sequence: John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture, 'Wagon Master' made after two big Indian-cavalry epics... It is a lovely poetic movie, full of romanticized reincarnation of the pioneer spirit... It didn't have to top the big ones that had preceded it...Photographically, it is extremely simple... The camera moves only once or twice in the entire film, and never when a director would have made it move to underline a shot... Ford even resists the temptation to track his camera in the breathtaking twilight shots of the women wearily marching along in the dust behind their wagons...

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. There is a whole village there and the villagers look exactly like the Mormons, except that they do not wear hats. This movie makes absolutely no sense and I really wanted it to be over. The only explanation I can think of is that one or two of the guys in the movie actually wrote the script (although how that could be worked out by the producers is beyond me). If this screenplay was actually written by a professional screenwriter/director it would certainly be better than this.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars! I really don't care what people can say badly about this movie...because it's a really well played parts from Samuel L. Jackson, and mainly by Christina Ricci!! I'm a big fan of hers, right since I saw her in Addams Family...been trying to watch all things she makes, and this is absolutely one of the best parts she played!! I love her looks (even though people say she's not pretty...I think she is...and I love her eyes)!!

I just watched this movie on it's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia. I liked (not loved) "Mork & Mindy" as a kid, mostly for Robin William's zany energetic performance. This movie made me remember why. Was the original show great? Not really, but Robin certainly was. Which brings me to this movie.I was pleasantly surprised, expecting nothing more than a paint by numbers chronological retelling of the show (which in a way it was). But, of course, the real focus was on Robin.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore . I 'm sure it pisses a few liberals off . It does not. The main problem the film has is, well it has nothing to do with anything that actually happened in real life. There were a number of major scientific and political events that occurred in the USA in the 90's , but none of them made any mention of Al Gore. There are two possible explanations for how this movie got made. Firstly it could have been planned to be a huge hit which would help make up for all of its shortcomings.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships, 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the spotlight on his own family, Block covers terrain that is off-limits for most filmmakers. He explores a common but often unspoken family dynamic and does so without resorting to hyperbole or sensationalism. In fact, the film is deceptively low key at the outset. In addition to providing a probing look at one family - and, by extension, every family - Block has also chronicled a very specific period in recent history. I don't know if this was intentional, but unavoidable due to archival content.Highly recommended.

SPOILERS AHEAD------------------------- Mel has got it going on. From the opening credits to the ending credits this movie has straight laughs. Dave Chappel shows why he is a comedic force. Cary Eewes carries the movie most of the time, but the supporting cast fills in strong when the plot is drawn away from Robin Hood. Right from the beginning this movie proclaims it's self not to be taken seriously. If you took a time machine and gave the characters thoughts of modern day antics you would get this movie.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying. In their escape, the bandits split up. The one thief who knows where the gold is hidden is killed before he is able to talk. Three men have a different part of the "clue" that will lead to the gold. Can the banker, the bandit, and the bounty hunter work together to locate the missing loot? Or, will they kill each other first? - The plot is an obvious take-off of Leone's The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome ; more bloodshed and very graphic details ( a bit too much for my own tastes ) . This is the movie that started me down a dark path of making films . And I am sorry it did.I know there are no spoilers , so I won't give away anything but I will say one thing: watch this movie or you will have a very bad trip . If you like Se7en , don't watch this . This is one of those movies where you just can't help but laugh, because the story is such a ridiculous one.The characters are completely unsympathetic!

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

The above summary really isn't meant as a slam against this film, as the series followed a very similar format. As usual, Simon Templar ("The Saint") meets a lady in distress and comes to her aid. He also comes to the aid of a police detective who was framed of accepting a bribe. Along the way, he meets some interesting supporting characters (this time, Paul Guilfoyle as "Pearly" Gates) and during his unraveling of this not especially compelling mystery (none of them really are), Templar is extremely erudite and just plain cool!

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film. I had just seen the MOOG doc, which was alright, the only problem was Moog led a very content life, and the doc was well... content. Haack's story is filled with all the marketable tragedy people buy into these days, but it carries a great deal of heart with it. Though the film doesn't go into the tragic stuff so much, one can sense that Bruce accepted the price of making music his way. There are so many elements that make up his legacy IE.

When this show first came on the air, I saw it once or twice and thought it was another "fat guy, skinny wife" show that seemed to populate the networks at the time. It was just "okay" upon initial viewings and I didn't watch it again; however, once it went into syndication, I caught several episodes (simply because it was on twice a night), and I'm telling you, the more you watch this show, the funnier it is. Once you see how all of the great supporting characters are connected, this show makes you laugh out loud.

Fata Morgana, the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog, filmed over several years in the late 1960s, is one of those rare DVDs that should be listened to with the commentary turned on. It is a visual feast of North African (mostly Saharan) imagery that is timeless. You simply could not tell that it was made over thirty-five years ago. The soundtrack to the film, including German classical music (Mozart and Handel), and rock music by Blind Faith and Leonard Cohen, also lends its timeless quality.

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * THE CELL / ( 2000 ) MELANIE O'HARA. Now that is a hard film! The first twenty minutes are like a bad horror/comedy, and then you get to the good part where we meet all the characters in their natural setting... And it doesn't really end well. I have no idea what was going on with the director, he's not an original storyteller and seems to be using people from his other films for his own purposes. What happened? My first viewing of this movie shocked the hell out of me.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. If you like you murders, to be signature and serial, and your cops to be British, and shout a lot, and the gore to be bloody and have a religious slant then this hits every button. Not quite enough 'gov'ing to put the shouting into the Sweeney's rarefied heights, but otherwise highly rated. Ken Stott is excellent as the 'cop on the edge' and the guest stars are also well cast, including Edward Woodward and Art Malik. Recommended.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom , which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the people, and put them to use for something else.The show started out good, then went downhill into the worst possible way.It had some good scenes and funny moments. However, it would take over 30 minutes of my life just to explain how awful this program was. There is no better way to make sure your family does not fall victim to pornography than to spend all of your free time watching TONIGHT & SUNDAYS. I can honestly say that this show is even worse than those two programs combined.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . It is a beautiful piece of animation. This movie is in 2 parts, The beginning and the middle. This film starts off with a dream sequence. A little girl falls asleep on her bed. As she sleeps, her parents call her name from behind. She wakes up to find herself in front of a large picture window. Inside there is an old fashioned clock that reads 9:00 AM. She calls out "9:00!

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit that I watched Spaceballs for the first time a decade or so later when I rewatched it in a theatre). However, I must say that this is a very different kind of film. I'm not a huge fan of the old Mel Brooks films nor do I really have any other fond memories of them. But after seeing The Producers I couldn't help but notice how many similarities were found between the story of the film and the plot of the film.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director René Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

Surprisingly good made for T.V . Thriller . I was n't expecting too much from this one but I 'm glad I did.. I don't know if anyone has seen this film yet or not, but I've always found it a bit disconcerting. I have read a few reviews praising it in the past as "good" or "exciting", which to me means that it isn't worth seeing unless you are really interested in what happens. It certainly doesn't feel like an interesting movie on the whole, though it is surprisingly good for T.V.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good:The camera work was absolutely phenomenal. Every shot is done beautifully.It was interesting seeing all the different animals that I could have never even imagined.David Attenborough has the perfect narrator's voice. No one could have done any better.The Bad:There were one or two different times where there was a reference to the Earth being 1 million years old ( I hold a different belief). Overall a TV series anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend buying it. 10/10 stars.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations , discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional and mental problems. But, that's the point. Why was I resisting it? I'm not gonna lie: I actually love this film. It has its moments. It is a very well-made film with terrific acting, especially by Mark Hamill in his role as Captain Kirk. You can see the affection he feels for William Shatner as well. There is even a little comedy in this film--though it seems to be done in a cheap way.

The philosophical, meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind. I'd give it 10 stars for that alone. That being said, though, what hit me with particular force was what I take, possibly incorrectly, to be its Art Direction. Many of the interior shots feature a rich concoction of color blends seemingly based on very understated Munsell Color Model progressions and complementary juxtapositions. This makes the movie probably unrealistic to contemporary eyes, but, to me, very beautiful as an aesthetic work in itself.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should , does so without sacrificing any of the action or suspense. However, there was one huge mistake that I think will take away from this film: The character development. I went into this film thinking it was going to be some really good sci fi flick. I ended up just hating it.The characters seemed like cardboard cutouts who didn't do anything but stand around doing nothing. There were lots of pointless dialogs which simply had no connection to what was going on.

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that's been released lately. It was funny, but it also had many touching moments. Zellwegger, Freeman, Rock, Kinnear, & the rest of the cast made their incredibly weird characters seem real. The story took such twist & turns that made it incredibly enjoyable to watch. If you're sick of the recent formula movies, see Nurse Betty for something completely different. Go see this movie in the theater or at least rent it when it comes out!

Do n't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit , crisp dialog or clever social commentary . This time it's about a man who has an affair with a woman and wants to end his marriage. After I finished watching "Jane Eyre", I couldn't help but think, why is anyone still seeing this movie?The plot of this movie takes place in England, circa 1700. The story revolves around two men, John and Richard, who have an affair. As their affair grows, John and Richard are constantly in conflict with each other.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years. As a boy, I enjoyed stories of mountain men and the wilderness. Books like "Call of the Wild", "White Fang", "The Frontiersman" and "My Side Of the Mountain", influenced me tremendously. I wanted so much to live like a mountain man, but nothing inspired me more to do so, than when I saw this movie on television in 1975. I wanted to be just like "Trapper".

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film ? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and a wonderful artist. It is very sad to see his name in all these bad reviews, especially since he was a huge star in his day. This movie is awful. The plot has nothing to do with science. It's not even about space.The special effects are laughable - the spaceship appears to float across the sky by sheer force of will, but no-one can see it.I am a huge Mel Brooks fan, and I think his movies are funny.

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

This is how I interpreted the movie: First things first. There was not a single scene in the movie where u see the bad guy (Taylor) torturing or nailing Ben's hands to the wall. However the same cannot be told of the gals. In the end too, u see Taylor disappear as he walks. Looks like the message there was "There was no Taylor". And the whole movie was a figment of imagination of Ben. Also, there was no scene during the torturing moments wherein any of the gals confront or are in the same frame as Ben.

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a man (and woman) who has been in prison for almost two decades, but also the surreal world we inhabit when it comes to the concept of reality itself. It is hard to say how much you actually know about this movie at any given moment, but it seems pretty safe to say that most people who have seen it would agree with me on that point. There is something so strangely beautiful about the camera work, the production values and the overall style of this odd film.

GREAT, Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen.. He acts it up, perfectly. This was like watching Robim Williams as he really was and is.. It almost made me cry watching him.I had no idea that Robin was as close a friend to John Belushi as he was. The portrayal of this relationship was very good and could almost stand on it's own merits.. Very sad, what both of them went through.I really felt for both Val and Robin during his rough times.

Very good `` Precoder '' starring Dick Barthelmess , which in a way , kind of reminded me of Hawks and his work. He plays the character "Barthelmess" (Dick's name) who makes it to the top, but is then thrown off course by some other people he met at an opera. I don't think this has any redeeming features. I would give it zero stars if I could.The acting is not only awful, but downright horrible. It goes from one terrible scene to the next without ever really settling into its tone or mood.

The "Hunting Trilogy" of Rabbit Fire (1951), Rabbit Seasoning (1952), and Duck! Rabbit! Duck! (1953) should be considered the comedic high water mark of the Chuck Jones-Michael Maltese collaboration. While they are seldom mentioned in lists of the "greatest" or "most important" cartoons in the history of animation, they are certainly THE FUNNIEST cartoons I've ever seen. Michael Maltese never got the credit that directors like Jones, Freleng or Avery got, but it's his dialogue and situations that make Warner Bros. cartoons, and these three in particular, some of the FUNNIEST ever made.

Maybe it's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel, or a fondness for things Egyptian (I grew up loving to visit the mummies in Boston's Museum of Fine Arts) but I think Maltin is a tad tough on this rather good film. The production values are great regarding color and cinematography, and it appears some effort went into historical authenticity (much of it from the novel, I'm sure). Purdom is admittedly a bit stiff in the lead role, but one can accept this as part of Sinuhe's character.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed . Very funny and the production quality is outstanding . It is not easy to watch, but if you can see past the bad acting, this is probably one of the most hilarious movies I have seen in a while. I was pretty disappointed when I saw this movie at the theater last night after hearing about it on IMDB , but I was pleasantly surprised when I finally got my hands on it today. The script is so good, it almost doesn't need to be read.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $ 300,000 of gold , along with a banker Clayton , who 's about to get arrested for the same offense. This movie has nothing in common with other movies made about this subject, as they all tend to fall into different genre categories.I like this film because it deals with the problems faced by those who make a living by using their money to influence the lives of others (i.e., politicians). However, I still can't see what the whole point of the movie is. Why would people want to donate so much money to these individuals?

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie . Amy Jo Johnson ( Susie Q ) is a great Actress , she is a good looking and beautiful Actress .I have watched many of Amy Jo Johnson's movies . So i just bought this movie, on impulse but i really wanted to like it..i liked the original film so much i couldn't be mad at this one. i saw the trailer and i thought it was nice, i'm pretty sure as a person who hasn't seen "Lincoln", i'll like this one a lot more.

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during the movie and I saw my name. I have to say I didn't really think it would be a hit , but boy was I wrong. This is one of those rare "dumb sitcoms" that is both funny and deep in its themes about the power of music. I don't know why everyone complains about this show. After watching for 20 minutes i'm starting to get it.The problem is that there is too much bad acting/writing.

Robert Altman, Nicolas Roeg, John-Luc Goddard--you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? These and other directors were obviously chosen because they have not followed the mainstream, but created it. For those that complain that they did not adhere to the original story of the opera--How often does the music in a film directly relate to what is going on in the film? It is the mood that counts. This is what I believe the directors of these movies were doing: creating a contemporary mood for old operas. For the most part they succeed wonderfully.

"Jaded" should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure unlike movies like "Indecent Behavior" or "Friend Of The Family". "Jaded" is not an easy watch as it's story is difficult to conceive and it's not that common in society. From the beginning of the movie, with the first scene, you expect more strong scenes. The raping scene wasn't (in my opinion) a well created scene. I think that the director didn't use proper camera techniques overall in the movie.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their `` Erasmus year '' in London and Berlin. The movie focuses on three people from different backgrounds - a German, a Japanese and a French - who make friends and become good friends over the course of their long visit. They also get caught up in other personal issues they are involved with while living there. There are some funny bits at times but most of the time I thought the movie was too short and lacked depth to justify what it offered (and I mean all its characters).

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old. I knew nothing of westerns then but recognized Ben Johnson from the movie "Mighty Joe Young." What attracted me to "Wagon Master" were the great songs sung by the "Sons of the Pioneers." Merian C. Cooper, who produced the movie, was the first to commission original music to fit the mood of a specific scene and so created the modern movie soundtrack. Cooper hired Max Steiner to create the mood for his classic creation King Kong.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments , Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air . The film follows two nurses who, after losing their patients, return to the rural town for a second chance at life. However, while the town gets some much needed help, one nurse's dreams come to a screeching halt. I didn't know anyone else could get so many wasted lines right on a film like this, but it seems as though I'm not alone. This film is filled with clichés that only make the film worse.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it! This movie has great suspense, great acting, very well done camera work (nice job Mr. Lieberman!) which makes a extremely well made slasher! Though low on gore for the 80s, it still has the effect on you after it is over. The opening kill (machete through the crotch) looked so real! And the fist to the mouth death left me stunned! Overall i give this lost classic 10 stars out of 10 stars!

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch . She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of a wealthy woman that had no problem taking advantage of the vulnerable young. Very disappointing! The plot is very vague, and the characters are too simplistic to get any sense out of. There are two main characters, and one supporting character (a prostitute), and each has their own personality. You don't get to know these two characters very well, or understand what makes them tick. As for the supporting characters, they have very little screen time - which makes them seem forced.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band 's 30 year career . Lee , Bobby and Gary were so well together that some of the more obscure or hard to get songs got their due credit in the show. The setlist had many classics from the era - I'm looking at you "You Gotta Believe Me" and "Somewhere, Somewhere". The audience was loud and interesting and really fun to listen to. I am an avid fan of Bob Dylan, having attended every concert he has played.

I love to see a female protagonist , in this movie her name was Rose . Rose brought out a lot of character, that I didn't think would have ever made it to the screen. I can't imagine how bad she must have felt having to kill people. I'm not exaggerating here, I'd say she had an orgasm every time she shot a person. She was so cool about it. It was great to see a movie like this on TV. I saw this yesterday on cable and it has to be one of my all time worst movies.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie . But at the earnest request of the reviewers, I watched it anyways. This movie is not very scary and if you have never read any of Stephen King's works you won't learn much about what is happening. This movie does a pretty good job of making you want to laugh, but that isn't really the point. The "gag" here is an odd one -- the kids are afraid of the creepy clowns, who scare them into doing something horrific.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight, he lives in this burned down old hotel, where eight teen convicts go to do some cleaning. Most of them die except for 3 of them. In my case it wasn't the best writing or the best ever. I still thought that the killing scenes were really well done. Like when the one girl go eaten by the hungry dogs. The best had to be when he shoved the cell phone down the Blonde Girl's mouth. Kane was a seriously great horror movie actor, he had this serious look the entire movie and it would never change.

I loved this movie! OH MY GOSH! This movie rocked so hard! I found it amongst some old tapes and didn't know what it was and after having read the back of the cover to see what the summer had to say about it (Which btw, mentioned the fact that Elton John covered the soundtrack for the film more times than it mentioned what the film was actually about. ), I thought it sounded interesting, and I was even more interested in seeing it because it was an older film. "What controversy?"

I had always heard about this great mini-series , but viewed it for the first time this week , July 11, 2006. I have to say I found it extremely disturbing.The storyline is so horrible, that I cannot put it into words. There is not a single character or scene in this show that has any merit at all.It starts off with a girl (the main female protagonist) talking about how hard life must be when she lives in a remote location with an alcoholic father and no money to buy food.

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! it is a great movie all the way through , even when you don't like the subject. this movie really makes you question yourself as a person, who would want to be so blind ? what can anyone know of another world ? if i was a vampire i'd go to hell for watching this ! they should make more films like this ! "The Last Vampire" might be the worst vampire film ever made! This movie is a complete rip off of Stephen King's novel.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me. I loved Orry and George's relationship so much. I was so enraptured in Orry and Madenline's love story. I am a hopeless romantic so it really got to me. I especially liked it when he first met her. I just wish he had more time with her and their baby. So you know in Book three I was so hurt that he died. I didn't really understand that because they had little time together. I just loved Patrick in this movie.

Our America is multi-cultural , with so many sub-cultures . This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time from the viewpoint of two people who do not belong anywhere near one another. This was an extremely boring and unfunny mess that failed to take advantage of its premise. While it certainly does have its moments, it also fails to move forward any further than what was established in the first three acts. The only reason I kept watching was out of morbid curiosity, which has never made me like a movie.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that . I got all the tapes ,the DVD,the dvd,and the blu ray and i was going to get this movie before any one else because it was my favourite action movie but then i found out there was no Dads Army at all. Then i went to youtube and took a look at the first 3 minutes and i saw "Dads Army 1". So i searched on youtube for Dads Army 1 until i finally found it. When i saw the name it made me want to just buy the DVD and rent it.

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight was magnificent in this role . You will be sorry you missed it.If you're a fan of movies like A Nightmare on Elm Street 2 and Halloween, you will be pleased by this one . I am not a horror movie fan but this was quite enjoyable. The acting was very good; the effects were pretty impressive as well. It's not a long film but it was really scary when it hit home.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game . This is the number one best TH game in my opinion, and if I'm gonna call this "good", then at least it'll be something I won't forget about anytime soon! This is like playing the first game in a series. The same people that made Bionic Commando have been working on this for the better part of two decades with absolutely no improvement. The story is very similar to B2, and the graphics are basically the same. It takes you back to the good ol' Days before video games.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.

I saw the Messiah : - The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes on TV at the time, even though it was shot a long way away. The show was very good, with great acting and wonderful camerawork, which gave the programme an air of authenticity and respectability that didn't exist before. However, there were two major problems. The problem with this show is that it's extremely shallow and predictable. They don't seem to know who the main characters are or what they are fighting for.

Robin Hood; Men in Tights is worth watching, I recently watched it because I've just become a Cary Elwes fan, and this is one of of his lead-roles. Some moments really made me crack up so hard! I didn't expect them you know, it was so funny, Even the 2nd time around you'd still fall off your chair The cast is great, of course especially Robin of Locksley himself,Cary, but Blinkin and the Sheriff and Little John (Don't let the name fool you, it's veryy big!

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me it's like some kind of "B-movie" that could be made today for $10 million or so. It starts out slow and slowly builds on itself, but doesn't really come to a head until about an hour into the show. If you think that's a bad thing, try looking at the credits. Most of them say "Written and Directed by Gary Moore". This show has no personality at all.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old . I knew nothing about it, other than what I could find in my family's old movies, so I sat through the first 10 minutes because that's all I did then. I don't recall ever being able to sit through 20 minutes at a time. It just didn't seem possible to me. Then, I thought about it for two months and finally decided I must be wrong. This film is absolutely awful.The story is very boring. Every character is forced to do whatever the plot requires.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule. And amazingly I found it really original. I have commented on other Colombian films before, and I agree that Colombian movies tend to have a similar scheme, and always try to make reference to the average vulgar people,especially trying to make jokes out of the continuous cursing. But let's face it, the language used in this film is not especially exaggerated. Unfortunately, this is how real people speak.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe that they can see a bit more of the bigger picture in the movie . And if you can't get past that, I'd suggest not to even bother watching the movie at all. If you want to enjoy this story then just give it a chance and find out where it went wrong . The movie is basically an attempt by the director/screenwriter to tell his fans that he's got the whole thing wrapped up in a nice bow and has them ready to jump in and enjoy the fun .

See No Evil With Kane . The Movie Has a great storyline But it just was n't a Hide my face movie... I really didn't think I would have to write a review about a movie with no dialogue. After all, the only real good movie I can think of that doesn't have any dialogue is "Kane" (and yes, there were other movies that weren't as good as "Kane" or had more dialogue.) However, here I will say that this film is a total mess.

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (I think) being the first to admit that it was "not as good as TV" but she also said that it had some nice stories. The characters were intriguing and well acted. I am a huge fan of this show. My brother and I grew up seeing it every summer when it was going to air on Channel 8. We have not seen it since we moved out of the state and haven't heard from anyone who still watches it.

I'm seen this documentary in its feature-form, in a movie theatre. And... wouah! The pictures are astonishing, one really wonder how by Jove did they manage to film those waves, those animals, those... is that a plant ? a predator ? a creature from the movie Abbyss ? Anyway, it's remarkable. Sure we've seen a lot of such documentary on TV, with weird animals and so on, but none with such a beauty, a precision, a deep emotion. The only downside is the commentary.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper, which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines tense dramatic moments, with very funny characters and situations, to give the film the right balance and feel. The comedy of the film occurs naturally, and the laughs haven't been set up too elaborately & haven't been too worked at. It really is very funny, thanks to the fact that each character in the movie is excellently cast, and that each actor/actress recognises and can relate to the Aussie humor. They portray it very well and very realistically.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim ( Richard Barthelmess ) who has one bad flight in a row. He finds out that he's on his last legs when he decides to fly home. I love this film, it is by far the most entertaining I have ever seen. If anything I am disappointed at how little screen time there is for Jack Nicholson as he was much more interesting in this film. Michael Douglas does an incredible job as the leader of the air force, well worth watching.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost '') as an electrical engineer working at a radio station. The show was popular in its time, but has lost steam with viewers since it began. For some reason this movie wasn't released to the public. I've heard it referred to as a horror movie for some unknown reason. Well, it isn't any horror movie, and I can say with complete confidence that this is absolutely not one of those. There is nothing scary about it whatsoever.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar, which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything, and the movie was by far the highlight of the evening. The technical elements were well meshed and it was obvious that Duncan Rogers had chosen his designers and crew well. But it was the story and it's delivery that truly made this short shine. Duncan Rogers' tight script was just what this evening of "shorts" needed. It neither meandered, as several offerings did, or preached to us. The Reader was simple story telling in it's best form, well cast by Rogers and beautifully acted.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there was one more film that gave me chills and made me think I had seen the greatest of all time. It was actually only about 5 minutes long so I guess it's not too bad but I never thought it would make it onto this list!The film is called "A New Hope". To tell you the truth, it might just be my first film. But as I grew up, I felt that Star Wars was the greatest movie ever made.

In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

This is how I interpreted the movie : First things first . There was not a single scene in the movie which made any sense to me. Why didn't somebody have the audacity to create an entire new genre from scratch, then take a shot at it and try to make it fun ? It seemed too contrived for my taste. And that's about all. The main characters were either moronic or very unimportant. Some of them had such a low-class air that if they spoke in their own voice, nobody would ever remember them.

Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a handsome man. I first heard of this movie over ten years ago when I rented it from a copycat rental shop in LA. At the time I wasn't much of a film fan, so I didn't think too highly of it. In fact, as an adult (and living in New York City at the time), I couldn't stand it. There was nothing interesting about it, but it certainly had its moments.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm , wit , and charm . At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gets her first television role on the hit TV series. The only catch was she was too stupid to be on the show, so when she did appear (in this case in an episode called "The Other Woman") it was for the same character as the real Lorelai: Emily. I don't know if you've ever heard of this, but it must have been around at some point in history.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd expect from a music video. But it isn't really like that. The music and acting in this would seem to be coming from a different place, which would explain how they managed to make it work. This is an entertaining (for a horror film) but poorly-edited documentary on the life of legendary rock singer "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band." It's hard not to smile as the camera crew follows the musician throughout the day, every time he looks at the camera.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year. It was a truly moving experience. I had heard of the Truth and Reconcilliation process, but as others have written, did not know much about the details of the process. This film demonstrated the process and the growth that can occur when people are able to face up to their pasts, understand the events from the points of view of others involved, and grieve together. Archbishop Tutu and the others involved in developing the T & R process deserve recognition for their understanding of human emotions.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this . I have no idea and i can't believe that they're still going with this crap. My parents were absolutely horrified to see this movie in a rental store. I saw it at the theater and it was so far above average that I forgot all about it until I got home late at night. The only good thing about this movie is that you don't need much imagination to make it funny. And there was a LOT of laughter in this one.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class . The musicianship of this band is incredible and these guys should be in every rock concert hall.I am so glad I got my copy of this book, it is now one of my favorites! I have always been a big fan of Neil Young's songs but I've never really understood the fascination he has with him. He is a very funny guy who doesn't give a damn about music, or what you think he is. He just likes to make people laugh.

I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of my movie. In fact, many of them seemed to be making a point about how awful it was because they didn't want to see it. (If you don't believe me, watch the film yourself, and judge for yourself.) I'm so tired of seeing what has to be the least intelligent comments posted in every review I've ever read at IMDb. "It's horrible," "This is terrible!" "Oh my god, that sucks!"

Blue Planet ... Wow ... Where do I begin ? The years of hard work paid off in what is surely the best special effects movie ever. As a child I was enthralled with the amazing sets, the action sequences and the incredible creature designs. So when I finally watched this movie it took me by surprise. There was almost nothing in the movie to make me believe it was actually happening, and the entire plot seems so contrived and nonsensical that there is no way I should be able to sit through another half an hour of this.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny (and fun) puns. The first shot we see in here is an island prison with the following written above its big gates: "Alka-Fizz Prison - No Noose Is Good Noose." Inside the prison, the first sign we see is "Welcome: have a seat." They then show an electric chair.Corny gives way to clever, however, as our favorite wolf is seen behind bars. With pen in hand, he literally draws a door next to him and then escapes through it!

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Artistic Values such as Love and Beauty to more modern interpretations that deal with issues of race, politics, family, and the war. I read this movie when I was about ten. It was a horror movie, but I don't think it could have been considered an 'horror'. It was a story of survival. The only thing that really killed me during the film was the lack of any suspense at all. In my opinion, there is no good explanation for why these people survived.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a cynical attempt to justify the actions of the Canadian government that resulted in the deaths of thousands of innocent people. The truth is not in these documents, but it does give us an idea of where they came from. This review is going to be a little harsh because I didn't want to like this movie, but it was so bad...I could hardly stand it. I'm talking about the fact that it's hard to see anything positive or important happen in it.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just something which was not unique. it was a series and i even did not know someone in it. later on, i realized that edward hermann is part of the cast of overboard (a movie, i absolutely adore). i had to watch it once with a friend and never stopped since. it's just fun. you have the feeling that it is okay to have sex before being married and it's okay to be a coffee junkie and to eat unhealthy stuff all the time.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be very scary. I watched the entire thing because I thought, "What's with this stupid shit? This will make me laugh more than anything," but instead I got so scared and sickened by it that I couldn't help myself from crying like a baby. It was one of the worst films I have ever seen and definitely the WORST film ever made. In the mid-'70s Hollywood was in the midst of a boom as they began to make some of the best films in the history of cinema.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of men and women in our society, and it takes aim at them. This leads to some really interesting and well thought-out comments that are a real breath of fresh air on many topics. I like American Horror Story and enjoy watching it but I'm not sure why. The movie starts off so well, but then it turns out the writers just didn't know any better. I was really expecting something truly shocking or shocking for the sake of shocking.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

Wagon Master ( 1950 ) Dir : John Ford Production : Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings us a tale of two wagons on a long journey to the North American wilderness, and he makes one thing abundantly clear. His characters are nothing more than caricatures. I am not sure who was supposed to be angry at him, but neither do I understand why the film was made in the first place. "Paint This Town Black" is just another example of the low budget exploitation films that we have become so used to these past years.

It came before `` the ten commandments '' `` land of the Pharaohs '' `` Ben Hur '' and it was called `` The Story of Noah '' because it had a lot of religious overtones. However, in this one we actually get to hear the story of Noah's Ark. And there are some really cool effects on this film that I can't take credit for. Most of these effects you'd have to pay $200 for to make yourself believe. But I think they were quite effective. This may be the most pathetic film I have seen in a long time.

In "Black Snake Moan," writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me felt like dismissing the entire film as pretentious--a sweltering Southern parable with some oh-so-risky subject matter. The movie also contains a heavy spiritual subtext where religion is being hauled into the picture--again, this is integrated without subtlety. After the darker opening scenes, the film increasingly blunts its edge until the entire production comes off with the artificial quality of a stage play (and I'll admit, the last 15 minutes go way too far into "Happy Ending" territory for my liking).

Just see it ! It 's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time . See it from beginning to end ! I have been looking forward to this movie for about 2 days. This is NOT one of those "what should I watch on cable TV?" movies where you get a show or movie and then go home and watch it again. THIS IS THE BEST MOVIE OF THE WEEK EVER. Why? Because it's just plain good. I don't even know why I went into this movie with expectations. It seemed like it had the potential to suck.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school team, after his father is accused of committing suicide. Unfortunately it gets worse. When I first saw the film (in theaters), I fell in love immediately. This is one of those movies that will make you want to go see it again and again. It's a wonderful blend of melodramatic suspense thriller and dark comedy. I found this movie so funny, as I never thought I'd find anything so hilarious in a horror film.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie. They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine. In particular, the way Candice pronounces the words "Puerto Rican" is very funny, as she is being kind as she can be but condescending at the same time. I had seen the original of this movie, called "Old Acquaintance", starring Bette Davis and Miriam Hopkins. They allegedly did not get along, so because the movie is about female friendship, that might have been a problem. Here, the actresses clearly admire and respect each other.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through. It has a great ensemble of characters, an origional plot, and an ending I shoulda seen coming but didn't and pulls at your heart strings.If theres any one thing about this movie that got me the most it was Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock's interaction. These two are great and it warms my heart to see Rock isn't going to do crappy Big Hollywood fare like Lethal Weapon 4 for the rest of his life. Freeman is as always the man, really there shouldnt be any need to critique his work anymore.

I 'm a fan of independent film . Dialogue driven , character study pieces are where it 's at for me. This film had the potential to be excellent. Unfortunately, there was so much going on I couldn't care anymore about anything other than my own misery.The whole film seemed to revolve around two very different men (one male and one female) who get separated in a war. The woman finds herself living with her father and is taken into custody by the government. There are a few scenes of her talking to her daughter and trying to figure out what is wrong.

The Killing Yard is a great film, although uneven at times. Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort as a mentally wounded and judicially jilted prison inmate, and the presence of Alan Alda as his defense attorney is none other than genius. The emotion and raw reality portrayed in this film's "flashback" scenes have the ability of putting viewers directly into the midst of the events being pictured. I was not even born when the Attica riot took place, however, through extensive research, I find that "The Killing Yard" does the story all of it's fair justices.

'The Cell ' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally . The film begins with a man named Raul (Juan Carlos Carrión) who is being pursued by the police for sexual deviancy after he kills his wife and then rapes her corpse. He's not too keen on letting the authorities track him down either as there are some very nasty men in the neighbourhood. If you're thinking of buying this movie, watch out. You may get to see the worst possible version of "The Cell" ever made!

This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I thought it would be a teen soap, you know, who's dating who, that kind of thing. But it was not. It is surprisingly deep. It is also very witty. It moves at a very fast pace, and there are more and more jokes you catch every time you watch it. It is a comedy-drama, which is rare when well done. It is about Rory and Lorelai's relationship.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

I'm certain that people from USA don't know anything about the rest of the world, but I think they mustn't talk about what they don't know. And they must remember that the rest of the world is not as hypocrite as the USA. The only places where consented sex between teenagers are illegal are the USA and Islamic nations. In France, for instance, the age of consent is 15. In Brazil it's 14. In Spain it's 12. So the teenagers actors, 16 and 17 years old by the time of production, aren't doing anything illegal.

Believe it or not, the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once, and was missing for nearly two years. In 1911, Leonardo da Vinci's 'La Gioconda' (better known as the Mona Lisa) was taken from the Louvre by a petty thief (and former Louvre employee) who allegedly sought to return the world's most famous piece of art to its native Italy. His actions after the theft make it seem more likely that he intended to sell the painting for his personal profit. (Of course, he had no hope of finding a buyer.)

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is blue . The film doesn't make much sense.It's all there . I just found myself thinking about it more and more. There are a LOT of things I'm missing here. This is the kind of movie you watch because you want to, not because you actually HAVE to! It's a little bit weird but at the same time it's kinda hilarious. Unfortunately, I didn't enjoy it much either. Maybe it's because I was a little too self-involved with the characters.

I have been a "huge" rush fan ever since "moving pictures" and this concert is simply and example to everyone who is a fan why Rush is so popular. They completely admitted to playing their biggest concert yet, and, despite the rain in a soccer arena, they still manage to give an outstanding performance from start to finish. A real example of this is during "yyz" the entire crowd start to sing along to it in a real classic manner, in perfect sinc. They really play all of everyone's favorite songs with a real powerful "lust" that rarely happens anymore.

I'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things. However, SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work. The story, acting, filming, psychological themes, erotic quality and spiritual understanding are all really quite complex and compelling. Rose plays the complexities and shifts of a psychologically disturbed woman really quite accurately. My partner was particularly impressed with the sophisticated way the power exchange issues were handled. It was so intense for us to watch that we found ourselves leaving it three quarters through to "get tea" and I felt compelled to have a shower.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store where i used to hang out with people who were good at movies and i tried to convince them that this movie was worth watching because i knew how much i would love it but they just wouldn't believe me and now i find myself wondering why the hell am i even bothering to try to get my money back from this movie which i paid for . It is just not worth it . If you have kids, make sure to check this one out.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies, this Lone Star oldie is a good one. What more could you ask for than Duke, Yak, and Gabby. Lots of good ridin' and shootin'!!! I found it amazing that Duke's singing voice was Bill Bradbury, who is none other than Bob Steele's twin brother. It has been reported that Bob Steele was a high school classmate and friend of Duke, so twin brother Bill may have been too. Anyway, if you like good, clean, early western movies don't miss this one.

North and South is a miniseries from the `` golden age '' of television miniseries in the 1980s , which I believe is not an accurate statement.In this show there is absolutely nothing to suggest that these characters or situations are relatable to our world. A friend of mine was at a party last night with her husband and two children. The TV was on, so she could watch what was going on during the party. But instead of being interested in what was actually happening, she started talking about the news. About how it was a bad movie. A terrible movie.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways . It is a non stop plethora of emotion and suspense . There has to be a reason this movie took so long to come out on the market . I think the director was trying to cover his tracks but failed miserably as he did not try hard enough to make every character feel real . I felt sorry for the characters because they were just plain flat. The plot was weak and uninteresting . The first thing that struck me about this movie, was the sheer amount of money it takes to put something like this together.

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just a bunch of stupid teenagers making stupid jokes and this time i felt bad. There was no drama whatsoever. I really, REALLY wanted to like this film, but unfortunately I cannot. This is one of those films that will make you think "why? Why do they do such terrible things", but that's not really the case. If you can't see past the acting, plot and/or theme here then you probably shouldn't be watching these types of movies in the first place.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good : The camera work was absolutely phenomenal . I had so much fun with this movie.The Worst : I wish they had gone with a different style of film. It would have improved the movie. There's one thing that you should know about this movie. It is based on a true story. And to add insult to injury, the lead actor plays his part in the movie as an ex-convict who has been given a reduced sentence by the justice system after he gets caught breaking into another home through a broken window.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars ' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. I know, it is not really a 'movie' but that does not make the film any less enjoyable.The story takes place on an old west ranch where a few men try to get revenge for the death of their buddy in a cattle mutilate incident. My wife and I went to see this movie again recently. It was great. We had been to see several other films on our own which were either mediocre or just terrible.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice. I think it's a better film, because there isn't an endless amount of plot and it doesn't show every bit of the action. You have some interesting sequences, but nothing truly exciting. I remember when I saw this movie at a video rental store in my neighborhood, as a kid. The cover had a really cute little bunny girl on it, looking like a Disney princess. I bought this movie thinking it would be just another "girl with her eyes closed" story.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. This low-key Western is unusual for Ford in that it lacks any big stars. Johnson gets top-billing but his is basically a supporting role, although he and Carey work well together. Dru is given little to do other than provide the love interest. The best performance is given by Ford favorite Bond, playing the leader of the Mormons. In fact, this role helped him land a starring role in the long-running TV Western "Wagon Train" before his untimely death at age 57.

Okay I marked this spoiler so do n't be upset when I wrap this up . Now I went into this expecting some good suspense and an intriguing mystery, but what a disappointment, the movie does not give any of that. The main problem is the lack of a plot which will make the film very difficult to follow. As I am sure most of you are aware, the movie was shot on location in Ireland. What made me feel sorry for the Irish is that they did not get to use any of the awesome footage from the set!

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I would have to say that it had a lot of potential. The story was well told and the acting was excellent. However, as soon as the credits started rolling there was an immediate disconnect with reality. This may be the scariest movie I ever saw. It starts out pretty decent but then becomes a complete mess. It begins when we are informed that the world has been overrun by some sort of horrific creatures.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. This film is awful and one of the worst movies to be released in any theater in history. I am an old school horror fan but even I felt sick when I was shown this film. The special effects are not worth the money and the plot is unimpressive. There isn't a single creepy or disturbing moment in this film and you could tell they were going for a low-budget production, but unfortunately that doesn't make this movie much good.

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought it thinking it would be a "horror" flick. I was wrong on both counts. This film starts out with an unknown man going to his friend's place to talk about his girlfriend being murdered. She turns out to be none other than Akhenaton. I read this review of this movie by someone else, which is totally understandable, as I am the sort of person that likes to have my opinions made available to people before they make their purchase decision.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social commentary.It might have been my fault, but I actually enjoyed this film quite a lot. The pacing was too slow, the action scenes lacked much in the way of punch, and most of the dialogs were either too generic or uninteresting to be entertaining. One thing you never see on this planet is a film called 'Dangerous Liaisons' being made! I mean come on, if such a film even exists that's so bad...well I guess we will just have to endure it forever!

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

In dramatising Wilde 's novel , John Osborne has condensed events , eliminated a number of characters , and generally added nothing to what is essentially an historical novel. If you can't find a better film version of this story, you simply don't know what's really going on.The plot is as bad as the book, and there is nothing here to enhance the original story--just rehashing some parts of it with little improvement. The main character is just a big fat jerk who gets everything he wants by any means necessary. A few things need to be said.

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis. It is definitely not a horror film as such, just a beautiful tale of a cat trying to find its way back into the sunlight. There's not even any gore whatsoever! This is probably one of the silliest horror films ever made, and you have to wonder why it became so popular. For starters, there is absolutely no story. This is about a young man whose mother has mysteriously passed away.

In Mississippi , the former blues man Lazarus ( Samuel L. Jackson ) is in crisis , missing his wife and one of his children . He has a dark secret, though, that only he knows - he is the son of a witch who casts spells on those who dare to cross her path . I've heard some really bad movies this summer, and this one is one of them. I haven't seen it, but if you think you'll be able to enjoy it at least somewhat, please don't.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall! As an archivist re: the Music Hall..I know what is and what is not associated with the New York venue. The film's Theodore is just the "Music Hall." No Rockettes are in the film. Only wonderful ice skaters plus superb actors and fun. Just thought you would like to know. Truly a wonderful film. You will never guess who the 'murderer' is while watching this film....till the very end. What a superb plot and beautiful ice skating.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails . Because it was a little picture , John Ford didn't have to write a new script every time he needed to change the setting of his action movies ; instead he could simply let the actors be creative. This film has everything that is wrong about modern Hollywood filmmaking. It tries to make you care about an individual rather than an ensemble of characters, it tries to use the audience's attention to create dramatic tension instead of allowing it to unfold organically. It tries to do both (or at least tries to).

Although dated , this film is definitely worth a watch . I saw it about eight times as a teenager. It wasn't a particularly memorable film for me as I didn't love it then and am still trying to remember what I thought of it at the time . I think this might be the worst film I have seen, ever. I mean that in the best way possible. This movie is so boring and uninteresting. If there is a redeeming feature, it may be that it does have some amusing scenes, but aside from that, there is absolutely no plot or reason to watch this trash.

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters. This movie should have been included on the list but was not. If you are a fan of Wes Craven films then go ahead and watch this movie. If you are just here to hate on this movie then feel free to walk out as soon as possible. I'll be blunt with you: I didn't enjoy this movie. There were too many characters and plots that were unnecessary, and the movie was very slow paced and tedious.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are planning to settle down, only to discover that the other horse traders are having a baby. It doesn't go as planned - the baby gets killed by one of these horse traders and his family, and they run off to get themselves killed again! This film was bad. I really did not like the script. Not only is the acting horrendous, the dialogue was also incredibly unenjoyable and repetitive. As a result, the film made me want to throw up.

I do n't usually like to see movies while they 're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but this movie was NOT worth the $6 I spent at the theater. The characters were so awful and the plot was not even remotely interesting. This kind of thing only happens in other low-budget action flicks where the hero just "knows what to do" and it works out OK. In this flick, the hero can't seem to get into a fight with anyone (and he never has) and his friends are constantly being shot at by bad guys.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Hilary Swank stars as a South African exile who returns to her home town as a lawyer representing Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofer), a member of the South African parliament who was tortured by a prison guard, Pete Muller (Ian Roberts), who is seeking to escape prison by testifying before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. They could certainly have found an actress who has or could imitate a South African accent; Ms. Swank makes no attempt whatsoever to cover her unmistakably American accent.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with "Valley of the Kings." These movies helped inspire a lifelong interest in Egyptology. (In 1975 I visited Egypt!) Seen today, "The Egyptian" suffers from flat dialog and a few gauche touches, but it's a glorious movie to look at -- the sort of thing Hollywood, alas, just doesn't do anymore -- and it has a great story... not just the usual boy-meets-girl or vengeance-is-mine affair. Too bad 20th won't re-issue restored prints of this to be seen on the Big Screen.

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show at some point and i just cant get over how good it is ! every time i go to my local flea market they are selling this show all day ! its like if you got someone that can sing a really loud song for a couple of minutes and then play it again for 5 minutes ! it's like having your friend who doesn't know how to play the guitar come on stage and playing for 30 minutes .

I don't think I have ever seen a better movie parody. Mel Brooks is insane. EVERY time I watch it I find something new and it makes it even more funny than the time before. Cary Elwes is perfect for the role of Robin Hood. It has a great and unexpected ending that leaves you cracking up. Every character is great from Little John and Will to Maid Marian and Broomhilde. I laughed the whole way through and will never get tired of it. Watch it! !If you liked Cary Elwes in this Movie, you must definitely see The Princess Bride.

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie . Is hilarious and very entertaining. You have to watch the entire movie. After watching this movie, you'll be amazed at how little effort it took! This was by no means a bad movie in terms of acting, writing, script, editing, etc. If you like stupid movies that are cheesy, then this should be one of your favorite. The problem with this film is that it falls short of being "cheesy" when it comes to story or acting.

-it has Carla Gugino * yay * and a crappy ending * boo * - '' Jaded '' is a bad movie. I don't care that it was made in 1981. It is poorly written, poorly acted, lacks any real emotional depth or character development, and has absolutely nothing to recommend it beyond an extremely cheesy ending.The film starts as the protagonist, "Joe", stumbles home one night, and is greeted at the door by his mother, who asks if he wants her husband to help him out. He's not interested, because of course she doesn't have time to do that.

I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area, and it was quite clear that most people didn't get the movie. Even if you don't, it's a good movie with some interesting character development. It is a thoroughly human story about some very imperfect people in a backwoods southern town, and really speaks to the root of the blues. If you don't know what the "Black Snake Moan" is by the time you leave the theater, you didn't get it. And no.. it's not just a song.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old. I loved it then and still do. The ensemble cast is great - in those days the actors acted "naturally" and you "felt" for them in the respective roles. A "glossy" film of the period -the relationships therein still relevant to today's world but now the sexes are on the same level, women would not or should not allow the type of treatment displayed in the past. The soundtrack music is wonderful and it is a delight that Film Score Monthly released the CD in January, 2005.

Fantastic documentary . A movie within a movie . I 'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother 's death. It is one of the best made movies I have seen.
