If you are an ex-pat, this movie might be for you. This movie may have been terrible, but it's got some very interesting and intriguing ideas. One idea is that there are many versions of God , and not all are created equal. Another idea is that every life form has a part to play in the creation process. I bought this movie for $6.50.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! As an archivist and a music collector, I felt compelled to watch this piece of garbage. I did it for one simple reason: there were four tracks listed on the VHS box set, two of which I didn't even bother to listen to. It's hard to find something bad about this film - it does have its moments, like when they say "I've seen every movie in the history of cinema", but most of the time it just makes you want to skip it.

I played Sam ( the porter , Lou 's sidekick ) in the Film `` Dead Rail '' Which later made it to TV as ``Dead Man's Crossing '' The main star was a great guy named Richard Dreyfuss . I liked him on TV. I am surprised that there is so much controversy over the matter of "Dead Man's Cross" making it onto the big screens. Well, I'll tell you why. At one point in the show, a couple of dead railroad workers are killed trying to steal money from a bank.

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's masterpiece. But it is hardly the master work it pretends itself to be. The first half is good enough for one who wants to enjoy this film, but by the time you reach the finale, it becomes completely tiresome. It's as if the producers never bothered to finish the screenplay; the only reason that it makes it to TV screen is because they want to put a big grin on the faces of their employees.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright , Wagon Master was one of Ford 's favorite films to make. And for those of you who never saw it before, here is a brief summary. It stars Bruce Lee as a Chinese policeman who must protect an American woman from a group of Chinese thugs. The film was directed by Frank Darabont , who was known for such classic Westerns as The Big Red One and Texas Chainsaw Massacre . You've heard of this movie? I think you've seen it...but I didn't know that!

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and making a movie that gets funnier each time you watch it.The first time I saw this, I cried from laughing so hard. Everything about it is funny.While "Robin Hood: Men In Tights" is not my favorite comedy (that spot is taken by "Real Genius"), it ranks way up there in my book. So go see it! If you don't spend the whole time laughing, then at least you'll spend the whole time drooling over Cary Elwes.

I ca n't comment on the accuracy of this production , historical or literary , but I can say that I did watch it and like it, although I have to admit that there are some flaws in what I saw. First of all, I am not a history buff as I don't know enough to make an educated judgment about anything going back to the Middle Ages. On top of that, most of the books are written by people who were born in the 1800s. I guess we should be thankful for these "historians" as they try their best to put things into perspective.

This was on odd film . I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. It is too dark, too long for a kids film and not very funny . I loved the movie "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood." This one takes the family back to the old days when they lived in Chicago. If you haven't seen it, that's fine. But I didn't realize that it was such a rehash of the original. Not just because of the similar theme (a boy finds a stuffed bear), but also because there were so many similarities.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare, but Fata Morgana is a good case. You can chalk up the large subject to the ambitions of youth, but Herzog does an amazingly good job. The movie's point is to show human beings, and even the world, from a non-human point of view.The movie is in three parts: Creation, Paradise, and The Golden Age. The imagery of each is in counterpoint to the voice-over. Although the text of `The Creation' (from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan myth) refers to the primordial wasteland, the scene goes no further in illustrating the myth.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Sydney. The plot focuses on the plight of a young would-be crim who's life is in danger after botching a job for his future boss. Very well acted by Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown. The plot is fairly believable with some very humorous moments in one scene which revolves around a bank heist. The setting-up of various themes central to the story is quite well done. Eg. When one crim is searching for bullets for his gun.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan, I really loved this film (although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired!) and agree with many of the comments, that certain areas of her life were absent or not touched on. Whatever - it leaves your curiosity well and truly unsatisfied, so off I went to discover more. I must recommend a book by Ray Coleman - Carpenters - The Untold Story. The book is an intelligent read and unlike the film, is 'real' and down to earth. I hope you enjoy it. I remember Cynthia Gibb from her days in Fame and Gypsy.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin 's short 'Chess Fever ' , a mad tale about a man whose girlfriend and daughter (played by Kate Millett and Marlee Matlin ) move into an apartment owned by his father, a Russian mob boss.The two soon run into problems when it becomes apparent that one of the tenants is actually a spy. I can't believe no one ever saw this movie before, or maybe I just never got around to watching it. The story starts out as a straight-forward detective film, then quickly veers off into the realm of parody.

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story, where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, and Richard makes an impromptu decision to have Karen sing for the owner of the studio.Richard picks the wrong key for Karen to sing in, so Karen is singing above her natural range. You can see a look of bemusement on the owner's face; he figures she really can't sing. Richard quickly realizes his mistake and tries again in a different key. The next thing you hear is Karen's amazing, beautiful voice, and the owner does a priceless double take.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape , they encounter some people on the road who offer them a ride. The driver has a gun and threatens to shoot if the passengers don't stop. Two of them agree to have the driver kill the other two, while the others get out and go after the robbers. If you are looking for a movie where the plot goes all over the damn place, then look no further. This movie is full of clichés and stupid dialog.

Hmm , is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar 's post Saved By The Bell acting ? In both cases, you are watching one of the biggest stars in the country do something extremely difficult. It's like trying to put up with someone who smokes cigars every day and does not drink coffee ! I can't understand why she did this movie...
Well, I'll just get out my own opinion on this film.I felt that some of the dialogue was quite funny and some of the humor was kind of silly; however, I felt very sorry for Tim Allen's character.

If there 's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other , It 's surely this one . It is simply incredible what can happen when a TV series turns into a big blockbuster film. Hollywood churns out endless numbers of bad movies every day and it's time for India to take its share of the responsibility for this. I have watched quite a few Hollywood movies but I was always struck by how unoriginal they were. I was especially annoyed by the low quality acting in most of them. This movie could've been a fine film if it had been made by an Indian company.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / didn't understand this wonderful film. What a sad life he must lead!This movie has more to say about life and relationships than most I've ever seen, yet it's not dark or preachy like the "ordinary people" type of film. It is mostly humorous, though not technically a comedy.The whole thing feels a little like a fantasy, perhaps Shakespear's "Midsummer Nights' Dream." Beautiful, intelligent women abound, with wonderful cinematography and a non-insulting screenplay that doesn't miss a beat.I look forward to seeing it every time this film is re-run on cable.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen in quite some time. What a waste of a wonderful script. This film should have been so much better, considering the quality of the writer and director. The dialogue is terrible, the actors lack charisma, the special effects were not that good, the photography was horrible, etc. Don't buy tickets to see this film unless you can be reasonably certain that no other movie of similar genre would be any better.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound effect on me. I couldn't believe it was made back in 1989 at the height of the hippies, and I think it was even more important then than today. I would have loved to see what happened to the young boys in that film. They don't look like they were around 14 or so! This film is absolutely awful. The plot is completely ridiculous, which makes it even more terrible.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western, given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social history into its plot. Lead by Mario Van Peebles, who does OK, the gang of misfits on the run from Billy Zane's (seemingly unstoppable) army bigwig all acquit themselves well, their adventures plausible yet fun and exciting. There're some nice moody flashback scenes setting up the hero's character and backstory, a good shoot-out ending as our heroes defend the town from greedy white landgrabbers, and even Stephen Baldwin isn't bad in this enjoyable, quite powerful western.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend. It was a fun romp with some cool music. Kristine was on the Playboy cover, and the centerfold, as I recall. She's really cute and perky and has lots of charm. The movie made me want to see more of her and so I kept a look out for her in other stuff. She's in Steven Spielberg's "I Wanna Hold Your Hand" and Barbara Streisand's "The Main Event" and Bill Murray's "Meatballs", plus lots of TV shows like Night Court and TV movies.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . The main character is a white kid and his girlfriend is black. Both are from a single parent home which has just been destroyed by a couple who left it to him when he was little. It's a beautiful, moving film with great music, good special effects and interesting plot points. I didn't understand the whole story for about 90 minutes at first. As time went on I became more intrigued and decided to check it out. And what a surprise!

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

i love this show ! it is amazing ... i can never miss an episode even if i 've already seen it ! it is one of the best shows ive ever seen in my life !... and its the only show in which i like to watch every night ! The opening scene of this series makes me want to curl up with a few beers, while reading a book. It's almost unbearable! That's about all I can say, as I'm still sitting here trying to process the ridiculousness of what was just shown.

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated. The cast is all pretty, and each one does a good impression of the character he plays. But the movie was too bad for any of the three of them. I would have given it 5 stars were it not for the awful ending. In other words: you'll never see yourself again. In the early '80s, my parents bought an old VHS copy of The Cell . While watching it I was amazed at how close to perfect the film was.

There 's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster , Sergeant Rutledge , and The Big Score . I've never quite gotten to the good parts of both movies, so I can't say much on their behalf. It's interesting to see a film about two people who try to avoid being killed in the name of love, but they get themselves killed. A young woman moves to Paris in order to pursue her career as a ballet dancer. When she decides to leave Paris, her lover (played by Anthony Perkins) has other plans.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film: Who are the crazy people?The answer become less clear as the film goes on.Renee Zellweger loses the whiney note in her voice and, while her voice is still high, she is incredibly effective as the shell-shocked Betty. In fact, she is so effective I almost wanted her to be just a little more crazy because her created reality was so believable.This is the first time Ms Zellweger has been called upon to carry a film and she is more than equal to the task.Chris Rock  though as foul-mouthed as usual  is fairly subdued as Wesley.

I can't comment on the accuracy of this production, historical or literary, but I can say that I enjoyed it. If there is a God, the sound track will be released, Ilona Sekacz' work is truly enduring. Twenty years on I am still moved by the haunting themes of this production and return to it frequently.The story surrounds the entry into society of Catherine Moreland. Somewhat awkward and possessed of an unhealthy interest in Gothic stories (early pulp fiction? ), Catherine descends on Bath in the company of Mrs Allen where she meets Henry Tilney.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational ) that I kept my eyes glued to the screen. What could be wrong with this? I've read some bad reviews about this flick. I don't think they should be taken serious. The premise sounds interesting, but it's just too far off. You can't really say you have a good time when you spend half your time worrying about making a movie and the other half eating ice cream. I love the idea of an all-star cast acting out a very well known story.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

Obsessed!!!!! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is because of how smart the script is, its not your average comedy show there isn't any pause after a joke it just keeps on, if you missed you missed it. And its not like a soap opera drama either because it doesn't use dramatic music and the actors never have those stupid cheesy surprise looks. I think Gilmore Girls is one of the bests shows on T.V. shows of its time.

The best of everything. Just what is the best of everything? It is different for everyone but for most of us it is love. But alas not everyone knows where or who to look to for real love. This story goes the whole gambit of looking for love. Sometimes in all the wrong places and for all the wrong reasons. But as the saying goes,"we are the captains of our own ships", and so it goes for our lives. We are responsible for the choices that we make in our lives. Once we make those choices then we must live with them.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure whether to try to save the baby or kill him. Finally, after some deliberation and deciding, he chooses to save the baby. Okay, I admit it; if this were a good movie (which it very much is), I may have liked it! But it is just plain dumb. Just think about it for a minute. When we meet Elmer in "The Dark Tower" we are treated to this:Elmer's first day on the job is ruined by his boss.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty, easily one of the most charming, off-beat, and lighthearted comedies of the year.When soap opera obsessed waitress Betty Sizemore witnesses her insensitive husband's murder by two hitmen (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), she snaps and thinks the cast members on A Reason to Love are real. She decides to travel to Los Angeles to find famed heart specialist Dr. David Ravell (a character on the show).As the two oddly paired Hitmen, the caustic Rock and the pontificating Freeman generate some very fun chemistry, and Greg Kinnear also has fun with his smarmy offscreen actor persona.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission, I can only look at this as a piece of entertainment. I started watching it too late in the evening (recorded from BBC2 earlier this year) but once I'd started I had to watch to the end.The down-side is that it's effectively a courtroom drama - never my favourite genre - but it's stunningly photographed (largely in super-saturated ochres) and well acted. Like a good novel, I couldn't put it down. All the way through, I wished I was watching it in a cinema to do the music and photography justice.

"The Cell" is an exotic masterpiece, a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer, but also into one of a very talented director. This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human beings unleash their uninhibited imaginations. This is boldness at work, pushing aside thoughts to fall into formulas and cliches and creating something truly magnificent. This is the best movie of the year to date.I've read numerous complaints about this film, anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast characters and bad acting. To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. The film follows two brothers as they move between their homes - first to live with their mother and then to live on their own. This is both sad and hilarious but at the same time makes you want to laugh even harder!The main problem with this movie is that some of the special effects are ridiculously unrealistic. For example, during a scene involving a car, an explosion occurs out in the middle of nowhere.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece. It's Werner Herzog's most unconventional film. It doesn't have a plot or story. Instead of a story, we're given a collection of images, words and music that work so wonderfully together. It's not a documentary either. Some of the people in this film are directed and given lines to read. It has some of the most beautiful and haunting images. Herzog shoots real mirages and we see cars and people floating around in the middle of the desert who aren't actually there but hundreds of miles away reflected like in a mirror.

Usually , Alan Alda plays characters that are too `` soft '' and overly verbal -- it 's probably how they get into their jobs, I don't know.) But I liked this film; the acting was top-notch, the photography really good, the script interesting and intriguing. (This would be an excellent film in any decade.) I have heard nothing about this movie so I must assume it is pretty bad. I haven't watched it but I do know it has been shown on tv and i'm guessing it was terrible.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one. I really can't come up with one. I think it's because most of the films that take on this topic (war, peace, violence) are in a fixed documentary style.There are some terrific ones out there, all of them better known than USA T.M., I'm sure, but they are intended to be informational and to bring your emotional response to the surface through intellectual means. This DVD, in some ways may seem more intellectual but it really isn't.

I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the character of Bollywood's biggest love-triangle. She made me laugh so hard, I didn't know if I had broken the screen or her heart. There are certainly some flaws in this movie, but the overall picture is superb. The story of Bollywood's most romantic love story is told from two perspectives. A young lad, who falls in love with an older girl, finds himself torn between his loyalty and desire for her affection.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being asked to come and see his son's first production at the New York Public Theater, "A Trip To The Moon" (which he had co-produced). There is not a lot of story to this one. I was so looking forward to this film I actually got my tickets in 3 days before release. I read about it on the internet and thought it might be a good idea. When I finally saw it I was shocked to discover that there is no dialogue...no subtitles.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield . The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor called "Mr. D," who builds a robot in hopes of winning the Miss Robot League, a talent show that he must win in order to become a contestant. The main character is voiced by David Arquette who also does the same thing for Scrooges. This was supposed to have been one of the funniest movies ever made, but this is what you get when you spend more time waiting in lines at McDonald's than watching these guys.

I have watched this show from the beginning, and I am a 45 year old man. To me, this is so much more that a show that appeals to women. This is the story of a family, possibly an unusual one, but a family none the less. It centers around a mother and daughter, Lorelei and Rory Gilmore, two bright, attractive, and in their own ways successful women. Lorelei makes her home in fictional Stars Hollow, CT, a small New England town with a sense of history, and a population of people that may be unusual, but acts as a dysfunctional family.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time. We loved it so much. It was the only show about Black middle class families on t.v. at the time. Please release this on DVD. I know many...many people who still talk about the show. If it its released i am certain that many black youth will find this enlightening as well as interesting. The show addressed many topics from racism, intra-race discrimination, teen pregnancy, sibling rivalry, single parenting, peer-pressure and much more.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds better than the rest of them, for me it was just as good (if not better).The only downside I have to say about this movie is that its very slow. You really don't need to see the ending at all. It's a nice change up though.If you like horror movies then this is definitely worth a try. This film is an absolute disappointment. I've seen some films with a bit more ambition, but this wasn't it.

15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. However as the story unfolds, one realize the thin line that director tries to walk between Relationships, Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia. I would say Aparna Sen is one director who has so much more to say and has so less time at disposal. Well no doubt she has managed to make a good movie. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie, especially when you watch the trailer. In fact, there was no real need for it to be any worse. The plot line: two guys (one man, one woman) get a chance to spend some time together but don't expect much from each other. The girl goes to see a guy she doesn't really like because she thinks she'll be able to make up with him. She meets another guy and they're friends.

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

This is a `` revised '' Riverdance presentation , staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City . The title was originally given as the "Riverdance of the Century" but the name has become so overused that I decided not to bother. The actors were all awful. The choreographer's technique was too much like slapstick to be credible. The music was very cheesy and the whole thing was terribly boring, even for a Broadway production. The acting was nothing to write home about, with the exception of Billie Joe Armstrong who did a fantastic job.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the past few years. So I decided to watch it at the local library, but I didn't know what I was watching. This is really a bad film. I watched it with my family, and we all said it was a terrible film. The acting was terrible. And the story...the whole story was just horrible. Why did the parents have to give their son that much money to be in such a film? He had enough money to pay his rent every month.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie . They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to make good use of them. I would have preferred if they had been the lead or at least a supporting part rather than just a cameo. Came across this one on Amazon and was impressed, as there is really nothing like it. I love movies where two attractive young women share a passionate kiss in the car, but never in this genre! The only thing that could make this even remotely appealing to me was if the director had found a way to bring the lovers into the movie.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . The acting was okay for a film of its time . Some scenes were cheesy . "I've never understood why people think movies are 'real' when they are not. A lot of films seem to be filmed on video tape and in black and white. They have no story, no world, no depth or real characters. The only ones you really care about are the actors, and the director/director. "Well if you make a good movie you will get better notices.

I 'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film . If you don't like sci fi or fantasy films then it won't be too much of a disappointment to you unless you're a total masochist.This film is based off a novel by Ian Tregillis , and the book was an entertaining read. I've never read the novel, but I imagine it was one of the first books I ever read while growing up as I had an obsession with the idea that there were wizards and witches in modern times (although my interest was more in the medieval kind).

I 'm not the type of person to watch T.V . shows because the acting normally sucks or it 's so bad that I never want to see a movie again unless they make it into a TV show. I'm sorry to say this, but this documentary was horrible. It's obvious that the people behind the production were trying their best to portray an accurate account of how life is for the poor and forgotten in Mexico. I have always enjoyed watching old Mexican movies like "Puerto Princesa de Guadalupe" and "Juana Matosas del Cielo".

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! The script is well written and keeps things escalating. It also has a great current of suspense coursing through it. You don't know what's going to happen next as the main character tries to deal with the realization that his new neighbor might not be the most ideal person to be living across from him. The jokes are quick and unexpected.

* spoiler * * spoilers * * spoilers * I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it. But if you don't like gore and blood, there may be nothing worth seeing. The acting was terrible. I have read the book "Bloody Disgusting" by Dr. Robert Heine, who also wrote the movie version. I am not sure how many movies this guy actually wrote, but according to the movie description on IMDb, this one was written for TV, and he got paid to do it.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries , I did n't expect much from 'Two for the Road'. However, I was wrong.The story begins with a young woman who has just been abandoned by an ex-boyfriend who takes her out to dinner and drinks all of her vodka before he leaves. She eventually breaks down crying hysterically after she is left alone in the car. This movie starts with a guy (played by Kevin Durand) who wants to meet up with a beautiful actress (Jennifer Lopez) whom he'd met a few years back but never got along with.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9 or 10 years old and it really scared the living s*** out of me. The acting was awful, and it just seemed so pointless. In a world of silly action-comedy cartoons (and you can probably guess how many of them follow this formula), why should I have been interested? What was I supposed to be paying attention to when watching these stupidly cheesy cartoons? Why did I even bother watching this movie?

I 'll be brief : I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that makes it very attractive to me. This is an example of the film business failing on the big screen. A director, who never directed a motion picture and doesn't seem interested in directing a film of any sort, decides to make a horror film about the occult... and he's got no idea how to make a decent movie. The whole thing looks like it was made by a student with only a few hours to spare on his days off.

Hallelujah!!!! Finally, a true Colombian film crosses the border(s) to shows how Bogotá and Colombia really are! I am an American of Colombian and French heritage sick and tired of seeing Colombia so perversely and ignorantly portrayed by Hollywood and others.How many of you are aware that Colombia is the second oldest, uninterrupted democracy in the world (after the USA), or that it has a vibrant film and television industry (-to say nothing of Ugly Betty), that it's capital, Bogota (Pop.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

**SPOILERS AHEAD**It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a disappointment. I thought this was full of (silly) clichés andthat it basically tried to hard. To the (American) guys out there: how many of you spend yourtime jumping on your girlfriend's bed and making monkeysounds? To the (married) girls: how many of you have suddenlygone from prudes to nymphos overnight--but not with yourhusband? To the French: would you really ask about someonebeing "à la fac" when you know they don't speak French?

I absolutely fell in love with this girls . let me tell you something : I am from Romania and I can say that this Romanian girl is a great model, she really does have nice legs , she has a good figure but she doesn't have much skin on her. What makes her so awesome is that she has a nice smile and she is really cute. The problem is that when she tries to make herself bigger she always ends up looking even smaller. There are times when I'm trying to buy a magazine and I see her and I'm not sure whether to laugh or cry.

Honestly , when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana , I did not expect it to be so bad. It is actually a good movie, but it is just awful . The plot revolves around a college professor who decides to write a novel about his wife and daughter-in-law, after which he is accused of murder and sentenced to 30 years in prison. Of course, this doesn't work out so well for him because he ends up killing his own wife and daughter in an effort to save his life.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm, wit, and charm. At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gave birth to Rory Gilmore. She left her parents house and got a job. Now, Lorelai and Rory have a relationship that many mothers and daughters envy. They are best friends. The girls have an extensive knowledge of movies, and TV shows, and are constantly quoting them. In the first season, Lorelai needs money to send Rory to Chilton ( a very highly rated high school), so she reluctantly has to turn to her parents.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic. I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

Jimmy (Heath Ledger) is given a simple job by Pando (Bryan Brown) a underworld kingpin to deliver money to a particular address, but when no one answers the door Jimmy decides to take a dip at the beach to pass some time, but he notices that his clothes on the sand have been messed up and the 10 grand is gone. Jimmy rings Pando to tell him the problem, but he doesn't want to hear it. Pando and his boys try their best to locate Jimmy, meaning no more Jimmy if they get their hands on him.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film's main achievements. When you hear a vague outline of the story  Erasmus students of mixed nationalities sharing a flat in Barcelona  you predict a collection of Euro-stereotypes in a farcical tangle. Pas du tout! In fact, it's a finely judged comedy about a young Frenchman, Xavier, trying to make sense of human relationships. There are some excellently observed minor roles (the arrogant French neurologist, the insufferably irrepressible brother of the English girl, Xavier's forlorn mother) and some fine visual humour, especially in the opening scenes mocking the bureacratic complexity of the application procedure.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment ! It is an energetic musical with lots of great songs! I have been waiting a long time for this show. I didn't like it when I first saw it but I have to admit that watching it was a real treat. The production value was top notch.The storyline was pretty interesting and some of the characters were very interesting in their own right. I'm sure that all the people who came here to see it are going to come away with different opinions, but I think the film is a bit overrated.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years. I rate it one of the best ever. I've just returned to Ireland from Arizona on American Airlines from a biz trip and by chance they showed several episodes. I laughed my head off and later I asked the stewards to play again and they did. Thank you AA. The acting from all the team is first rate and especially from Kevin James, Leah Remini and Gerry Stiller, but from all of the cast in fact the acting is superb. I love all the cast, they are so funny.

I liked this a lot. The camera angles are cool, it's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. And I thought they did a great job with the Sound when we see things from Kane's point of view. Lots of fun. Plenty of people were shouting at the screen! Kane did a great job with his various psycho emotions. He's a lot less one-dimensional than most horror heroes.Kane is a lot less scary and more believable than most movie psychos. It was not clear to me how he would react to various situations.

Cant believe it .... after all these years finally tracked this down .. it was meant to be named 'The Cuckoo and the White Mice' and it is really a great movie..I can see how some people would find it offensive..but that's just my personal opinion, I'm just an old fart from the 80s.. This film is one of the most bizarre and disgusting things I ever saw in my life. I had to get out of here as quickly as possible. I was at work when the movie came on. I decided to watch it.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny ( and fun ) puns . The first shot we see in this film is of an astronaut walking into a cave. The only thing he's wearing at the moment is a pair of white tennis shoes. We do not see any other clothes on him at that moment. I found this movie to be very funny. Unfortunately it had no story or even plot. I laughed out loud more than once throughout the movie. The characters were likable, but all of them were completely unrealistic. This movie does have some good comedic moments in it.

I saw `` The Reader '' at a film festival in Manhattan this week . It touched my heart in two ways. The story is about a family who moves to the small town where their teenage daughter is an oddball from the wrong side of the tracks (she's a lesbian, so there goes that social status). Things go awry one evening when the little girl returns home with a man she just met and begins making out with him. Her father comes home and calls the authorities but no one can be found to report the incident.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the U.S. as a self-funded project from Herzog's personal bank account, is generally regarded as "not good enough" (and not even bad enough) for an Oscar nomination, but it has recently been hailed as one of the 20 best films of all time. First off, let me just say that I'm no fan of Werner Herzog. No, I am far from a big fan of any of the other directors he has co-directed, or his movies.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee , it is evident in his movie . Forget the Black guy on White Hill , the film was nothing like that, he played a good role , but the plot was shallow. Well, let's face it, there isn't a single movie that I've seen lately that hasn't had a white person in it. Sure, some of them aren't really bad per se, but the ones that are... well this one wasn't one of them.It's hard enough to make decent movies without whitewashing.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release. It is a delightfully cute and funny movie in the spirit of 'Benji' though much improved and focused more on the actors than the dogs. The simple portrayal of life difficulties in a humorous way, followed by the bullies and villains getting their just deserts, is both sympathetic and heartwarming. It is also thought provoking. With deft subtleness this movie affects ones awareness of cruelty, personal behavior, and bullying. Movies have different genera's and different purposes.

Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks. He has the assignment of spoofing the Robin Hood legacy and the couple of movie dealing with the mythical honorable thief of English folklore. Cary Elwes stars as Robin Hood. He's looking for a few good men who'll join him in his quest to topple the evil sheriff of Nottingham (Roger Rees) and win the fair hand of Maid Marian. Robin also has to deal with Prince John (Richard Lewis).as well.

GREAT , Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen .. He acts like a spoiled child at times . he's just not a very likable person (at all) so i'm really impressed by him ... So it was with a little surprise when I picked up this book for the second time yesterday. After seeing it once, I thought "oh boy, this is pretty darn good" and went back for it again because I knew it was going to be much more fun to re-read it. This time I was pleasantly surprised!

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy on DVD for 99p. I enjoyed the film, the twists and turns in the plot and that the file was mainly about the main character Sinuhe makes it more of a "family saga" rather than an action film. The costumes and attention to detail was remarkable for its time (1955). The back projection during the chariot ride now looks clumsy. My main interest was in the character of Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by, no matter how bad it may look. His debut, Hustle and Flow, was one of my favorites from that year, with its emotionally charged storyline and realistic, fallible characters. I wasn't quite sure what I would end up thinking after seeing this sophomore effort. The cast seemed great, the trailer used music effectively, however, it seemed like there was a good chance it would cross into absurdity, and fast. Fortunately, Black Snake Moan hits all its marks dead-on.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply too good. I was just amazed at the amount of people in attendance. This was a really great show! I think every one should see it. The sound was spot on, Jerry's guitar was excellent, the song selection was pretty good, and the crowd reaction to each song was quite good. A lot of people asked for the photos (the only time I've ever let them)and when I told them they did not get what they wanted, they started throwing things at me.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

If you want to see a movie with nudity, sex, drugs, alcohol, brutal beating of a woman and child rape, this movie will satisfy you. If you want to see a man creatively exact revenge on the treasure of a wife who left him, this movie has it. You've already heard the wonderful music that keeps the raw emotion going. The surprise is that in a story of violence, action and music a climax can come in a moment of silence, without a pedantic speech, which transforms the movie.

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the story of a man who tries to find love in all the wrong places and ends up with a girl he falls for.The plot, which at first seems plausible, becomes increasingly implausible as the movie goes along. I watched this film last night while my wife and I were trying to figure out why we hadn't had sex since our marriage started. If there's one thing I've learned about life it's that it doesn't have to be this bad.

`` L'Auberge Espagnole '' collected the audience wherever it was shown . It gathered audience awards on many film festivals around the world and has been seen on TV and radio in a few countries such as Canada, Greece, Norway, New Zealand, Sweden and Belgium. The film was shot at the studios of the legendary French director, Jean-Claude Carraul. I just stumbled across this gem of a movie. My initial reaction was, "Wow, you must be a die hard Carrau fan!" Then I thought, "No, this is way too far out there for Carrau to ever make a feature."

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment. This movie does an excellent job of revealing the complexity of the task and the incredible challenges facing South Africa. I believe every one should see this movie as I think few people outside of South Africa understand its past and what is being attempted in the Truth and Reconciliation process. Almost every country has some part of its own history which is still a source of continuing hatred and bitterness. We all need to understand ways of dealing with the past. What's happening in South Africa should guide us all.

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. There are some things that I just can't stand about this movie, though. The plot itself is so cliched that I couldn't help but roll my eyes every time one of the main characters (and there are quite a few to pick out) said something that sounded familiar. I've watched this movie a dozen times now. I don't think I like it more than 2 hours.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band's 30 year career. Lee, Lifeson, and Peart were animated and fun on stage and delivered a great show. That being said, I think the audio recording was botched at the mixing console and/or through the miking process. This is not the fault of the boys however. They even mentioned that the show was setup last-minute, so the band and their crew obviously did their best. They just shouldn't have put the show out for public consumption.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say "french culture". I thought the way it was filmed and the editing was real good but mostly it was entertaining especially the guy that played Wendy's brother. Also the story line was really good as well as it was believable and yet adventurous as well.Favorite Part: When William is making fun of the German guy studying and when he acts out how flies reproduce! :) My french isn't that good but with the subtitles i could pretty much get what was going on. WATCH IT!

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn about the horrors and dangers they are about to face in their struggle to survive in an unforgiving world. I liked this movie, but I can see why people would have a problem with it; it is a bit like watching a child on the verge of making a bomb. It has a very simplistic approach to what makes a movie good, so you can't expect much more out of it than "it's just some kids going on a trip".

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking . I 'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and make a change from the norm. It's well worth your time (I did), although you can see why some people find it too much to take at first. But once you understand what the message is behind it, its really quite an interesting watch. The whole film is based on the fact that "there is only one race, there is only one kind of human, and all the other races just exist to make life easier for their own kind".

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west. Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

I couldn't believe the eye candy from start to finish. Being a fan of movies directed by music video masterminds. I am happy to report that the photography in this motion picture is a splendor for the eye to behold. There are so many rich, full images that are put before me, that each and every time that I see this movie, I find something new that I had not seen before. As with previous movies that I have seen, such as Blade and Mystery Men, also by former music video directors, the use of color to capture one's attention is utilized extremely well.

I'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5, but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 pages of imbecilic, unjustified 1-star reviews. This is an interesting story, all of the acting is good to very good (even Ms. Diaz, who is totally out of her usual grinning-bimbo role here, yet plays it well.) The sets are perfect and the cinematography is consistently appropriately creepy. It's a fine morality play and there is *no* reason to explain the origin of the god/supernatural being/alien/whatever that's "running the show," so I'm glad the movie doesn't try.

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty. IT was about a middle class black family who had a teen aged daughter and son who moved to a middle class neighborhood from Oakland or somewhere (I can't remember). I remember several episodes but the one I remember most was when their cousin got her period for the first time. I was probably 7-8 when I first watched it and I was able to keep up with the program.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining a high-stakes, high-octane style . King of the Underworld is an entertaining, fast-paced action movie set in the ancient Roman Empire. The problem for this movie is that the acting is extremely shallow and the story is completely predictable. I feel like most of the movie was cut from the theatrical release so that only people who have no idea what they are doing would be able to make fun out of it. The first thing you notice about the film is the low budget and the lack of special effects.

I 've seen 'nurse betty ' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea 'and i love it, but this one 's just so wrong, i got a sick feeling at the heart of that movie. I don't think any real doctor would even want to take her out on a date, never mind going for a walk along the beach. If there is something wrong with Betty, i am willing to bet that she has some sort of mental health problem. I've read all the reviews here, and I have to say that I found this movie to be incredibly disappointing.

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , ``The Cell' is based on one of the greatest and most notorious unsolved murders in the United States. Most people don't realize this because it is presented as a nonfiction documentary. I'm not much for documentaries, but what a delight this was! This movie had all the trappings of a great movie, from interesting characters (Meredith Vieira) to good acting (Burt Lancaster). But there was one little problem: the editing.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ...but not much else . I would be happy if this film was made and directed by someone who has the ability to make a good Sci-fi movie even if they didn't have the skills to do it . The story is weak. I watched this movie without any real intent to understand it, but just because I couldn't help it. It seemed that the director of this movie knew exactly how to ruin the experience of watching movies with people who weren't expecting anything special or special-esque.

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone who sees it say that there is too much blood and violence in it ? There was a lot of violence in the movie but I would not recommend it to people who are sensitive about violence . If you are not, do not watch it , it will change your life. The plot of this film is so unbelievable that it sounds like a bad dream. An English couple (Beryl De Jong and Tom Hanks) travel to Italy to visit an old friend.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50 's , along with others such as 'The Great Giza Sphinx' that are worth watching . I had been wanting to see this film for ages and I have always found it very interesting. But I finally saw it in its entirety recently when I was looking for stuff to watch while at work on Friday. It surprised me, not only because it went into so much detail, but also because some of the characters felt quite believable. The script was good (although I wasn't terribly impressed by the casting choices).

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across this film. I remember thinking, "Hmmm, maybe this is a good idea." It's hard to believe these movies ever made it to the US. It's been over 20 years since this movie first hit the UK and I'm going to take a stab at reviewing it.If you've seen other reviews of this film, you know it's not very good - but for some reason, that doesn't really get any mention here.The premise isn't very good either.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography. Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth? 15 park avenue is the story of an alternative reality of a schizophrenic (Mithi). The movie is about her search for her home at a fictitious address where her imaginary husband and 5 children live. Aparna Sen delivers yet another masterpiece. Each and every actor of the movie was better than the other. Konkona Sen looks unbelievably convincing as a schizophrenic. She pulls off the role with such ease and maturity beyond her age. Shabana Azmi is incredible as usual.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas, Phoenix, Fresno, etc., just single buildings with the name in block letters on the roof. And the tri-motors, and the well-dressed passengers. Fast-forward 75 years....But what really got to me was the hammer and sickle emblem and what appeared to be a Chinese ideogram adjacent the logo, aft of the pilot's seat on the starboard side of the fuselage. Remember when the mutual acquaintance Neil and Jill encounter says that Jim'd become a general in a Chinese rebel army?

I'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film. If you're looking for something different then this movie is a good choice. Definitely not your typical mindless story that seems to be everywhere starring Ben Idiot Affleck or some other Hollywood loser. It's an intellectual film, you actually need to pay attention so some people might be turned off by that. However, if you are looking for something that keeps you on your toes then this is a good choice. Warning to parents - it has some fairly graphic sex scenes so watch it once the kiddies are in bed.

First of all - I'm not one to go all sappy over movies. I saw Friends in the 70's when it was first released. I was about 17 years old at the time. Even now, at age 50, I still can remember some of the scenes. The movie is sweet and sad and may actually be too tame for teenagers today but I loved it. The story is about innocence, the purity of young love and the determination of 2 young people to make a better life for themselves then they had at home.

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

honestly.. this show warms my heart, i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has started i'm even more hooked than before.. the characters are so well-developed and their relationships are so real.. i would recommend this show for any woman or mother and daughter.. the Lorelei's are super fast talking witty girls that will, truly inspire you and the show is hysterical at times and never too too serious, but serious enough for it to be completely addicting.. it's an hour long which is a major PLUS because you can't ever get enough Gilmore!

I was expecting this movie to suck, but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film. Most of the death scenes are adequately brutal. The teens are decent, with Penny McNamee definitely the best of the bunch. Rachael Taylor looks like a young Christie Brinkley, but doesn't bring much to the movie other than that. Kane was good as the killer, and is totally believable as a fearsome juggernaut. I saw the "twist" coming from miles away, but I still enjoyed the movie.But what really stood out to me was the direction.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogotá, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

This movie is VERY LONG, but totally worth splitting up over several nights. It has an all-star cast, and if you are a Patrick Swayze fan, this will get your heart to throbbing! :-) My mother is a Civil War buff, and a history teacher, and every summer we would watch this movie (we had recorded it off TV), over several, several nights until we got through the whole thing. We had every line in the movie memorized, lol. Pop some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the action and romance.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I couldn't believe how well she handled the role . It was like watching a good acting class and getting taught by a real actress. This was one of her best performances yet ! I didn't see that many people complaining about her face , but I guess it wasn't that much of a problem considering what she is now. If there is one movie that everyone should see at some point in their life, it must have to be this movie.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial . The films that featured their brood paved the way for countless imitators. While this movie may look and sound like it is supposed to be a kids movie, I actually think it is intended to be a horror movie. And it isn't. There is no gore, no blood, no violence at all. It is merely suspenseful, but you do have to watch it because you don't really want to miss some of the scenes that are meant to be scary. This was the worst horror movie I've ever seen.

I wanted to watch this , to get a inside look at the show . It told the story more or less. One thing was, the characters were too much alike. They were not interesting and not real. I can understand why so many people enjoyed it . First things first: I saw "The Wire" a couple years ago when it first aired. At that moment I really didn't see any reason to continue watching the series after all its episodes have been completed. I don't remember much of the final season, but I remember how frustrating I found it.

THE CELL (2000) Rating: 8/10The Cell, like Antz, must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time I saw this film I thought it was mediocre, but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing, I decided I had to rent it again. I did, and I found the film to be much more likeable. The Cell is not for everyone, but it divides its stories up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dreams up images and plot ideas that could not be matched.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw this a couple of weeks ago but was too late for the film as I had to get home from my job early to finish it off. But after viewing it, I can see why people say it's an excellent documentary. Just like the title said, this movie is absolutely terrible. It should not be shown to anyone, ever. I don't care if someone doesn't want to see it or that there isn't enough time to find a DVD player - this is just awful.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references to pedophilia. This film is so offensive that I feel no need to address its issues. The only positive thing that could be said of this film (other than being a "good horror movie") is that it's entertaining.The main characters, Jason and Zoey, are both in love with each other. They are trying to stop a psychopath from killing people. When this psychopath arrives he has a gun pointed at them and they decide to get away.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door , I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling . On the one hand, there are some interesting people. But on the other hand, it seems as though everyone else who works in this business has their feet firmly planted on the ground . For me, Boy Next Door is a story about what happens when a group of guys get together and decide to do something that no one else can do. It's not exactly the most original concept out there, but hey, maybe someone should have thought of this before they decided to make a movie based on it.

At first I couldn't tell if it was an art film or a documentary. The day after I had a unique movie after taste experience or perhaps a revelation. The film is a human quest to destroy everything that exists, including life on earth. The lead is clueless and cold. He is like all of us he wants to get rich, to laugh, to travel, to eat and be entertained. He moves from one place to another in a giant RV without direction or motive only to pass time and entertain himself. By the end it's too late.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a banquet of beauties into a delightful meal day to day, this movie hits the mark. Good afternoon fare. I understand that Louis Jordan wanted to work in this movie to play opposite the quintessential GORGEOUS Suzy Parker. Everyone wanted to be in and I believe it has done well and held up over time. Best on screen kiss between Hope Lange and the late Stephen Boyd.It may not appear that anything of this is plausible but actually it was and probably still is even given the scare of sexual harassment.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me quote from the movie's IMDb page,
"In this comedy/romance-ish tale, a guy (Drew Barrymore) is kidnapped and returned to his home city after he has accidentally been transported there. He soon finds out what a big deal his disappearance was for the kidnappers, who claim he 'gave them more trouble' than they had ever known." This movie should've been banned in most states in the U.S., because there is no reason that you should watch it.

This is a really great film ! It gets you thinking about your parents . How we all have fragile hearts and how they are affected by those around them . It is the first film where I really got to feel for characters . They are human beings and like any other human beings , they cry. There is no doubt that some of them will not be sympathetic in the end, but this is not the fault of the writer or director or the cinematography. This is a good movie with lots of things to love.The dialogue was fine. The special effects were OK.

I saw the movie in 1972, and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went back many more times to see it over and over ... I think 9 times in all. Just great is how I would describe it ... I was taken by the sound track, the beautiful panoramas of the south of France, the life style the kids began on their own. An ideal way to live is what they had set up ... of course the powers that be have to intercede, but when I forget that part I find myself wanting to be in the movie and live like that!

Robin Hood ; Men in Tights is worth watching , I recently watched it because I 've just become a big fan of the original film. If you are not into this movie, don't worry. There are plenty of other fine films from that era (e.g., The Maltese Falcon ) that have better special effects. Now that we've seen the wonderful and sad story of Robin Hood and his archnemesis Lord Glenvarloch, I need to see more of them. I think that they'd all be much better than this trash.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time. If you don't watch the show, well then you were just a mindless viewer. So why not watch the show with your family or children ? You get to learn from both sides. I was watching "Americans Next Top Model" this week with my husband, and while we agreed it was pretty entertaining, we both thought it was very stupid. And that's saying quite a lot. The first half of the program was good, but the second half took the show down a different path.

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A Lot of Money. OK. The plot is bad. I have watched it a hundred times but I cannot find an explanation of this plot. It seems to me that the only way to get ahead in this film is to give as much good advice as possible to the lead character - his wife, her children, friends, etc. But they all seem to prefer to listen to him instead of do what he says. Why should we be expected to listen to him?

What can I say ? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an example. I watched this show today because of the hype that was surrounding the premiere. I was disappointed with the content and the production values, which are very low. It's a total waste of time and money. First of all, the whole premise of the show seems so ridiculous that it's beyond parody. A young girl is kidnapped and she ends up in the hands of some weird monster-man. There's no action, no gore, no suspense, nothing.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teenaged girls have been raped and murdered by a crazed gang called the G.O.R.L.S. The first thing that strikes you about this movie is its lack of suspense. Everything is too slow to get you on the edge of your seats. There is no tension or sense of excitement here. The acting is not believable either. I don't know what made it past the casting stage but the actors seem to be from a different planet than they were on. This film is disgusting.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their "Erasmus year" in Barcelona which by the way is one of the most beautiful towns in Europe and is an ideal location. The idea itself with all the different languages is great and gives the film an original atmosphere. There are some clichés about the countries but most of them are true! The characters could not better represent their different countries.Having experienced "Erasmus" on myself during my exchang semester in Italy I can say that is movie is incredibly authentic.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to catch him. But when he spots Bugs, he runs for it! I didn't know this cartoon was made at the time I saw it...but I just had to check it out. Well, let's say it's a little different than what everyone else said...it's funny, yes, but then you get a couple of the other "crazies". For example: The plot isn't very sophisticated and doesn't give any hint of how it will be resolved.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful actresses in her production team to be involved with this film, the fact that they were not only both very talented actresses but also very charming was just an added bonus. I remember seeing this film years ago and it really disappointed me because of its terrible acting, bad script, weak story (one character is a complete joke) etc. But i thought "hey, let's take a chance and see what this film can actually deliver."

`` The Honkers '' is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time . When we were shooting , everyone was watching, but me and a few of my co- cast mates were out there doing our own thing. A good movie that has so many plot holes I could count them on the fingers of my hand. It starts off by telling us that in an effort to protect their family from the violence they would have to kill a member of their family and it never really develops into anything more than a very basic "murder trial".

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen ( mostly in English ) but there are just some minor flaws here and there.The story can be seen as a sort of "paternal drama" where a father tries to keep his daughter in line and the daughter tries to keep her father out of trouble. This is not so much a true story as a melodrama in which the mother attempts to do the best that she can to save her own skin, and it sometimes does work at times.

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time and the movie wasn't so bad. It's a pity there was no ending. I just had to share a comment that someone else made about my film on IMDB. I don't have a problem with IMDb, but as others have mentioned, you can get a sense of things like character development and story by searching on your favourite search engine. After watching this movie it took me an hour and 20 minutes to watch it.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again as an adult you are supposed to be able to get a little more insight into the movie than just "what it's all about", but what is happening in this film I don't quite get.
