It has always been my problem with horror flicks. The monsters aren't scary. The script doesn't make sense. If the bad guy was really bad, he wouldn't have won. The story is too unbelievable.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including `the young & the restless.' However, I guess some of the profanity, violence, and sexual innuendo in the movie are not suitable for `all your children.' Anyways before the sand fills up the hourglass, let me tell you the name of the film: `Nurse Betty.' Renee Zellweger stars as Betty. She is a Kansas waitress who falls under a trance, and thinks she is a real life character of her favorite soap opera.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe , grappa , aramangac or jungle juice some night and decided to write a movie based on a book I had read a few years ago
"The Man Who Killed Don Quixote" is one of the better, if not the best movies I have ever seen. It has an epic storyline, it features some excellent characters, and it is all in Spanish. In short, it was a lot of fun to watch and I'm pleased to report that I still remember it.

This movie makes you think. It shows how a woman's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others. Her physically aggressive behavior is more often seen in men than women, so it made me feel even more uncomfortable to see the way the lead actress behaved. I think that women might think about this behavior, but I don't think they act on it. The dark scenes added to the sense of evil that needed to be hidden. I was relieved when the prisoners escaped. I was hopeful that the end would bring a satisfying solution, but it did not.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius , every character in it is perfect for their part , and they all do their job perfectly .the only problem i had with this film was that I never got to see how this film would end, i didn't know if it was gonna be a horror or a comedy . I don't know how to make this sound good. In my opinion there should be no reason for a movie to be called "The End of the World" It just doesn't cut it.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger , and I loved it back then, but I didn't think it could ever become a hit. The original concept of this movie is actually very cool, as in it has an entire alien planet full of dinosaurs that had been living in their jungle for thousands of years. But after watching this movie, I will NEVER watch another Disney channel movie again!! The first thing I noticed when I first walked into this theater was the horrible soundtrack. Everything was so slow and boring.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances. I just read a user comment concerning the performance of the actress who plays a conniving courtesan who fleeces Sinuoeh, the lead character. I remember a mini-biography of this actress following the movie the last time I saw it. Apparently, she was a Holocaust refugee, discovered by a French husband and wife in the movie industry who were taken with her extraordinary beauty. She died very young and under tragic circumstances. Gene Tierney is also outstanding in this film.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie . How surprised I was ! This is a movie which has the ability to be one of the very worst movies ever. I am going to tell you what is worse in my humble opinion... The bad acting ! The story of this film goes like this: In a remote mountain village, a young couple find themselves lost in the mountains for days without food, water or shelter. Things get even stranger as they try to survive an intense winter with little or no shelter.

First of all , ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans . Everyone is doing it anyway. And I don't understand why anyone would even care to go through that effort. It's like going to a zoo and telling them to kill all the animals . This movie was so bad that I started to think, maybe I'm not in the first wave of anti-GOP fans. This film has been a complete disaster from beginning to end. Firstly, there were so many glaring plot holes that I found it incredibly hard to follow.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. It is not difficult to define the reasons of this success. This movie made by one of the most interesting French film-makers of these last years, Cédric Klapisch, presents students coming from all over Europe and gathered all together under the same roof in Barcelona. These students are described like the ones you imagine or you see in everyday life: either untidy, either serious or with a sense of humor.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

Okay, where to begin. Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous mime team Shields and Arnez? Bet ya didn't. But they turned it down complaining about robot make-up. Then they faded off into obscurity. Now, this movie has everything. A crazed killer robot who thinks he's dirty Harry. Lots of cool robots. It's funny, it's touching, it's the perfect date movie for people who love sci-fi and romantic comedies. It's the first robot romantic comedy. Now of course very few movies are perfect and there are some character issues.

With all the dreck out there , this is a gentle movie about young love . Yes , it 's a B movie , but i don't see why not! I have to give it at least a 6/10 because it lacks a little something for me. There were some good dialogue scenes here and there , but most of the time they were in the background so that you can't really feel them. Maybe it's the type of movies that come out every couple of years? The story was pretty lame. The plot was also very predictable from the beginning.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome; more bloodshed and very graphic details (a bit too much for my taste). Great script and acting (I was especially impressed by Ken Stott and there were no weak points in te cast). Good cinematography and very realistic stereo-sound. One of the best thrillers I've seen since years. Although it was scheduled on BBC in three parts I watched Messiah on video in one take. One point of critic; the motivation of the villain was not very convincing.

Having just got the `` Loony Tunes Golden Collection '' ( which i HIGHLY recommend , by the way ) , i really have no idea what to expect in this one. The whole film starts off with some kind of cartoonish clown and his sidekick who, we are never quite sure if it is a real character or an invention. Well, that doesn't make it any more entertaining. There are two reasons why I don't understand the reviews that so often call this movie silly. One, there is nothing "cute" about this film.

This if the first movie I've given a 10 to in years. If there was ever a movie that needed word-of-mouth to promote, this is it. A $4 Mil box is a disgrace. People don't know what it's about. If you have any appreciation for the Blues, or just a good use of excellent music, that alone is reason to go see it. How many people knew Jackson could sing, and damn fine too. You hear books and movies taunting that they're about salvation. After seeing this, you'll never be able to forgive such trivial use of the word.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I'd anticipated. I had expected some gore and blood, but that just isn't what is shown here. The fact that there is nothing in the movie to distract from the fact that this movie is based off of Robert Rodriguez's films only added to the confusion. This film might be one of those rare movies that I have seen for which the plot is totally predictable. There is not a single new element introduced into the story that we haven't already heard about in other movies or TV shows.

I loved this movie ! OH MY GOSH ! This movie rocked so hard ! I found it amongst some other movies and I have to say that I am one of those who didn't see it before, and then I saw it recently in a DVD. I must say that there is not much to be said on this movie. It isn't bad by any means, but don't expect the good stuff.The acting was average, the cinematography was boring (at least compared with some of the other things they've produced) and the dialogues weren't funny or compelling.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture , 'Wagon Master ' made after two big Indian-cavalry movies. This movie has nothing in common with the stories it tells. The main characters are played by unknown actors who can't speak a lick of English and don't seem to realize they're on screen. "Wagon Master" is an utter waste of time from beginning to end. I thought this was pretty good but I must admit, I didn't understand much of what happened. Maybe that's because I'm not entirely familiar with the genre.

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surface-level performances and dialogue. The plot is extremely simplistic, however, the characters are well-drawn and you get to see a whole lot of their personalities. I personally enjoyed this film, I think it had some good elements that should be explored further. It's kind of hard to believe this is actually a feature film. If you're looking to watch one of the greatest bad guys in movie history, then this may not be for you.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up this film's success to one thing alone: the fact that it takes place at the same time as the most famous and controversial movie I've ever seen: Jaws. I don't know what it was about this film that attracted me, but I knew it was going to be something special from the word go. The plot follows a group of scientists working on alien species who discover that one of their own has been murdered.

Well ..... I would n't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I find funny, or maybe I just feel like getting on my knees and kissing somebody. It is a bit like watching a soap opera and not being able to stop thinking about what could have been. If it was only one character they would have made an interesting film. This is simply not a film worth seeing. When I saw it on TV, in theaters, and on video, I cried with joy. But when I turned it on for the first time, I was utterly stupefied.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . The actors were all excellent in the roles they were given . The only problem with these shorts is that it takes forever to get to the action . I've been looking for a new comedy I can watch, and this show was exactly what I expected. I thought I would get some laughs, but instead I got some serious boredom. It didn't make me chuckle, but I did find myself wanting to go home and just sit on my couch and watch another episode of Friends.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way!! When I first tuned in to America's Next Top Model, I expected to be bored, and to find it very very stupid. I didn't. This show is actually serious fun. I read on one of the other reviews that it makes you wonder if you have what it takes to be America's Next top model. And it so does! Who doesn't love the glamour and excitement that come with being a model? On ANTM you get to see what it's REALLY like.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch it. It starts out as a very simple story, a guy gets lost in the woods and has to find his way out again. The problem is that he keeps going into the same area until he finds an old cabin. Now it's like watching a ghost. There is some real gore (some of it from the movie), but for some reason the gore makes me want to be afraid of the characters. This movie isn't scary at all.

Maybe it 's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel , or a fondness for the film, but I could hardly believe my own eyes when I was told this is really what happened.The movie opens on an air raid shelter, where a pair of teenage orphaned boys are huddled together on the floor and playing cards with their mother. Suddenly they are shot at from all sides and fall unconscious. They wake up in the hospital and are immediately sent out to find the men who shot them and try to save them.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film : Who are the crazy people ? The answer become less clear with each passing second. It's hard to see how anyone could do such a project, but I'm not even sure I can say whether it's worth watching at all . It took me more than two minutes to come up with the word "hobgoblin" in the first sentence of this movie. That's probably because I've never heard of these creatures.I have no problem with that, and I find them quite interesting.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie. She thinks he's perfect and they get into all sorts of trouble. I am surprised that this movie has gotten so little publicity. It could have been one of those "what is the most successful movie of all time? ", but I guess movies are made for the same reason that music is, and it can be as good as any other.This is an absolutely terrible movie! The actors are awful and the script is horribly written.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old . At the time I was a teenager so I was not interested in what was being shown and thought that most of it was just too ridiculous for children. I had seen lots of comedies but never one where the jokes seemed so out-of-touch with the times. My only hope about this movie is that someone who isn't afraid to say no does watch it, otherwise I'd feel very ashamed to have written this review because I would rather watch "A Fish Called Wanda" or "Liar Liar".

First love. Teenage love. We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the one the protagonists share. "Friends" could be considered an adaptation of the classic "The Blue Lagoon", originally from 1949, and its remakes from 1980 (the most popular one, with Brooke Shields) and 1999 (with a young Milla Jovovich). While "The Blue Lagoon" puts the two young lovers in a desert island, with no contact with civilization, "Friends" goes the opposite route and it is sure to ring much more true and be a more difficult movie with contemporary audiences.

When I was engaged, my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores. He would look for his favorite mags, and on occasion a video that caught the eye. As much as I enjoyed the one-on-one with him that the media caused, there was never a video that I really enjoyed. I had seen only one other movie way back when there was a satellite channel called XXX (it dealt with a private eye unraveling a case) that actually had a proper plot and was enjoyable. All the others were grunting and puffing and blowing and whatnot.

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert , and its influence on them is so significant that it is hard to believe that it came after. There are some similarities to this film's storyline, although they don't quite hold up in the end (as far as I can see). What an appalling movie this is. I am not going to pretend to have seen it, but it is clear that the production team knew what they were doing when they made it. The story line is ludicrous and very little else happens.

`` Two Hands '' is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life (in this case a family with two young boys) and Hollywood movies.This movie was quite enjoyable, however there were a couple of elements that made it difficult for me to like it.First of all, I found it hard to believe that an Australian actor would have acted in these films. He's just not that good. I've read a bunch of "horror" films in my days, and this is perhaps the scariest one I've ever seen.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction . This is what today 's documentaries are all about . It was one of the most difficult films for me to watch and I had to go through the whole thing twice. I must admit, that I was a bit bored after it finished but I still enjoyed the rest of it. In fact, I think this film could have been a better film in my opinion. For example, you would've seen much more of Albie Garcia's face. I'm not a huge sci-fis guy, but I like a good movie.

1981 's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there . It 's one of those films where you can't help but root for the bad guy and I just found that it made me a little emotional. The film is set during the late 1800s and features two friends who find themselves mysteriously trapped in a cave at night. When they realize they're trapped, they try to escape using whatever tools they've been given. Unfortunately, this turns into a series of hilarious misadventures and near murders. There are so many terrible movies based on this book!

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld. This show was one of the greatest comedies of all time and Jerry Seinfeld did NOT give it a chance. The same can be said for many of the shows on this list. Don't say I didn't warn you: this movie is awful! It's obvious that everyone involved in production thought they could make this look like a comedy. And if they had been able to, they should have. It's a complete waste of actors' talent.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

Do n't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you ? "I'm sure it has its fans", he said. "But I've seen my share of movies that were as bad as this one. In fact I found it pretty funny. There are only a few scenes in this movie that were very funny and some of the others were rather pathetic. The story is so over-written and clichéd that it makes me want to take out the dictionary and read all the words that could be used to describe what we were seeing."

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound affect on me then. I saw in again about a year ago (I am now 29) and it still moved me in similar ways. This is a great movie that personifies the struggle of "principle vs. pragmistism". Voight's character is the idealist teacher that won't give in to any psuedo-racist leanings of the Superintendent, Mr. Skeffington. That story also personifies the struggle of how older people often resist change, and more specifically, cultural change.

America's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense. It has a great hostess, has great guests, a great production and some of the best professionals of the modeling world contributing for something they hadn't achieved yet: present a true America's Next Top Model. Of course this is not something easy to do, therefore USA and the world already would have 10 top models concurring and fighting between themselves in this cruel world.But it's obvious that its intention is not to present the America's next top model, but yes, the America's Next Pop Model.

I can't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten. To be honest, I saw the preview for this movie, and the premise looked intrigued me. Yes, I rented it after reading others' comments. They are correct in that some of the acting leaves a lot to be desired. They are also correct that one of the best performances of this movie was that of Dr. Graves.Also interesting is Scott Clark, who plays Grant, the kid in the wheelchair. I identify with the character he played, perhaps because I am in a wheelchair.This movie is certainly worth your looking at.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest . In many ways it's even more enjoyable than I have had the privilege to enjoy.The cast is terrific as usual and if you're looking for great action then this movie may be just what you're looking for. This was my first time seeing Bollywood films, when I got into it in the early 1990's, I was immediately drawn in by the sheer size of the characters and the fact that no-one spoke English (or any other language for that matter).

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , swimmers killing crocodiles (not a big surprise there as most Australians don't have much time for swimming either) etc.. But I can assure you that on the other hand when i was growing up in USA we had no such thing as 'the crocodile movie'! Wow, how do I begin to explain this masterpiece of bad cinema? One could go on and on describing all the wrongs. This is one of the scariest horror flicks ever made.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer , his secretary is kidnapped in the middle of the night while they are having dinner and her captors make off with her gold necklace, jewels and purse. If there's one thing I hate about this movie, it's the actors. There aren't a lot of characters to get attached to (especially since they don't even come off as "baddies" anymore). However, this movie had a LOT of bad acting.

For my money , probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford is making. If you want to watch a film that has all the characters and plot elements of an average soap opera, I suggest you check out this film instead. It is hard to decide what makes this movie so bad, but maybe it's the fact that it was filmed in 1974. Or perhaps it is the fact that it was not written by any Hollywood writer (though there are some pretty good names in it).

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule that evening. The film did not disappoint. I didn't expect it to be as well written as it was acted but the script and performances were so believable that it almost took my breath away. I'm not sure if the director had any clue on how to write a script like that, because he seemed completely disinterested in what he was directing. In the past 10 years, I've seen about half a dozen high-end horror films.

Renee Zellweger is Betty, a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse, who is infatuated with a soap opera actor (Greg Kinnear), and who is married to Del, a cheating, stupid male chauvinist who's trying to sell some stolen drugs. Unfortunately for him, he gets brutally, bloodily murdered instead, while Betty secretly watches. It leaves her unhinged, believing that Kinnear is really the character he plays, Dr. David Ravell, and that she is his RN ex-fiancée. She heads for LA to find her lost love, not knowing the stolen drugs are in her trunk.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I didn't pay attention in high school, so I had no idea of the plot. The only other thing I remember about this movie were that they had a scene where some guys took out their balls and threw them to a woman. I couldn't figure out what the point was, but somehow I felt sorry for the poor dudes. This is not a good movie. At least, not for anyone who enjoys action movies. There's nothing particularly exciting or interesting happening on screen.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with a memorable cast and good production values. The opening sequence shows us a scene from Texas where a Native American chief has been captured by a band of cowboys. They are in pursuit of an escaped convict, who leads them straight to his home. I'll admit that I wasn't very high on this film, but if you liked the original, it may be worth a try. However, this isn't much of a sequel either.

it's the best movie i have ever seen!!!!!! i just love them!! i watch it every day! i have the episodes from the internet! here in Romania is being broadcast the 6 season! i'm happy that i have seen the show from the beginning and i'm glad that through the internet i can see the 7 season. until now, season 5 is my favorite one :D i love it because Logan appears and the scene where they jump is my favorite. i have liked Dean too, but Logan is best.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

spoiler -- In 1993 , African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with another action-drama that could only be described as "black" because it was made by a black director and star. You know what to expect. There's nothing good here. First of all, the acting is laughable. You've seen people who have great talent, and then they put it all together and get really bad. Secondly, this film has no plot line whatsoever. The characters aren't connected at all.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction. This is what today's documentaries are all about. It's refreshing to watch something so personal, honest and real. Mr. Block's thoughts, opinions and disclosure are rarely seen these days and are incredibly well displayed here. It's a fine line to walk between personal truth and exploitation. This film treads very carefully and quite successfully.One would think that learning about how a seemingly normal couple falls short of society's expectations would give birth to pessimism...but it doesn't. Quite the opposite: it made me feel good.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . Why is it that I cannot tell a story of people and their relationships to the things that make them human? I know they exist because I grew up with them, but why have I never heard of a black person who knows how to love? This film has really gotten out of control. The dialogue was so silly that I couldn't remember much of what it was about until after I watched it. This is not a documentary though - it's basically a rerun of a popular sitcom.

The most beautiful film . If one is looking for serious depth , meaning and excellent performance then you have got to see this one. And that is the important thing.I just can`t believe I did not like this film. All I can say is that there are many great movies in the world, a very good one will make you feel something, but not this movie. It seems that everybody who watches it thinks "This is a great movie". It would have been better to have given it a 2 or 3 star rating if it wasn't such an awful movie.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / did n't understand this wonderful film . What a sad life he must lead. He could have written a better review ! It is one of those movies I would recommend to anyone who doesn't like horror films, especially ones that are set in a real world setting. It is so easy to get sucked into the weirdness of it. It starts out innocently enough when a family moves into a secluded cabin at the edge of the woods. After a while you realize there is more to it than meets the eye.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right . And when it goes wrong ... I 'd rather sit around in a corner for a while and stare at my phone than spend the next half hour watching this film again. I thought this might be a great movie to get some laughs, but didn't expect much. A lot of good jokes in here, but nothing that was going to keep me coming back. Maybe it was just the weather, but there wasn't a single thunderstorm in the entire movie!

King of Queens is comic genius . Kevin James , whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny , and the acting is top notch . I had a hunch that these would be great comedies to watch, and I am glad I waited until this movie was released. "Lucky 7" is one of those movies where you can really tell what's going on without any dialog at all. The plot is simple - the family of a guy (played by Kevin James) falls into a river when their boat gets lost in the jungle.

Unlike some of the former commentators, I was (and am) an avid fan of the Carpenters. Face it, Christmas would never be Christmas without The Carpenters. That said, I believe the movie did a good, not excellent, job at depicting Karen's life. The movie was enjoyable to see on primetime TV, but the content fell a little short. I suggest that you all look into getting some of the Carpenters specials that were shown in the 70's. You cannot believe how awesome a drummer Karen was. Cynthia did not capture the extent of Karen's talent.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What do I mean ? This movie has nothing to do with the Duke movies in the sense that it's completely non-historical. It's about a group of young men from the East Coast who go to Texas for the weekend to help build a dam. One of them ends up taking care of some Native American boys while the other goes fishing. As they're talking, a car pulls up in their driveway and the driver tells them to "get rid of the sonofabitch".

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time with this rubbish. The whole plot is stupid, ridiculous and just plain bad. It makes no sense at all and makes me wish I was dead. I know there are some people on this board that will say something along the lines of "Well I don't give a f-ck about anime". And they're right, but let's not go there. That wouldn't be much of a review anyways. My question to everyone is this: Do you ever watch anime?

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Most of the gore was done well , it wasn't overbearing or in any way "tough". The actors all had good lines and acted like normal people. The only reason I watched this movie was because I wanted to be able to find out what happened to my brother-in-law, who disappeared without a trace several days after watching this movie. I didn't know what to think about it when I saw it on television. Did it really take place during a zombie outbreak?

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. My interest has recently been rekindled by visiting Hilton Head - the next island over from "Yamacraw" (Daufuskie actually), and reading Pat Conroy's excellent "The Water is Wide". With the benefit of knowledge I have reappraised Conrack and consider it a masterpiece. Jon Voight captures the spirit of Conroy and the atmosphere of the film brings the book to life with some accuracy - a Hollywood rarity. Three things still strike me about this tale: 1.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday (4 February, 2006)and came away with a better understanding of what schizophrenia patients and their loved ones go through.Ms Aparna Sen must be congratulated for not only taking on a difficult subject, but also treating the mentally challenged with a deep understanding of their predicament that is necessary to help them cope with the trauma of disorientation, hallucinations and the storm of turmoil raging in their minds.We have had Hollywood movies on this subject such as "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" where Jack Nicholson carried away the honours.

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends . After we watched it the other night , we decided we wanted to catch up on what we had missed before. The first 3 films were all good movies and this one was really interesting. I will be giving it an 8/10. I've read the comments and enjoyed most of them. Some have said this movie isn't real, but I don't disagree with those people. You are right. This is just a movie.

Based on Mika Waltari 's Book , This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color , beautiful soundtracks and wonderful animation. The story itself is a mystery wrapped in a mystery .The first time I saw this movie I was hooked. It really was a mind boggling film. This movie is good. I'm not sure if it should be described as a bad movie or an acceptable movie. It does have some weak points, mainly that the ending is so lame that it can almost be considered a waste of time and effort.

There are a few things in life that we can't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. Especially if we're living in a foreign country and in a apartment with 6 wackos from 6 different countries. Xavier the main character leaves his tidy life in Paris, his ex-hippy mother and his beautiful girlfriend and goes to Barcelona to study spanish in order to get a job at the embassy. He falls in love with the wife of a french doctor and he makes friends that make him look at things differently.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations, discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional dramas and over-the-top acting.Once in a while, movies like 15 Park Avenue come by and sweep you off your feet.The movie grasps your attention pretty early on and there is no moment to rest after that. Aparna Sen has done a wonderful job of gluing the audience to every line of the movie. The impeccable character development, "just right" amount of emotions and an enigmatic end to match it all...I have a renewed respect for Konkana Sen Sharma, who convincingly plays the schizophrenic Mithi.

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday ( 4 February , 2006 ) and came away with a great deal of confusion about what actually happened. The story is not very interesting. The plot is one of the weakest parts of this movie. It seems as though someone decided to put all the most boring characters together and then had them explain how they found each other and how they ended up where they were. I have seen so many movies where everything just happens - that it makes no sense whatsoever, but here, there is no reason why people are supposed to live in harmony.

I LOVE this movie. and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore. I think they should definitely put Susie Q back on the air at least one night so we can record it!!! but if not does anyone know where I can find it?? my email is cristin6891@aim.com please email me if you know where i can find this movie. Online, or anywhere. I told my kids about this movie and i think that they deserve to see it also. All these Disney movies that are coming out now are fake and boring.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks . Marjorie Main ( Ma ) steals the show with this film. If I could have had two hours for one movie, this would be my #1 pick. First of all; it was really well done in terms of the acting. Secondly, the special effects were great. However; that is not what made me want to go back to see this again. There were several moments in the movie that made me wonder: why did they do this? Why did they make this?

Blue Planet... Wow... Where do I begin? The years of hard work paid off in what is, without question, one of the best documentaries ever created.The sights and sounds presented in Blue Planet, like most documentaries with the Attenborough stamp, are rare and haven't even experienced by most people. That alone should be enough reason to buy this series, especially if you're the curious type who 'wants to know'.Blue Planet is not a perfect documentary, however. It does get a bit repetitive after the 3rd episode.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford 's best in my opinion . No major stars , but pretty much everyone who appeared was either a good or at least decent. I think that, while the story isn't great (not even close), it would have had more depth if the characters were more complex. It is just an action film with bad special effects, no suspense, and very weak characterisation.The plot is very simple: A bunch of Indians want to get back to their traditional way of life. They are killed by white settlers.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made, "Murder in the Music Hall" seems to have undeservably faded into oblivion. A shame, because this lusciously produced, expertly directed and written, and crafty mystery-suspense item spins an enticing whodunnit thriller against the setting of Radio City Music Hall. A murder in one of the building's posh penthouse apartments casts suspicion on the luscious Rockettes--among them, Vera Ralston (who besides giving an appealing performance of subtlety and vulnerablity, provides a few dazzling ice-skating production numbers), Helen Walker, Ann Rutherford, Julie Bishop, and several other delectable B-movie starlets of the '40s.

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again ( because I 'd missed it so much, and thought that it would be really interesting if they were just going to shoot the movie in a different way and get better results )
Okay, I'm disappointed that this film is such an underwhelming product. The acting is pretty good, especially the two leads. The cinematography is great, the dialog is clear and not rushed or forced. The music is very well done, as are some of the effects work.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings. In Europe for example we've had years of war and though one nation could never eradicate the other, the old enemies always ended living next to each other or WITH each other at the end of the conflict. In the US, the immigrants white population exterminated the aboriginal population to near extinction. the US citizen never had to live with its enemy. This explains in my view the often simplistic nature of Hollywood movie when they try and explain a foreign country's strife.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest; however, it turns out that a lot of them were actually pretty damn interesting! I have watched about 80 of the bad films on this site, and most of them are really bad. Most of the time, I don't see how someone could watch an 80-minute long film and be entertained by it. However, this film was not only one of the worst things I've seen but one of the most poorly made.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is. This is the true story of one woman and one man and their quest for happiness amid the dull, rote life of a housewife and "man of the house". It could be any couple, any family, in any town... but that's what makes the story so moving. It touches each of us in some way and reminds us of someone we know and love, or of ourselves. I laughed, I cried, I couldn't stop thinking about it... and what more could you ask for from a film, really?

With Nurse Betty ( 2000 ) , acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute ( In the Company of Men , Yours, etc. ) came across some very strange images on his computer which he had obtained from a DVD. He decided to investigate and found himself in a world of horror that would have been unthinkable just a decade earlier.The film follows a mysterious figure who suddenly shows up out of nowhere and kills everyone around him without any apparent motive. Some people believe it to be a hoax but others are convinced that something far more disturbing is going on here.

I too saw this movie when it first came out . I was a teenager at the time , and I remember thinking it was very good. But after seeing this, I realized it was not for me at all. I really did not enjoy it . I don't know what I expected from such an "adult" film that took place in high school. This film has a lot of promise. The problem is that it simply fails to deliver on its promise. If you've seen a couple of bad movies before, you'd know what I'm talking about.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous music composer. It's too bad he doesn't seem to get any credit for it either. There are several reasons I decided to see this film, the biggest reason being my love of comedy and movies. In all honesty I can only think that this film got its name from one line in the plot: "Whoa! Whoa!" However, if you really like comedy films then this movie is for you.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film . The backwoods slasher pretty much started to fall off its pedestal. People were starting to turn away from this type of gore. This is one of those films I don't think I've ever seen, which is a shame because I liked it. When I say "it", I mean that there is just absolutely no plot whatsoever. What you have is a group of teenage boys going to high school on a Saturday morning. They walk through the woods for some reason, go to a diner and get drunk.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should just have a commercial when you see it . What a disappointment. This is one of the worst things I have ever experienced as a film producer. The story is laughable, there's not much in it, the characters are all boring and poorly developed, etc. There is really no story at all, other than that "Beverly Hills Chihuahua wants to go back to Mexico City". The only good thing I've seen about this movie is that it can be watched on a DVD from the library.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , you feel like you were really there . In this movie, the lead character gets kidnapped in the jungle. The only thing he has to do is to find his kidnapper. But before he can do anything, he runs into some kind of crazy woman who turns out to have a brother. As soon as he goes to meet with the kidnapper, her brother appears and beats him up. I don't remember what happened to the female lead's brother during the whole movie.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old , ( having an existing interest in science fiction ) and I can say from my own personal experiences that if it has a story that is not compelling enough for you to sit through the movie, DO NOT SPOIL IT! There is a lot of cool action shots that don't really add up, and the ending is a bit of a letdown. The acting is pretty bad, but nothing too terrible.It would probably be better to skip this film unless you're a sci fi/fantasy loving kid.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "the murder mystery", as the addition of sound to films helped to make a more faithful translation to film of what the audiences experienced in the original plays. And since horror films were very popular in those years, by enhancing the horror elements of the plots the murder mystery films experienced a popularity almost equal to what it enjoyed in the previous decade (in which the first movies of the genre were produced).

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award show because it lacks in certain areas. I cannot think of a single instance of what I would consider a good story line that happens in this show, where the storyline is interesting. This was terrible. The only redeeming qualities I can see was the music, though it sounded so lame it didn't get any points for originality! I'm not sure how anyone could have written something like this.The only thing I liked about this movie was the ending.

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it's rabbit season. But, you guessed it - it's really duck season. Elmer Fudd appears: he's the only hunter dumb enough to fall for the gag.He's even dumber than that. When Bugs Bunny strides up to him and asks how the rabbit hunting is going, Elmer admits that he hasn't seen a rabbit yet. This is more than Daffy can stand. He emerges from his hiding place and immediately points to a rabbit: Bugs Bunny. "Shoot him now!"

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney, Australia, following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Jimmy, (Heath Ledger), who bundles a job for a local gangster and needs to make amend before they get to him. The gangsters, (led by Bryan Brown), are a menacing bunch with a humorous streak in them. That's what makes the film work, because we always view gangsters as a rough bunch out to screw you badly. But this mob tickle your funny bone as well. A clever structured script by Jordan has characters crossing paths and getting caught in the web plot.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets seem to be recycled from the first two films.The plot seems to be about a thief who wants to get his stolen art back. The thing is, they don't think he can get the art back due to a curse that has been set on him in the past. WOW! What a disappointing film this is. The story is very interesting, but it just falls flat. The characters are all cardboard cut outs and no chemistry between them.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances . I just read a user comment concerning this film that sums up most of the points I made. I would give this movie another chance if I saw it after having seen "Journey To The Bottom Of The Well". I have to be honest with you: I was surprised by all the positive comments in this review, but even more surprised by some of the negative comments. It's hard to believe how bad this movie is!The acting was pretty good though.

America's next top model is a good show, it helps people with their careers, but lately i have become bored with it.cycle 1: yeah I'm happy Adrienne won, i wanted her to win from the beginning.cycle 2: its too bad, i think Mercedes deserved it.cycle 3: i did not like Eva, but i did not like most of the girls in this cycle.cycle 4: Kahlen should have won. i don't know what they saw in Naima, but i definitely know what they saw in Kahlen.cycle 5: like cycle 3, this was not a great cycle either.

"The Honkers" is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time. When we were shooting, everyone connected with the production figured that Slim was Academy Award material. Unfortunately, United Artists had a James Bond picture in release at the same time and did not devote much attention to "The Honkers". I personally feel this film was under-rated by most critics. Sam Peckinpaw's "Junior Bonner" was out at the same time and seemed to impress the critics more than our film. Also, Cliff Robertson had a rodeo film out a few months before our release and that might have hurt us, too.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film 's lead character. It seems appropriate for the city, as it is very much an under-rated film. I loved it, though it did take me three tries to get through one of the first scenes, but I was glad I did. I don't have too much time left to write about this film, so i'll try to sum it up as best i possibly can. It starts out with a gangland killing and gets even more intense in the last couple of minutes.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . I have seen both of them, and I am glad I watched them at a theater. Tombstone however, is definitely one for the serious film buffs. I don't like it that much in fact I think it has some minor flaws. In the first place, I just wish this movie were more about "The Great Train Robbery", rather than trying to show the world the atrocities of the war between Spain and Mexico.

Jimmy ( Heath Ledger ) is given a simple job by Pando ( Bryan Brown ) a underworld kingpin to find the owner of a stolen motorcycle who was recently killed. This movie, despite its mediocre writing and acting, managed to grab my interest. But unfortunately I couldn't keep up with it.It starts out well enough. It follows a group of kids that have been running around in a forest for three days looking for an amulet. The kids think they will be able to get back home in time if they can locate the amulet.

Despite all it's trappings of style and cinematic invention, this is basically another serial killer thriller, following the same sort of plotline favoured by such old favourites as Silence of the Lambs ? team of cops follows the trail of (particularly nasty) murders, someone else gets taken and they somehow have to find out where they are before it's too late. Only in this case, the only person who knows, the killer himself (powerfully played by Vincent D'Onofrio) is in a coma and we need psychologist Jennifer Lopez' sci-fi mind-meld machine to get into his head and force him to tell all.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris . We 're all here on an exchange trip and watched it on a couch. I really hate movies, so I didn't feel like turning it off. Anyway the story is about an old-timey French man who becomes obsessed with a little girl who lives with her aunt. Of course he thinks she is a witch because she does magic tricks. If I were you I would watch this when you have nothing else to do. It is just that good.

`` Side Show '' is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures . Very gory in spots and some scenes are very disturbing. I'm afraid that this movie contains more gore and blood than the films I like to watch. Don't watch this one. Why? Because I have seen all of it before! I think the only reason I can get out of it is because I just can't wait to hear someone screaming for help when they find themselves in a room full of dead people.

I'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of Black Snake Moan. It's not about black/white relationships or old/young relationships, though I think director Craig Brewer deliberately threw in both elements to tweak imagined taboos. It's not about sexual abuse or sex addiction, though Christina Ricci's character, Rae, typifies those. It's not about folk religion in the black community, though religion plays a large role. It's not a love story, though there are not one, but two happy couples at the end.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best summarizes the experience I have had at this place since I came here was TERRIBLE ! You could almost get the feeling that it is run by people with no idea how to do their job ! The manager told me that there were so many people in line and they didn't need to wait like they normally do as the line kept growing. This place is terrible ! This is an excellent little movie for kids ages 10 and under.

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has some of the worst lines in cinema history . It starts with a bad script, a bunch of stupid characters trying to save each other from one disaster. Then you find out what's really wrong with it - they have no idea what makes this movie special.They're just trying to save money on popcorn and paper towels. I mean seriously? When is something going to change? Somebody should tell this movie director that nobody cares how much money they make off of it.

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

Minor spoilers follow, but nothing you won't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a wonderful central performance from Renée Zellweger, Nurse Betty is a dark yet deceptively good-natured comedy.Suffering from an emotional and mental breakdown after witnessing her sleazy husband's murder, already-troubled and desperately unhappy waitress Betty becomes convinced a character on her favourite daytime soap is her long-lost fiancé and sets off from Kansas to Hollywood to find him.Instead of making jokes at the expense of Betty's mental state, writer John C. Richards is very sympathetic, with Zellweger portraying her as a lost innocent, not entirely helpless but tragically vulnerable nonetheless.

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season was released i had to buy it just to see what's the deal. This is by far the worst show I have watched in a long time. It's not bad by any means. I can't believe Fox decided to go for something with such a dull title as "Dumb Show" (a term I don't understand either).It's hard to find a single positive thing to say about this show.

Brian (Wesley Eure) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton (Conrad Bain). The Norton firm is in financial trouble for, unknown to the owner, he has an employee who is selling secrets to a rival firm's owner (Jim Bacchus). It's not Brian, as he is a loyal and faithful employee and a good inventor. But, Mr. Norton has no patience with Brian, in part because Norton's beautiful daughter, Casey (Valerie Bertinelli) has a thing for Brian and Norton questions Brian's motives for wooing her.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V. and came across this film. I don't ever remember seeing this or hearing of it. What a fun and interesting one to watch. Well, my meeting was pushed back, because I couldn't get out of this film. It had some real interesting things in it that marked it's time in history, and some fun things that they don't have people do in today's film because it's not pretty. Well, there was a lot of realism in it.

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II." Then years later, along came Book III, "HEAVEN & HELL - NORTH & SOUTH - BOOK III." FINALLY, the last installment came for the on-going saga of the Maine and Hazard families. I was so enraptured by this series that I taped each part off of TV and then managed to get family and friends hooked and I watched it AGAIN, each time someone new wanted to see them.

I have n't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way. I went into the theater with very mixed feelings about this film. As I was leaving, I heard the song "Babes" play over the credits. I looked around for the movie, then realized I couldn't find it on my local Video rental store. So I ordered the DVD at a discount and sat back and waited patiently as the credits played. A friend of mine took me to see this movie. It wasn't very bad, but it had some cool special effects.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50's, along with my other favourite, Land of the Pharaohs". The sets and colours are just wonderful and everything seems so "neat" in the production quality. I thought Victor Mature was well cast and Peter Ustinov a real gem! The whole look of the movie (along with others made in this era) has an appeal that you just don't get with modern movies with all their digitized effects (I have yet to see the 1999 movie "The Mummy but am sure I will love it!

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn`t get to see the original teleplay untill a few days ago and this is far superior to the sequel . Okay it`s not a million miles away from the plot of SEVEN but it`s still compelling . Much of my praise has to do with Ken Stott`s performance as DCI Red Metcalfe a policeman who seems to have led a very unlucky life and someone who has a terrible secret . It`d be easy for Stott to go over the top but he plays the role in a fairly subtle way .

then you will be a big fan of this movie. Its almost the same basic concept, a nice mixture of music, soul, and drama. I'll admit, i was a little aprehensive about seeing this movie, I had only seen previews of a white trash girl chained to a radiator, but I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson and I enjoyed Hustle & Flow so i thought I would give it a chance.I'm very glad that I did. It turned out to be more than just the surface story of a nymphomaniac southern girl being imprisoned by a 60 year old black man.

I Love this movie! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie, but I really disagree. The comedy is classic Mel Brooks style and the actors were superbly chosen. This was my first exposure to Cary Elwes, and Dave Chappelle and what a first impression they made. Cary Elwes shines as Robin Hood, the only British Robin Hood mind you. He has great comedic timing and the right attitude for this type of film. Dave Chappelle is obviously much bigger now, but at the time this was his first movie and he did an outstanding job as Achoo.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film! I enjoyed it.. its a sci fi film, if you want a thriller watch another channel.. This is what the scifi lovers want. Excellently produced by one of Sci-fi's best producers Scot Vandiver ! OK the special effects weren't excellent, but what a great cast! Some more money could have been used for effects but then again what sci fi has high budgeted effects. Stop complaining and change the channel if you don't like these type of films..

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film . I had just seen the MOOG docudrama "Babe", and thought it was a great film. This film is not as good as the other MOOG docu's i've seen in the past like "No Mercy", but it's still a very entertaining film.The production quality of this film is rather average, and the actors look to be cast from the local high school drama department. I didn't know where to begin when I went into this film. There was too much hype for me to let it pass on my own.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies , and this is actually the second time in my life that I've done this, but I still can't get into it. The plot is so weak and stupid, that I can't believe it was ever even made. What a shame! The characters are really bland and have little or no real depth. The most depressing movie I saw in a long time. This movie tells a story about an 8-year-old boy who goes to visit his relatives in the country.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world as secretaries. This follows the same idea as THREE COINS IN A FOUNTAIN a few years before. This takes place in New York while COINS takes place in Rome, Italy. Our three beauties are Hope Lange, in her first starring role, Suzy Parker and Diane Baker. Lange does well and holds her own opposite some strong veterans in the business, namely Joan Crawford. Suzy plays an obsessive woman who has a hard time losing her beau.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys , but providing a very amusing description of them that made us laugh so hard. I'm sorry if this review was harsh. This film is one of those "funny-as-hell" movies I've been meaning to watch, and I just got my hands on it. The premise of the film is simple enough: an interracial couple is in a remote cabin in the woods where they try to escape from each other. The problem is that this couple's situation is all too common.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight (Midnight Cowboy, Coming Home) has ever done, but a real tribute to teachers.Despite incredible odds, Pat Conroy (Voight) managed to reach a group of students and bring them from nowhere to a basic literacy and awareness of the world. His methods made be criticized by bureaucratic dinosaurs like Mr. Skeffington (Hume Cronyn), but teachers like Conroy will always be winners.Voight really showed that he had a love for teaching and that it was a natural high for him.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and, as mysteries should, keeps you guessing until the end and has several suspects to choose from.Many films from the Golden Age are not for all tastes, especially younger viewers. They date themselves by clothing, cars, settings, etc. Who nowadays asks for a highball? Or wears a suit and tie everywhere? And the legal process was so much simpler - must have been a dearth of lawyers back then. Frankly, much of value is missing from those days.In any case, go with it and enjoy.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary, it is obviously a labor of love and I think they did a pretty good job of putting together an enjoyable documentary about a person who has had so such little info available about him. It definitely has a fan worship feel about it, which is a good thing.I had heard of Bruce Haack but didn't know much about him, and I found the start of this documentary frustrating because I could hear other musicians talk about him, but Bruce Haack himself was kept way too far off in the distance.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance, women-on-the-verge psychodrama, work place sexual harassment, adultery, and fashion. It's all there. Typical characters found in corporate America. Joan Crawford is the usual long time employee bitch executive who feels the need to be such because she's with the big boys. Hope Lange is the entry level ambitious employee whose determined to get to the top by using her mind and not her body. Their personal lives is the subplot. Wardrobe for the film is great but someone forgot to tell Stephen Boyd's hairstylist that "a little dab will do ya!"

The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself. Simply awesome!! I wish this movie entered the Oscars. I cried through the whole movie for the schizophrenic character. ..The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself.

This is a "revised" Riverdance presentation, staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City. Of the three Irish "dance" musicals that I watched during the mid to late '90s (which includes the first "Riverdance" and "Lord of the Dance") I liked this one the best.I thought it was better than the original, held in Dublin, Ireland, because it adds segments that are mostly good, it has a more varied and colorful stage setting and it eliminated apiece for two from that original that wasn't good to begin with.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. It's got action, adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one (and a bit of zen thrown in for good measure). Like much Australian film, the plot is easy to follow yet wonderfully engaging, and Jordan should justly feel proud of his work.Anyway, it was on TV just now on Channel 4 in London, and my two favourite comedy scenes of not just this movie, but indeed any movie, had been cut out!

I did n't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn . I do n't know why I keep buying into these things but it keeps me coming back. The first thing you notice is the actors in this film are all excellent. So good, I would like to watch them all again. There was a little bit of plot twist at the end but it made sense. It was worth watching and the characters were pretty convincing. I liked the idea of being part of a group of people going on a trip.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game. This is the number one best TH game in the series. Next to Underground. It deserves strong love. It is an insane game. There are massive levels, massive unlockable characters... it's just a massive game. Waste your money on this game. This is the kind of money that is wasted properly. And even though graphics suck, thats doesn't make a game good. Actually, the graphics were good at the time. Today the graphics are crap. WHO CARES?

The `` Hunting Trilogy '' of Rabbit Fire ( 1951 ) , Rabbit Seasoning ( 1952 ) , and Duck Soup ( 1953 ) are all quite decent. It's a pity that the movie wasn't made much after this one, which could have had some good ideas about the Vietnam war. It is unfortunate that it didn't get made. I remember watching this on TV years ago, and I still find it funny to this day. The film has very poor acting and plot. A young man, played by Bill Murray, tries to save his mother but ends up killing a dog.

Susie Q. is one of those rare , and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling . It 's funny to me, but I guess not to everyone .I think I would have enjoyed it even better if they had tried to find out the truth in it . This is probably the most offensive movie I have ever seen. I don't know why anyone would do such a thing. The acting here is awful and there is no substance to the plot. I really want to slap myself in the face everytime I think about seeing this movie on TV.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of "slasher" movies in the early 1980's, that a few good ones might slip through the cracks. This is a great "rare" film from Jeff Lieberman, who insured his cult status with his memorable 1970's films "Squirm" and "Blue Sunshine".Five young people head into the Oregon mountains (this movie was actually shot on location) to do some camping and check out the deed to some land that one of them has acquired. Before long, they will predictably be terrorized by a bulky killer with an incredibly creepy wheezing laugh.

`` Stripperella '' is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones ( voiced by Pamela Anderson ) who dreams of becoming a supermodel. Her father is the boss of a fast-talking fashion designer who wants to get her in the industry and make his fortune. The problem is that she doesn't want to be there at all. I watched this with my friend when he was still in college and we were looking forward to getting a laugh out of it. We expected to be entertained for about five minutes. I was not expecting much.

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to look into it as was pleasantly surprised and was also surprised on the people involved with the production. If I remember correctly we had to watch it on a UHF station and this meant using a converter in those days UHF not part of regular TV to tune in the local station to watch the cartoon a big deal in those days which made the show even more mysterious. I remember all the sound effects that Gerald used to talk. A great memory from 50+ years ago.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim , California in the summer of 1981. He was impressed by the acting and especially that of Paul Newman, but he noted that he couldn't figure out why this film had been made. When I finally saw it again at the cinema several years later, I found it very difficult to understand exactly what the story was all about. The plot doesn't make any sense whatsoever and the characters seem like they could have been put together from different ideas.The special effects are laughable and the camera work is terrible.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies that I have seen in a long time. She steals the show, does her best to please everyone, and brings some of the best comedy moments I have ever seen on TV. I had heard of this before but I didn't really want to buy it because I'm not particularly fond of comedies like "Mrs. Doubtfire", "Mystic River" or "Couples Retreat". So what's a woman to do?

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC, or any big city of mid-century America. The colors, thecars, the clothes and the coming of the Womens Movement. It reflects thecomf-cozy attitudes of relationships between men and women in thecorporate world. In some ways, things gave changed and in others, theyhaven't changed at all. Women still want what men have today, but theynow have all sorts of laws and equality mandates to get it for them. Inmy opinion, beautiful women will still THROW themselves at men inpursuit of thier goals!

Robert Altman , Nicolas Roeg , John-Luc Goddard -- you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy.You got what you came here for. The cast is awful, there are no redeeming aspects to mention, and if you are really looking for an enjoyable popcorn flick (and I am not) you might find it at the back of this one. This film is horrible! There are no jokes, characters are uninspired, and the only reason I even bothered to give it a rating was because of the name of the director.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to seductress , I began to ponder what it might mean to "transition" into womanhood. It wasn't until much later that I knew exactly what that meant, and the more I thought about it the more I found myself wanting to scream and howl in joy at the absurdity of the movie. The characters were all extremely over the top, the whole notion of sex as an erotic experience just seemed like a fantasy to me. I don't remember ever finding this movie so revolting.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by his own wife's father, who also happens to be in the movie! This movie had a really bad script. This is not a horror flick, and there is no suspense, so that was a major problem. And I am sorry to say that even if I could watch this movie without having any sort of mental illness, I wouldn't be able to stay calm. The whole movie was ridiculous, unbelievable, and completely out of place.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch. She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of Harry (Mike Wagner) girl friend. Harry a robber down on his luck trying to make one more heist. Harry goes to a funeral where he meets Vittorio De Sica and takes him for a ride. When things don't work out on the ride they put there mines together to figure out the fastest way to get money. Harry and his gang decide with the help of Vittorio De Sica to from there on mob.

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood, this short film was pretty boring. The acting wasn't impressive, the background characters weren't especially likable, the story line wasn't very interesting and none of the special effects were that spectacular. Even though there were some good jokes in the film it was nothing special. I saw this film last night after watching an hour and half of the first season of Game Of Thrones. It didn't impress me much but I'm not sure why.
