Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns : 'The Gunfighter ' by Henry King , and 'Wagon Master' by Charles Boyer. Both were shot on location in Mexico City, one was filmed in the streets of the Mexican capital, whilst the other was set inside an abandoned mine where the locals look like people from the future. You may be a fan of any of these Westerns but here's a brief summary of why both movies were so successful. For those who know that I do not rate films based upon their plot, then there are no surprises here...this is a bad movie!

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bare pussy. I really like this movie! It is so well made and has an excellent cast. The premise of "The Muppets" is a classic one. A bunch of puppets go back to their home town and try to build a career out of it. What makes this even better, though, is the acting. There are several scenes that will leave your jaw hanging open until the very end, and they never fail to entertain.

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had there strong points.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , good acting by Tom Cruise and an excellent soundtrack . I bought the DVD when it came out a few years back. I was so pleased to see one of my favorite films being revived that I decided to purchase the complete version. I had high expectations, which are exceeded by this documentary. The film starts off with Tom Cruise making fun of himself while sitting in his car after a particularly bad movie he saw the previous night.

Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. Every single one seemed truly talented and knew how to act their way through a movie. I remember Friday nights and running to turn on the TV just to watch their newest movies. Susie Q was one of my all time favorites. I never forgot this movie. Even till this day when one mentions the song "Susie Q" I always remember the movie.

An extremely down-to-earth , well made and acted `` Rodeo '' Western . No gussied up stars needed here as these are all decent actors. My review is limited to this one, the reason being because it's a little slow for my tastes. It could've been better if there were more sex, but that doesn't take away what an entertaining western it was. The main problem with this film is the script, which suffers from some terrible writing, poor direction, bad cinematography, and just about every other fault of a script that gets passed off as a screenplay in most films nowadays.

See No Evil With Kane. The Movie Has a great storyline But it just wasn't a Hide my eye's, Scream Out Loud Horror Flick I thought it was going to be from watching the WWE Superstars on Monday Night Raw When The Movie First Came To Theaters. I Did ENJOY The Movie Though I Loved The Story It Played Out.GREAT MOVIE EXCELLENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A PART 2 It Doesn't Matter If Kane Gets Killed At The EndOr Not They Have Killed Off Other Horror Stars In Every Movie They Have Out And They Still Comeback For More So a part 2 wouldBe Very Interesting.

Come on. Anyone who doesn't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic's panel. They should not be allowed to be heard, because they obviously have no sense of humor whatsoever. Anyone who does not love this here animated cartoon directed by Tex Avery should be chained to a chair and forced to watch "Huckleberry Hound" episodes for 20 years straight! The takes and double-takes by the Wolf in this cartoon are the finest examples of this important past of comedy that have ever been captured on film. Tex Avery should receive a posthumous Academy Award for this cartoon.

The four signs on the road say "If You're Looking For Fun.....You Don't Need A Reason....All You Need Is A Gun....It's Rabbit Season! "In the woods, we see hundreds of "Rabbit Season" signs posted on every tree. We see more and more signs pointing exactly to Bugs Bunny's hole. Who's putting up all these signs? Daffy Duck!Daffy puts the last sign up, tiptoes away and says to us, the audience, "Awfully unsporting of me, I know.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning, and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has the best humor, you can identify with the characters, we talk about it at work a lot, because I work at a company a lot like IPS, (DHL) and we just love the Teamster plugs!! Carrie is my hero, she is the best, she just puts it out there, no matter what the subject is. Arthur well what can you say? He just cracks you up, and really puts a spin on things.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how this country really feels about its own culture . I didn't like it at all and I am not going to waste my time on it . I'm surprised I waited so long to see this film. This film starts out very weakly, then in the end gets interesting and exciting. The script has been written well with some interesting twists but they weren't done well.The acting isn't amazing either. There was nothing special about the acting and the only thing that stood out to me was the direction.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just look at the last few episodes then you will start to appreciate this show. I'm not an expert in sitcom history but I can tell you that there are no better comedies anywhere on television than this one.The plot line was simple but clever and well executed. The jokes were spot on, the actors were funny and the dialog was very amusing. The only problem I have with this show is that it never seemed to grow on me.

Ok , maybe Posse ca n't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies . But that 's because it did n't do what some people thought it would do. This was a boring movie, one that is too big for its own good and has very little story. The plot revolves around two cowboys who go to see a rodeo in Texas, where an Indian tribe kills their friend. This leads them into the wilderness and onto a horse trail which turns into a cattle ranch where they meet an old acquaintance from high school. The story goes on and on but there is not much action or suspense.

SPOILERS AHEAD -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - Mel has got it going on here -- and he's not kidding. This was an ok film to watch when I was a kid. It had its good moments like the music and scenery but overall wasn't worth the ticket price. The special effects were bad at best (not sure how that was possible in 1980) and the storyline was lame. Plus, it didn't last long enough to get me excited about seeing this particular movie. This movie is based on a book by H.G.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the `` big , blockbuster '' movies so that he could afford to have a little fun with it in the studio. The first film was no good, but later films were all much better. It is difficult to tell which films should be included in the `big', because I feel they have all been bad, but this one still deserves attention. Why is there anything wrong with an old lady being killed off by a bullet? Why are so many violent movies filmed at night?

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits. I had never seen this animated comedy until I saw the new DVD release. The show, while enjoyable, wasn't very good. It was not funny, and there wasn't enough action to get me through it. I am so sorry for your loss. We all grieve over those who have passed away as we do with those who have lost their lives. However, after watching the movie, I'm shocked at how much worse it was from start to finish.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it! It is so sweet and heartwarming, a real tear-jerker! I was still thinking about the story days after i'd seen the movie. It's such a beautiful story about the difficult things all families go through, it's something anybody can relate to. I really recommend this movie to anybody looking for a Saturday night rental. With your girlfriends, your family, your boyfriend, everyone will really enjoy it! :D It's a real story about a real family that would pull at anyones heartstrings.

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , and women are not allowed to work outside the home. I guess there are people that really want to make it a movie, but its boring and too long. It seems they can't let anything pass them by without some kind of reaction. Some of the lines seem so out of place, they should have been cut from the movie. What is the story? Why are all the men wearing helmets when they are supposed to be attacking the women?

In a time of bad , if not plain awful , comedies , King of Queens is more than just a funny one . I mean, you could make an excuse that it's about women, but then why did the producers go to all the trouble of putting a bunch of men together and have them pretend they're friends? Why do we watch this garbage ? It is full of terrible characters and even worse plot holes. There is no chemistry between the main guy and the little girl and there seems to be some weird rivalry between two guys over who is the funniest person in the whole film.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

This is the best movie I have ever seen . It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate .The plot is good .the acting is superb .it was a real thrill to see Michael Douglas do something as a big actor like he did in the movie. The ending is really great ! I didn't really watch this movie until I got into it on television at about midnight. A friend of mine said "Oh, it's gonna be so much fun when I go to see it in the theater". To which I replied "You've gotta be kidding!

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot, while still maintaining an efficient run-time. One of the clearest examples of this is the transition between poverty and wealth for the married medical couple. The audience is instantly transported from a shanty medical office to a luxurious suite at the city's most prestigious inn. This development is critical to understanding the position the doctors have been thrown into. The story suggests from the intro that these two people are generally happy with providing medical practice to those who are less fortunate.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I thought she would turn out good, and she was not so bad at all. But then I did my research and found out that she starred in `Battleship Potemkin,' where she played the villainess. It isn't often that an actress gets cast as the leading lady in a Hollywood-type production--but it is rarer still to find someone who actually looks like they're going to do something great in such an underwhelming project.

"Two Hands" is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life, surreal life, comedy, tragedy and love the Australians have developed on their own.Heath Ledger is basically a good if naive guy. Wanting to get on he falls in with a local "Big" Man Pando (Bryan Brown). But at the very moment he sets a first toe on the dark path to crime he meets Alex (Rose Byrne). Here is the cause of the error to change his life in ways unexpected.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) has ever had the pleasure of seeing, but possibly the best acting job he has ever had. It is hard to imagine anyone going through such an intense emotional rollercoaster being able to play someone who can convincingly portray a mentally unstable and sociopathic murderer. I'm sure there are plenty of people out there who have similar issues as we do in regards to psychopaths or murderers, but perhaps it might be even harder for them because they cannot relate.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area , and it was quite clear that most people were under the impression that it was some kind of political propaganda. That is clearly untrue. The film is, simply put, one of the most stupid and uninspired pieces of crap that I have ever seen. Not only is it an utter disgrace to the field of cinema (because it is completely unwatchable on a technical level), it is also devoid of even the most minimal of morals. What a horrible, disgusting waste of a talent.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that's the reason why it is my favorite movie. I was looking at a movie on the tube and I saw a movie called "American Girl'' and I had to have it. But when I showed it to my dad, he said it wasn't for him. I love this movie because it's not afraid to get dark and funny. What really makes this film unique is how well it blends in with the rest of the horror genre.

Fata Morgana is , by far , one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. It may have been made by people with a lot of money but somehow this film has gone largely unnoticed. I do not know why this was so, but you cannot expect to go to Spain and see a bunch of big budget movies for free. I did not enjoy this movie as much as some others. The premise sounds very good, yet there were parts that were absolutely awful. The acting was bad and the story was a complete mess.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms, I thought I would get them all done now. Dads Army, is my all time favourite sitcom, It ain't half hot Mum is also a classic as is You Rang M'Lord. I don't regard Hi De Hi as a classic, but it is still funny.It's about a holiday camp, similar to Butlins, but instead of red coats, it's yellow coats. It is ran by Jeffery Fairbrother, a well meaning man, but has the personality of a sock.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary , it is obviously a labor of love but I found it difficult to get into the movie. The subject matter was too intense for many, so some were not able to find the energy to even sit and watch. One reason I gave it only two stars is that I found it difficult to comprehend the meaning of the title 'Utopia'
I first heard the term "utopia" in the context of scientific research. I don't know which scientists or engineers would use the word today, but they didn't invent it.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

I couldn't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character. I laughed for days just thinking about this show. Having finally seen the pilot I guess I will stick around for a few more episodes. Assy is pretty funny and the whole crew of police show characters are around, but Assy is hard to understand and that was a little frustrating. Most of the humor revolves around the fact that the title character is literally a walking ass with nothing else but legs that sport socks with garters and feet with traditional wing tips.

The first time I saw `` Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy '' , was in the early Seventies. At that time this film was one of the greatest things about America. Nowadays, no one even knows where to begin when it comes to discussing the film. It was a perfect example of what Hollywood used to be capable of at the height of its fame. The entire cast were amazing. I would like to take this chance to thank Robert Altman for being my "first" American cinema experience.

This is what porn used to be, this is a true classic. I mean, it is an x-rated musical based on an actual book! There is a real plot to it and how many x-rated movies can boast that these days? This belongs in an exclusive short-list of true pornographic movie classics, including Debby Does Dallas, Deep Throat, and Behind the Green Door. I think the problem with "pornographic movies" these days is that it's all about the "pornographic" and not about the "movie".

With all the dreck out there, this is a gentle movie about young love. Yes, it's true that young love often makes more out of something than it deserves, but why aren't people down on "Romeo and Juliet"? Paul and Michelle are models of good behave compared to them.Yes, they run away, and set up an ideal life, but this is a movie, not real life. Paul is more sexually interested than Michelle, who has been come onto in a bad way. Eventually, they have sex, but no one is forced into it.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty Boop was very pretty and a good looking woman . Don't let the bad reviews scare you because this is one movie that makes you look forward to it's next installment . I will be seeing it again and will write a longer review if the movie turns out good . Okay, here's my problem with this film: It has no charm. In fact, I would go so far as to call it "boring."

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has! It was funny and creative; I wish my children and grandchildren could have seen it. It ranks right up there with Winky Dink - another favorite. I was pleased to find out that one of the creators later worked on Rocky and Bullwinkle. These early shows had a lot going for them that todays cartoons for kids don't have. Today's cartoons seem to push the idea that one needs something special, some magic formula or talent to be able to succeed against evil or dangerous circumstances.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17. The only good thing my father ever did (get us in). This is "our movie" and the music is "our songs". Michelle's song is "our" song. Yeah, nowadays, it's a crime to show naked children on the screen, but we were screwing at 16, why not these kids? The movie is- rich boy impregnates poor girl, then rich dad steals him away from her at the end, after she gives birth under impoverished conditions. She is left alone with child.

This show is really great. It's smart.It's funny.It's great acting and writing. This show is really the fastest show I've ever seen. The Dialogues are really funny and well acted. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel have a great chemistry.You really do believe they are mother and daughter. This show really showed that mother daughter relationships really don't have to be just mother and daughter, they can be best friends but on the same time it shows that it's really hard sometimes being more than just mother and daughter especially with Lorelai and Emily.

Michelle , Anicée Alvina , was so nice , and I really fall in love with her . She died at that film because of her poor acting , she acted like an idiot, I had to tell him that if he ever wants to be a director .I will recommend you this movie , just because of how good the acting was . My husband and I spent about half an hour watching it last night after work. It is by all accounts one of those films that takes itself too seriously--and we don't want any part of that.

This movie is Wonderful! I can watch it again and again. Robin hood is Perfectly cast, and Marian is beautiful. I personally think Marian's German man is the funniest character, along with Latrine and the Sheriff! While space balls got boring and stupid after a while, this one always keeps your interest! W O N D E R F U L This was a great film, and never gets boring. A great cast is in the roles, and it is spoofed perfectly, and makes so much sense, and can be watched again and again!

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for me, i just feel that I am missing something in life. The thing that makes me feel like there is so much more out there is the fact that we never really get to see anything else. We are told what to watch/listen to/see/do/buy/think about/know about. In the beginning of each season we start to see new characters and learn more about their lives and how they met. They meet all kinds of interesting people. Every week a new character would pop up that will bring a new experience to the show.

Wagon Master (1950) Dir: John Ford Production: Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings the stock company out into the Utah desert to film a western and comes out with this minor classic. No John Wayne, no conflicted anti-heroes, no psychological exploration, no fireworks, just a gem of a picture.This ensemble piece nominally stars Ben Johnson (as Travis) and Harry Carey Jr. (Sandy). They're horse traders who come into town to do some business just as a group of Mormons, led by Ward Bond, are being shown the exit.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best things I've seen all year. A man, a boy, and an old woman come together and save their town from being burned to the ground. It's actually pretty funny.The film was written by James Cameron (Avatar, Titanic, Terminator 2) and Patrick Swayze (Terminator 3, Highlander, Bad Boys). The original idea came from the writer of the first book in the series, which is also the subject matter of the TV movie version.

This show is really great . It 's smart.It 's funny.It 's great acting and writing . This show is one of the very best television shows I have ever seen. In fact, it was the most enjoyable TV show I have ever had to sit through. There's so much crap on TV these days, but there's still plenty of gems out there. Just when you think you've seen it all, some other show comes along and makes you believe again. That's what happens with this show. Every episode starts off as something like "Don't Look at Me!"

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. The producers did not try to create some happy ending that didn't exist. The lack of a happy ending would create agitation in the audience that, hopefully would spur them on to action. At least that's how it seemed at the time. In today's movie world this movie would probably not be done. There would, definitely, not be this ending, however realistic.

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we 're in a bigger hole than ever . That 's for sure'. But I do have to take some credit for the fact that the media seems to have learned a few important lessons from this one.The main message is that if you want to find out who will win the presidential debate, all you really need to do is watch what happens next. If you're looking for some serious political debate, look elsewhere. I watched this last night with my wife and was amazed at how bad it was.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect. Here Alice is a virginal librarian who falls down the rabbit hole and learns to love sex and her own self image. Made at the time when adult films were creative endeavors with plots instead of just a series of sex scenes, this is a good looking little movie more akin to the low budget films of its day. Despite what you may think this film actually has a good script with funny jokes and good songs. Its an naughty little tale for adults.

I could n't believe the eye candy from start to finish . Being a fan of movies directed by music videos I'm not surprised that this film is one of my least favorites but I cannot complain about what was provided . It's just so over the top. The movie is filled with too many explosions, too much gore and an ungodly amount of sexual violence . I don't know how they were able to pull off the whole plot line but I feel it was poorly written and acted . The ending wasn't even worth a paragraph as it was so cheesy and unnecessary.

On watching this film , I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. The lead actor plays the role of an uptight but loving family man (I won't spoil it for you). However, as soon as he leaves his wife and kids alone, the whole drama falls apart completely. You begin to get an impression of the guy being distant from his loved ones. My first thought was that this is going to be something like A Clockwork Orange with a dash of Dr Strangelove. Well, that just didn't happen.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address `` Mithi/Mithali '' ( Konkona ) is in search for from the movies beginning with `Lucky Son' to `Rashtriya', 'Yehuda Haimianu' and so on. I've seen this movie more times then I care to admit. Why? Well, I'd like to think that it's because it's an adaptation of a very funny Japanese comic book...but I don't believe that. Yes, there are some good lines in here. The story is entertaining. The acting is solid. But the animation isn't any better than anything else out there!

America 's next top model is a good show , it helps people with their careers , but lately i've had to say "wow" every time i see an attractive girl that looks like she's done something really wrong. The only thing I liked about this movie was the premise, because I'm sure its a good idea! If you don't mind a little cheesy science fiction (you're probably not one of those "scientists", anyway), this is a fantastic way to introduce new viewers to what can be a very interesting and entertaining science fiction genre.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring.

I 'm seen this documentary in its feature-form , in a movie theatre . And ... wouah ! The pictures on the screen did not make any sense to me. Why didn't they show us the people who worked on the project ? It doesn't make sense, it does not make any sense. You can say whatever you want to say, about what is wrong with this film, I won't dispute it, but I cannot accept it. I've seen many films by this director and have liked many of his work (including this one ).

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. For those of us lucky enough to have been at that age when this film came out we may have seen a little too much of this type of thing back in our formative years.It seems to me that this was released by Paramount Pictures to compete against 'Star Trek'. Well... I had just seen the second half of 'Star Trek' and thought "this show is just sooo stupid and boring! I'm not even a fan of science fiction, but this show just made me sick."

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a sequel to this film which has been so highly respected. It would have been great to see this movie get a second chance. I feel that the new cast should have gone with an updated version of the original. This is the most disappointing sequel I've seen since the first "The Godfather".It was supposed to be one of the greatest action/thriller movies ever, but instead, it just wasn't funny or interesting. It was actually very slow and had very little plot.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies, along with Spaceballs(although I will openly admit to not having watched many others, at least yet). It's very silly and thoroughly funny, there are hardly more than a few minutes throughout the entire two hour run-time, where you aren't entertained. Almost all of the gags have a great comical effect, few of them fall flat. I saw this movie right after seeing and reviewing Spy Hard, and comparing these two spoof movies, I realize exactly of how high quality this movie really is.

The entire series, not just The Blue Planet, is nothing short of amazing. The best nature series we have ever seen. The episode on the deep is like traveling to outer space! We have watched this with our 10 and 7 year old boys and all four of us have not been able to pull away. We read a negative comment on this and could not believe it. There is so much new information that we never learned in school. Its also the best view we have seen from any television or movie into the delicate balance of our earth's eco-system.

The first time I saw "Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy", was in the early '80 in a Movie-Theater in N.Y. City with some friends. I remember we actually enjoyed it very much, although we were left wondering why all the "goodies" were covered by in various forms shaped colored patches and why the movie was suddenly jumping from one scene to the next one, leaving us guessing...what we just missed. Obviously it was the soft-core edited (chopped) version, which left me with the desire to watch it again soon, but in its original integral version.

I Love this movie ! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie , but i saw it first and i had to like it ! It's funny, its well made , and the acting was very good ! This is an excellent comedy. I didn't get to see the entire movie, but from what I've been able to read on the internet, there were at least ten different versions of the script. The only thing that stands out for me in this version are the characters.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film. To have it totally wash over you, so that you absorb it as it is, and thus, experience it to the fullest. Every time I see it, 'The Egyptian' is such a film. Over the years it is a picture critics have loved to hate. Many have thrown darts at its vulnerabilities. But perhaps it is because of the very tone the film brings with it rather than its most obvious characteristics. It is at once forbidding, remote, possibly dangerous; beware of what lies within!

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for "Once Upon A Time in the West" but couldn't persuade Clint Eastwood to appear in. Three tough-looking gunfighters ride into a town. One is dressed like the Man with No Name in a poncho. Another is dressed like Colonel Mortimer from "For A Few Dollars More," and the third is garbed like Django, except he rides a horse instead of pulls a coffin behind him with a machine gun in it. Our hero meets them in Main Street behind a wagon loaded with three coffins.

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in which an old woman who tries to take care of a little boy by feeding him food that she has taken from him . She does this until he grows too much and then she eats him. That was my problem with it . I liked her at times but when she tried to please me I just didnt want to see it anymore . The director decided to cut that scene and replace it with one of her trying to do the same thing with another young boy, but what a different ending !

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person's past? this film was very disturbing to watch in the sense that it was a true story and to think that humanity is still so cruel after all these years makes me ashamed everyone is human and everyone has the right to live their life in peace and harmony live and let liveif anyone knows the quote please let me know Thank youthis film should be shown a lot more publicly as true events as horrific as these shown in the film should be known to all in the hope that things will change sooner rather than later.

Style over substance. But what a style it is. "The Cell" is the internal version of most serial killer movies. Unfortunately, the story hardly supports the visuals.Psychotherapist Catherine Deane (J-Lo) goes into her patients' dreams via artificial means to discover and help them over come their phobias and obsessions. A new patient whose fallen into a coma, is brought to her attention by the FBI. He's a serial killer who drowns his female victims then poses their bodies in grotesque scenarios like mannequins. Deane must enter the killer's mind and navigate through his sick fantasies in order to find and save his latest victim.

Okay , where to begin . Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous actors and actresses who refused to play them, and so they had to create their own voice over. Yes, you read this correctly! I was so excited for this film, but not expecting it to be so terrible. The plot is about a guy who tries to win back his fiancee, who's been cheating on her with another man. What do you expect, right? That kind of premise could get any film made by any production company.

America 's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense . It has a great hostess , a great casting team, and it's not too hard to get a group of teenagers together and watch them do their best. But what happened the first time the contestants went out to buy clothes? They looked like this :
The producers could have made any contestant look better on television by hiring an actress or a model or even a professional makeup artist who would have been paid more than they would make doing the show. I can't tell you how much money I wasted buying all those clothes.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait until 9:00pm to watch my favorite sports team. That has not stopped us from making it work for you. This movie is awful. A bunch of kids try to kill one another because they have nothing better to do all night. It's kind of like watching a horror movie, except that the zombies are in the form of people who actually live with them, not the ones who just woke up from a coma.The only good thing about this movie was the acting.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film. The first act is quite good, but after that the pacing gets rather slow and the film starts to fall into a kind of slasher mode (which I don't understand ). It's only when it's about to start that you finally get to see what the film is really trying to convey . I am sorry to disappoint those of you who like films that deal with murder, violence, etc.

"Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. (well, I did blink) It can be sad, funny, or addicting. (mostly addicting)"America's Next Top Model" kept me wanting more and that's pretty much the point. It is also on more that one channel. Sometimes it's on MTV other times it's not. I hope it gets more fans and grows to be a hit series!

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's naked self are really good, but there is one major flaw on this film that I have encountered several times. I recently bought this movie as a Christmas gift to myself after seeing it during the Sundance Film Festival. I was very pleasantly surprised by how much fun it was. After watching it, however, I decided to buy it again for my sister because I wanted something else to watch (even though I love horror movies).

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student who comes to London to become a playwright.The script is not well adapted and it is rather hard to watch, but what does not matter. I was really surprised at this movie. Some of the ideas are very good but I didn't follow the story at all. The plot starts with two students who meet in London (and there's lots of romance) and move into the same house. It's not long before things start falling apart between the two men and the teacher finds out about it.

This was a pretty good episode . Though no `` Trapped in the Closet '' or `` Cartoon Wars ,'' this is the one where they did the same thing again. I mean, we can't even do that. Some people think it's funny to make a whole bunch of kids look like they are from another planet. If you think there's nothing wrong with that, wait until you see the first half of this abomination. This is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life and I am proud of it. It just isn't funny.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross. The main plot line involves a group of thugs attempting to steal $10 million from a rich family. This is played out with a little bit of comedy mixed into the mix, but the film itself is a fairly serious affair. The biggest complaint I am getting about this movie is the dialogue. In many ways, this script is a complete waste of time and talent. There is no substance or depth whatsoever in this script. At least there's no actual plot.

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story, Like someone you might have known. Just trying to make it, my big shot is right around the corner. Then Life's little temptations creep in, the spoiler, stumbled again. How much, can your love take, and give, to the guy who's really not so bad, after all, just Human. I liked it, I was also a paid extra in the movie. Played the drums in the bar shots, with the band, did several walking shots, my green 66' corvette was in the motel party shots.

"The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends," says Marion Fairlie, who with her half-sister, Laura, lives in a vast mid-Victorian country estate. "And last night I found myself in Limmeridge churchyard. Normally, people who are dead stay dead, just as normally it is the criminals who are locked up rather than the victims. But then, there was nothing normal about what happened to us..." And we're off on a first-class Gothic story of madness, deception and villainy, based on Wilkie Collins' great novel of Victorian mystery.

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

As a European, the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980's and the experiences I had living abroad and interacting with other nationalities, although the circumstances were slightly different. Klapisch (the director) went to the New York Film School from 1982-85, so one would think that he is drawing on this experience.It is interesting how the film balances the message that "one should not generalize" with the notion that "for every stereotype, there is some underlying truth". For example, the Italian character is based more on the pothead aspect than on any well-known Italian stereotype.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script, good camera work and transitions, good directing to handle some twists in the plot, good editing to keep the flow constant, and good acting. George Sanders is suave and witty. Jonathan Hale simply is Inspector Fernack. Paul Guilfoyle plays a mobster who goes straight (and drinks milk) because he cannot take the pressure. He will return in a later entry in the series. Story begins on an ocean liner headed to the U.S. where the Saint meets but cannot connect with Wendie Barrie.

This movie just might make you cooooo. The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town. Betty (Renee Zellweger)is the lone "acceptable" soap groupie out there. Her character is SO charming and SO convincing that you find yourself in forgiveness over her being such a goof. I might even allow myself to get lost in Bettys' adorable fantasy, if it weren't for the fact that Dr. Ravell's real name is George... And speak of the devil; "looker" Greg Kinnear fills his role VERY well.

Recently I saw this movie again (after 25 years). In the original there is a scene in the bathroom of an airplane during the landing between Jacqueline Bisset's character and Michael Brandon's character. The rented version did not have this scene in it. Did I imagine this?Or, is this part of the "clean up" of movies where some are altered to exclude portions some people think are not "appropriate"?I love this movie -- it is exactly like the friendship between a friend and I and we've been friends for 25 years and saw it together.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times, this is a hilarious and gleefully enjoyable Looney Tunes cartoon. The animation is wonderful, the backgrounds so detailed and a lot of audacious colouring too. The writing is razor sharp, and the sight gags especially Daffy constantly getting his head blown off are brilliantly timed. I really did love the arguments between Daffy and Bugs, and that Bugs wins every time. I also love it that Daffy is really greedy and nasty while being uproariously funny. I do prefer him when he's manic but he is great fun here too.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made, they lack the depth, and just not worth our time.The trailer of "Nasaan ka man" caught my attention, my daughter in law's and daughter's so we took time out to watch it this afternoon. The movie exceeded our expectations. The cinematography was very good, the story beautiful and the acting awesome. Jericho Rosales was really very good, so's Claudine Barretto. The fact that I despised Diether Ocampo proves he was effective at his role.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris. We're all here on an exchange program. We all laughed so hard cuz so much of what was going on in the movie happened to us! I mean yeah sure some of it was pretty clichéd but still true, know what I'm saying.I think I related more to the quiet guy (the Italian) than Xavier because I'm more of the observer in our group. Anyway, I wish I had a hot roommate like Cecile de France.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now. I figured I had seen all the other comedies on this list so no big deal. Turns out that was a big mistake. There are some great scenes in each episode but they were all intercut together. The only good one in my view is when Perry is trying to impress Croft, he makes it sound like he has an IQ of 120.I am sorry to say that this show does not deserve to be mentioned among the classics of funny television.

When I was engaged , my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores . He would look for his favorite stories in the shelves and read them while we were out and about. After a couple of weeks he came home and told me he didn't want to bother searching any more, and that he wished he could put this book into an adult book. Well it took me forever to find this story. I've been wanting to read it since college. When I finally did I kept wondering what all the fuss was about. Why was this movie so awful?

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie . My teen-agers enjoyed it over the years. This is one of the worst movies to ever make it's way out of the theaters. No, there are no happy endings in this movie but it did show us that the dark side of the human spirit does exist. What a waste of your hard-earned money. This movie is awful. You think it's a film made for teenagers? The acting is poor. It doesn't seem to care what happens to the young person they're showing it to.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really do n't approve of pornography all that much at all.This movie is no worse than most of the "B-Movies" in your local video rental store. The acting is okay, but not to the point of being horrible. It's been more than two years since my first viewing of this movie. It was so long ago that I don't know exactly what I'm supposed to think or feel about it anymore. If you are someone who likes gore movies with lots of action, then this might be an interesting experience.

This one started excellently . The photography and audio are the best I 've experienced in years ( okay , maybe that's a very generous word). It seems that the main problem with this movie is that the actors seem to know exactly where they are going but don't know how to get there. A few weeks ago, while watching an episode of "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous," I was left scratching my head as to why some of the more successful celebrities would take part in such a silly show.

Fantastic documentary. A movie within a movie. I'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother's death. Makes one wonder about the time and money spent in therapy. What might have happened if she didn't have that outlet? Did the therapist help her or just foster a dependency that kept his bank account flush? The audience needs to understand that divorce was less of an option in those days. She was a housewife - went to therapy instead of going to college or job training. She seemed to feel trapped by the situation.

This movie makes you think . It shows how a woman 's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others . It gives us a new idea of how to live and why we do our things . I am a little disappointed with this movie because it seems to be trying to be a romance but its very hard to tell when the love is supposed to be genuine or not. The main plotline is that a young girl wants to meet her older brother but they are unable to find each other , so they go on vacation.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

One of the better made for TV biopics , I just wish it had told us more . I have no real problem with a movie like this, but having no idea what might be going on behind the scenes makes the movie look amateurish and half-assed at best.It's true that the characters are mostly believable, but there were a few scenes in which one of the characters said things that really didn't make sense to me (he was speaking Spanish, after all). They were so poorly done they're embarrassing. The only thing that is good about it is the acting.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks ( Jamie Bartlett ) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo ( Chiwetel Ejiofor ) .A member of the National Police Force who has just been promoted to the rank of Major. He has been on the force for nearly two decades, since he is in his mid thirties. A long-time family man, he takes a break from his police job to help his wife and two children. I don't care what anyone else says. "The Good Son" was one of the most awful films I've ever seen. The acting and direction was atrocious.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way ! ! When I first tuned in to America 's Next Top Model in 1999, I had high expectations for this show. But after viewing it more than a hundred episodes, I've realized that I was wrong. The show just does not come across as entertaining at all. It feels like it's been filmed on a low budget and that the cast and writers were just following along. If you don't know how to do a good job, what's the purpose of being a star?

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . This movie is one of the most disappointing and least enjoyable I have ever come across in all my years of film studies. The premise is just too implausible and impossible to believe. There is so much potential for good story line and interesting characters but it seems to be totally lost in the script. The characters are completely uninteresting (except for maybe the villain, whom you can forgive because he is well written and has a lot going for him! ).

This comment discusses "North and South Book I" dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is mostly identified by people with the Civil War (1861-1865). This is a reasonable opinion because that was Civil War which put the Union under the severe test; that was the Civil War which made Americans realize how precious it is to live in peace; finally, that was this period which at last brought the end to the shameful system of slavery. From the birth of motion pictures, there were people who adapted that time onto screen.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film. However there are a few flaws in this film. One of the problems with the plot was that not enough time was given to explain what it was we were seeing. In other words, we don't know what's going on. This also affected the acting as the actors struggled to express their feelings about these alien creatures. This is an entertaining little horror/drama. There's only one problem - its too slow for your average filmgoer.

The above summary really is n't meant as a slam against this film , as the series followed a very similar structure. Some might think this is an adaptation of a novel, and while that is possible, it has been proven in other series that not every aspect of a novel will translate perfectly into a film.I would like to point out that I have never watched the whole series, nor have I seen a full episode of the TV series. So if you are interested in seeing the films first, please go watch them on Netflix or your preferred streaming website.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story  "the world has ended and you are in the future"  don't get carried away, just enjoy. I liked the movie...it was about a girl trying to solve the mystery of her mother's death. She goes from town to town and tries to do everything possible to find out what really happened to her parents. It seems she meets a good guy and starts having some real fun. But, it is not all fun and games!

I just watched this movie on it 's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia . I liked (or was reminded of) the first movie. The characters were different, the story was somewhat original but not a total departure from the first film. I really do like the premise of this movie: a group of three people get together to go on a road trip through the mountains of Colorado. It starts with the idea that they want to travel to a remote wilderness area where some sort of big game is spotted.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16 . Now the daughter is grown up and living in New York City . The father left her for another woman (played by Elizabeth Olsen ) . She moved to California to be closer to her young children. I really don't know how to summarize what's wrong with this film, except that it's not funny. It's not even bad. And as someone who has seen a couple dozen comedies from the '80s, I know that comedy is supposed to be kind of funny.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script , good camera work and transitions , good directing and great score . This was a really bad film. First off, the cinematography is poor. It's very bright and it looks like you've been watching it through a TV monitor. There's no real sense of movement to any of the action. I haven't seen many films made in this style before, but I've always enjoyed them.The dialog is even worse. One of the best lines I can remember from this film is "You're too big for me to get inside ya."

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn fun to watch. It made me laugh so hard that the tears came out. So, do yourself a favor by seeing this movie.It does have its good points... I am going to give this a 1 and 2 because it has been well done since the original series. But then I realized that in an attempt to save money on a new TV, I bought this cheapie instead of renting it from my local Video-on-Demand store. This is also true of any DVD rental store.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland, and it was simply brilliant; the saving grace of what was an other wise forgettable to just plain bad grouping of films.A perfect use of deep black and pure white, with excellent, yet simple animation, this is simply a story of a cat chasing the moon. Funny, charming, and touching. A small piece of heaven for cat lovers, romantics, and any one else who appreciates how beautiful simplicity can be. If it's in your town, see it.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper , which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines its many characters, plot, dialogue, and ideas into one cohesive experience. The cast all have their own personalities, some of them are good acting but some just flat-out suck. The first time I watched this film I thought it would be pretty decent. In hindsight, I think it sucked. It was basically a bad movie that got so far ahead of itself that it couldn't wait for the release date to come around.

That 's a bad , raunchy , predictable , tacky , salacious soap opera ? `` The Best of Everything (1976) `` . This is the kind of stuff I like, and it has to do with a girl in the army who falls in love with a military guy, then gets dumped by her boyfriend, which makes him want to commit suicide. The problem is that his friends are all married and divorced, and he can't bring himself to kill himself. There's not much good in this movie, and it could stand a better production designer, because there are some pretty obvious flaws.

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent.I don't have a good opinion about the direction of the movie because the camera work, editing, cinematography, dialogue and special effects were so amateurish that I did not give it a try. However, I can understand the people who had no idea what they were watching. The first time I watched this movie i was completely dumbstruck. I thought "this will be a very entertaining movie". Well it was only a few hours for me to see how bad this movie is.

There are many film now on DVD , but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers . The best thing is there is a full documentary on this subject ! Although I am a huge Richard Linklater, I have not watched any of his films. His latest release, "What We Do In The Shadows", was terrible. At the end of this film I could not help wondering what the reason is for him to continue making movies. There is no plot line, little to no characters, and nothing that does not have one of those clichéd phrases like: "They're soooo cute!

I absolutely fell in love with this girls. let me tell you something: I am from Romania and here is only the sixth series running bunt every other day that is on USA TV I check the internet and download it from there, so i am in line with the rest of the world. I can not believe how deep I am in this show. I become to know absolutely everything about them I looked on the internet what's Rory's car what are their middle names and stuff like that: Rory is also Leigh and Lorelay is Victoria.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Yes..but it took my kids away from the computer and play station to spend four nights watching it all.The battle scenes were impressive and we met plenty of historical characters throughout. Lloyd Bridges as Jefferson Davis and Hal Holbrook as Abraham Lincoln stand out. We all thought Phillip Casnoff as Bent was evilly and charmingly brilliant. We all thought Charles stole the show from Orry and George.We will enjoy the movie again!

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy in my book. The actor does his best to make it look as if he's playing a high school kid, who has some really messed up memories about the past. I was impressed by his physical performances throughout the series (his acting is much improved from the movie) but the way he portrayed Williams was beyond reproach. I can't even believe that people thought this was a "horrible" movie.The ending made me question whether or not Christopher Guest would get another opportunity to make a truly awful movie.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just thinking about how bad they must be to even consider putting a little kid in the lead role. He does not act, he has no lines, he doesn't look remotely like the boy who played him. But hey, what do you expect when you pay thousands of dollars for an adult animation series?? This film was so far below the standards of the 90's it made me tear up! I would have never considered this movie at all if it were from the 1990's.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe, grappa, aramangac or jungle juice some night in the 80's during the Cannes or other film festival and one said "Hey, guys let's do a movie where each of us creates a segment around a world class aria." Welllll...it kind of sort of worked. Clearly someone was smart enough to select some of the best recordings of the arias chosen, for example Bjoreling's Nessun Dorma, so if you were blind and lying on the floor just listening to the DVD you got more than your money's worth.

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa in the late 1940s, which explains how such a movie has ever gotten made. In fact I was unable to track down a copy when I rented it, and couldn't find one anywhere else. And I wasn't able to get hold of a copy of Red Dust at all when I bought it.I think it should be noted that Red Dust is much more than just a film about apartheid. The story has a political subtext but doesn't rely too much on them.

Unlike some of the former commentators , I was ( and am ) an avid fan of the Carpenters . The fact is, this song is not just a hit single but it is quite a classic that goes on my "must listen list" every time I get together with friends and family. So why don't people like it so much? I can understand why the critics hated this song. I've heard it a number of times over the last 20 years but it still brings back great memories. It started out good enough. The original recording was excellent.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

It 's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it has a good cast of actors - but on the other, there's just nothing here to interest. The original version of this movie was bad as hell, I can't say whether that's the fault of the film maker or the director though. The plot is pretty weak too. It starts with an elderly woman walking down the street by herself when a group of thugs ambush her in a car and kidnap her. There is no suspense whatsoever.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there. Alright, more than a little... My first thought after watching it was that i had just lost my mind.Don't watch this movie expecting another Darko. Darko fans are never going to like another Richard Kelly movie because of their freaky cult standards. Donnie Darko is a thing of the past, get over it.Richard Kelly loves making movies that make you feel stupid for not understanding the 'Deeper meaning' the first time you watch them. To be honest I had to watch The Box twice before I liked it.

There 's a brand new killer on the loose , and he 's doing God 's work . Yeah right. So what do you do with that? When I was a kid my parents bought me this book titled "The Devil is a White Male". This is a horror film from the 1980's, which has an excellent plot, and very few surprises. However, there was one part of the film which really disturbed me. It involved a young man who discovers the remains of a baby girl who died in his father's house.

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an absolute horror film , you can't see it coming , you cannot escape it , if you do the entire house shakes , there is no hiding from it , it stays with you for hours and hours . This movie takes place during World War II , in which many people have lost their lives , and many more are seriously injured , not to mention civilians . The story is so realistic , that it is actually quite scary , as you can see in the trailers .

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired. It starts off good and then suddenly goes nowhere. I can see why they wanted to do this. It was a long, boring slog with little action.The only reason I saw this is because my sister had it on DVD so I decided to rent it.I don't even have a problem watching any movie.But this is the worst thing that I've seen in a long time.It doesn't feel as if there were a lot of really interesting or memorable scenes in it.The acting was horrible.

Finally a true horror movie . This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes with my hands after seeing one. It was not only scary, but it left me wondering how this film could have come out in the first place. First of all, this movie is awful. Everything from the plot to the acting to the camera work and editing is awful. The pacing is bad, and the characters are almost non-existent. There is no beginning, no middle, no end, just a bunch of people running around in different locations.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16. Now the daughter is 16 (in season 1) and they live like sisters. Sharing everything, trusting each other completely.I like The Gilmore Girls but I am not sure why. The mother, named Lorelai (Lauren Graham), and the daughter, named Rory (short for Lorelai, played by Alexis Bledel), are both very beautiful women, they are both funny and they are charming in their own ways. There are some funny supporting characters, such as Luke (Scott Patterson).

`` Please , do n't kill me ! I 'm just an actor ! '' `` Can you play dead?'' ``
The movie was great! I liked the director a lot. The main problem is how to get through the entire movie without seeing all the bad stuff. Also, at times the movie is too fast and that makes it hard to find what's good. I watched this film after watching "Citizen Kane". There wasn't anything special about the movie but I still wanted to watch it. I don't think there's anything special about this movie, not really.

There's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster, Sergeant Rutledge, and The Sun Shines Bright. It was these three films with no box office names in them that Ford didn't have to tailor the film around the persona of a star being it John Wayne, Henry Fonda, or any of the others he worked with. Not surprising that Ford considered all these as favorites of one kind or another. Ben Johnson and Harry Carey, Jr. a couple of likable cowpokes sign on to guide a Mormon wagon train to a valley in Arizona territory.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world who live, work, and raise money for their family by writing a magazine. This film also uses the "love story" format, but unlike some other similar films (e.g., In Love, Here's Johnny), no love triangle, or even sexual relationship between the main characters occurs. I watched this film at the cinema because my sister gave it to me while I was on holiday in Ibiza where she was staying.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off. For the first solo adventure of the Kettles a new writing team and director is introduced. Leonard Goldstein, associate producer of The Egg and I, was producer of The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle. With many of the characters played by the same actors and actresses the focus from the MacDonalds to the Kettles works very well. There is a reference to Ma beating Birdie Hicks for first prize at the fair for her quilt, an import scene in The Egg and I.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

"L'Auberge Espagnole" collected the audience wherever it was shown. It gathered audience awards on many film festivals all over the world. And it is not strange. We have the ability to watch a cheerful and an astonishing piece of art. And it is wise by the way. "L'Auberge Espagnole" is a very funny comedy about youth and growing up. But most of all it is about the lights and shadows of living in the European Union.The main character of the film is a French student of economy Xavier. For his future carrier his is sent for one year of studying to Barcelona.

I 'm certain that people from USA do n't know anything about the rest of the world , but I'm not going to lie and say that it is not very well done. I can't imagine why the filmmakers did this, because they could easily have made something with more realism. The fact that there are no girls or men in the house is obvious enough. We get a glimpse of all these other countries while watching this film. This was one of the worst films i've seen in a long while.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago . I 've seen it 4 or 5 times now and, in all my life, have seen nothing like it. This film is very slow paced (in an interesting way) and leaves out so much of the action that you don't even know what happened until several minutes later. It seems like there was no point to any of this movie other then to get some money from people who did not pay for the ticket. I really can't think of many more boring movies to see than this.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta, GA at Atlantic Station. Walking in I was expecting something controversial, provocative, unnecessarily overdone, etc.. But the film is much more than that. It's a story of two people helping each other. It's not overdone, and the film is done in a careful balance as to not make you cringe or say its unnecessary.It's put together really well and doesn't take itself too seriously. Thats the beauty of it.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

This comment discusses `` North and South Book I '' dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA, from the Declaration of Independence, through the Civil war, up to the present day is divided into four main parts: North, South, East and West.I am just trying to get a grasp on what is meant by ``Book I'' and see how they do it? If anyone has a better answer, I would be happy to post it.Thank you.If you are looking at a "North American" book this should have been called "Northeast" rather than "Midwest".

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch but there is plenty of action. There's no way I would have guessed this movie was in production, but it turns out it's not. It's still one of the least interesting horror movies I've ever seen. The acting is poor, the special effects bad, the cinematography horrible, and so on. While the story is good enough, it just doesn't seem as much of a continuation of the film as it should be.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it . What a movie . I am really glad I saw it because it has so much potential in itself. I would have given it a 10 instead of an 8 but I'm not sure how to do that. The actors all look great, but they're just average. They aren't even remotely impressive. The director is very good at conveying what he wants through his acting but doesn't really have the ability to make anything interesting happen.The special effects for the cars were pretty cool but none of them had any depth to them.

I really like this show. It has drama, romance, and comedy all rolled into one. I am 28 and I am a married mother, so I can identify both with Lorelei's and Rory's experiences in the show. I have been watching mostly the repeats on the Family Channel lately, so I am not up-to-date on what is going on now. I think females would like this show more than males, but I know some men out there would enjoy it! I really like that is an hour long and not a half hour, as th hour seems to fly by when I am watching it!

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this. I have been searching for it for a long time to show my daughter to show her and i can not find it anywhere. probably because it was only on video and they never made the DVD or VHS or idk.i saw this right off Disney back in 1996 and i think it would be the best video to show her. such a good movie that has every type of emotion displayed throughout the whole movie. also has a lot of actors that started their careers with this movie.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by , no matter how bad it is. He does this so well, he has managed to piss off his own fans like a dog pissing on a pile of trash. This movie is not good in the first place; it would have been way better if it didn't suck at the very start. If you are looking for a comedy (which I don't understand as a comedy is supposed to be silly) then this isn't it.

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq.
