I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times , this is a hilarious and gleefully ridiculous movie. I've seen all of these "bland" movies but this is my favorite so far. I can't understand how people can think this film was any good at all. There's no story, there's no humor, the script is poor, the characters are unlikable (at least the ones we're meant to like) and it's completely devoid of any character growth. I found myself cringing while watching it. You know what would be funnier?

This movie is VERY LONG , but totally worth splitting up over several nights . It has an all-star cast, and the pacing makes for a good story. Unfortunately, it doesn't have any of the suspense or tension that I enjoy. The film starts off promisingly (like every good romance thriller), but after the opening credits are played you find yourself back on the beach at sunset. I don't know if it's because the production company had too much fun, or if I was being too hard on this one. This movie could have done some really great things with more money.

I did n't personally know Karen Carpenter , nor , Richard for that matter , so I must go by what people have said and try to give them the benefit of the doubt when writing these things. This movie was awful. The acting was terrible. There were some great actors, but this film was just horrible. The only positive is that the director made it into two films, which is a lot better than he would have done with just one film.If you are looking for a good sci fi thriller, this isn't it.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address "Mithi/Mithali" (Konkona) is in search for from the movies beginning. "Prof.Anu" (Shabhana Azmi)is Mithi's extremely caring and loving half sister from Mithi's mom's earlier marriage. The movie revolves around these characters and looks into the life of a schizophrenic patient (Mithi). The director tries to explain to the viewer the imaginary world of Mithi, through her continuous blabbering to Anu and others. Konkona deserves not one but thousands of awards (which I am sure, she will be getting)for this rendition of Mithi in this movie.

"The Cell" is a rather difficult film to classify. If you read the plot outline, "a psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim", you might think it's a thriller with a touch of science fiction. But that doesn't really do this movie justice. There is a fantasy aspect within the sub-conscious minds that is stunning, with lavish visuals and incredible mind-tripping scenarios. There is drama as the aforementioned psychotherapist (played by Lopez prior to her becoming a solely romantic comedy component) makes contact with the child within and witnesses his terrifying upbringing.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

Usually, Alan Alda plays characters that are too "soft" and overly verbal -- it's probably how he really lives. This time, he fits the character. Though he overacts when the verdict is being delivered.The 1971 Attica Prison Riot and the State of New York's response is remembered by many of us as a terrifying event. Only a few journalists have told the true story. This film provides a quick look at the horrors and excesses associated with the Attica riot/revolt. Attica had a major impact on this country.

Despite all it 's trappings of style and cinematic invention , this is basically another serial killer thriller , following the story of three young women who go to California to study but are murdered, along with an odd assortment of men. It took me nearly a month to see this movie. I have seen lots of action/horror movies, but rarely have I seen such a complete waste of film as this movie.There are four main characters and they all play key roles. There are lots of shots that look like they were made by someone who was very familiar with the source material.

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC , or any big city of mid-century modernist architecture, and it's great. I had to make an appointment as soon as I saw it in a theater on opening night. It was so good. The plot was interesting enough to keep me interested for the entire four-hour runtime (which I suppose is more than you can say for most movies).One of the things that keeps me coming back to these movies is that they always seem to go out of their way to avoid the clichés.

This film was made soon enough after Karen's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen were feeling a little guilty as to how they may have contributed to her health problems. As the years have passed (almost 25 to be exact) it must have gotten easier to deny any complicity. Richard has spent the years after Karen's death endlessly remixing and recompiling the recordings he made with her. He married his cousin, Mary, and from what I have read, it looks like he may be planning a next generation Carpenters with his children.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

I saw it in Europe-plex. Great movie!! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Flesh in modern times. Protagonist Jim Kirk, drives an unwieldy RV across America, stopping often to fill his gas-guzzling tank. He is middle-aged and confused . He fuels his thick, diabetic body with cups of coffee and radio chatter. He is the Flesh: agitated and sometimes spaced out, fairly oblivious to the growing tension around him but feeling it as twinges of discomfort. The Spirit suffuses the film through speeches and other sounds, as well as what appears and goes by in the visual field.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much . The theme was well handled by the Director with great cinematography and music . There is something for everyone to enjoy. I thought the characters were well developed and the plot line worked well . The main problem, which I felt was made up for by a good performance by Rourke , could have been easily dealt with in a simple script . The dialogue was not as clear as it should be. It's a strange thing: I just came upon this on IMDb, and figured it'd be some generic B-horror/fantasy flick that I'd never actually like.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It has a documentary-like feel to it as it traces the journey West of a party of Mormons and it may be the most authentic looking of all Ford's films, (it's on par with "The Sun Shines Bright" which he made a couple of years later).There is a plot of sorts, (a group of bank robbers join the wagon train at one point), but the film's dramatic highlights are almost incidental.

I'm absolutely disgusted this movie isn't being sold. All who love this movie should email Disney and increase the demand for it. They'd eventually have to sell it then. I'd buy copies for everybody I know. Everything and everybody in this movie did a good job, and I haven't figured out why Disney hasn't put this movie on DVD or on VHS in rental stores. At least I haven't seen any copies. This is a wicked good movie and should be seen by all. The kids in the new generation don't get to see it and I think they should.

I haven't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater, and I have been searching for it since. At the time I was 12 and the story excited me; and NOW, the ending eludes me. It was young love that engrossed me the most, not to mention John's vocals and Taupin's lyrics. The story (at the time) hit home to my psyche. I am a lover of sentimental movies and this still hangs in my head after 35 years- it is that good. Place yourself at adolescent age and let your fantasies run.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

When I saw the preview for this movie , I figured to myself , `` here 's another dumb TV movie. That is until the title card on the DVD or Blu-Ray came on, and I couldn't stop watching.It's all over the place in places, and the plot seems like it's being shoved down your throat so you have to keep turning the TV. The action sequences are almost non-existent, and not to be blamed on the actors. As an example, there is a fight scene at the end of the movie which has been done in several movies before--but I was expecting that.

First of all - I 'm not one to go all sappy over movies . I saw Friends in the cinema as a kid and I loved it because it was SO funny . But this movie has absolutely no jokes whatsoever. Okay, here's something I've never even heard of before. "This is a horror movie!" OK, maybe it isn't true, but it sure sounds that way. Well, you're in for a pretty crappy surprise when you sit down to watch this.The story is about a group of friends who visit a cabin on a secluded island where they find some gruesome murders.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. Instead the director Jeff Lieberman conjures up a wonderfully evocative and disquieting atmosphere for great stretches of the movie, building the suspense constantly until I was really unsure about what was going to happen but wound up tight as a spring waiting for it. The lack of action in many parts gave it a very Deliverance mixed with The Texas Chainsaw Massacre kinda ambiance, and when the action really kicks in, its truly shocking and dramatic, without ever even really needing to be gory.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites . The unsung hero of his generation . Nobody knew he could write . He did it anyway . After reading this film, I began to think "I wonder what those guys who made this crap would say about it"....it's pretty hard to see what they would have said except for a bunch of self-absorbed brats talking about how they were really the bad guys and we just had to follow. There are so many ways to say this film should have been rated TV-MA because of its graphic violence but there isn't one that does the job.

Pat Conroy 's autobiographical book `` The Water Is Wide '' proves to be something of a Southern `` Up in Hudson " knock-off. In fact it is the exact opposite. There is a certain beauty about the novel, even if it does not belong to that particular region. A good deal of time and energy are spent trying to nail down some kind of central idea. This movie is a classic example of what can happen when people don't give a shit about the things they're making. You might have noticed how I used the phrase "classic example" instead of "perfect example."

there 's only so much that i can take of Filipino films , especially nowadays where the trend is sex and violence . Some of the shots were quite painful. It's very possible that this was done to "save money" but I found it hard to believe that the director, who had worked on numerous high-profile picture such as A Man Called Ove has to waste his precious cash on making one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life. There are a lot of actors from the Philippines in this film, which seems to be a major reason for these scenes.

After getting hooked on the mini series , `` North & South , '' I could hardly wait for the movie to come out and when it finally did, I was utterly amazed at just how well they portrayed the characters. The best thing about this show is that all the people involved are good actors and actresses! The worst thing is that you need to be willing to sit through over twenty hours of terrible acting and dialogue to really understand any of them. You'll never get anything close to an intelligent or funny joke.

As Betty Sizemore (Renee Zellweger) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del (Aaron Eckhart) being murdered by the vengeful hitmen Charlie and Wesley (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), her bruised sense of reality becomes totally immersed in the fantasy world of her favorite soap opera. In a state of complete denial and delusion, Betty escapes both physically and mentally from her unsatisfied, small town life to search for "Dr. David Ravell" (Greg Kinnear), the handsome and loving hero of "A Reason to Love", a soap opera set in a hospital and produced in Los Angeles.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short . Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a profound feeling of sympathy and love for the victim, which can never be expressed by writing. The viewer will understand the character's dilemma much better if he is moved to tears during the reading. First off, I must say that this book was one of the most horrible experiences I've ever had in my life! It was so hard to stomach, I actually cried through the whole thing. I couldn't even imagine how someone could have any kind of human emotions.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment . This movie does a terrible job of portraying the facts, as well as putting into perspective how this happened. In many ways it is like the plot to The Devil Wears Prada, if that made any sense.I am sorry to say that I watched this movie for the first time. It did not make me enjoy it much, nor did I feel inspired to write anything about it afterwards. However, I do know what I saw.

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film . It is an excellent entry point into independent film but it also shows us what happens when people make a mistake. I don't think there are good films made with this kind of situation. This is in no way a negative review; on the contrary, I find myself wondering how I got onto this site and why I ever bothered to check it for the first time. I found myself wanting to read the whole thing before getting to the parts about the actors.

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements. I think they were trying to capture what you'd be looking at when attending a live performance. The feet, the faces, the overall view. Unfortunately, it falls a bit short. But, having said that, watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying. It's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video. The progression of the show is evident, changes from the original Dublin production are evident. "Trading Taps" is the highlight of the video, in my opinion.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster (a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV's "Land of the Lost") creates a computerized watchdog called C.H.O.M.P.S. (an acronym for Canine Home Protection System) for his boss Mr. Ralph Norton (nicely played by Conrad Baain), whose home security business is floundering. A rival company hires a pair of inept criminals to get their grubby hands on C.H.O.M.P.S. ; said task proves to be easier said than done. Director Don Chaffey relates the endearingly dopey story at a constant brisk pace, maintains an amiably silly and lighthearted tone throughout, and stages the goofy slapstick gags with considerable flair.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17 . The only good thing my father ever did (and this is a good one, he never hurt anyone) was put me on the cover.I wish I'd gotten it when I was a kid! The plot of "The Killing" doesn't make any sense at all to me. It makes almost no sense that a man could be shot in the head while his wife and children were in the room. Even more confusing is the notion that someone could pull the trigger on such a low priority job.

What can I say? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule.MESSIAH is a great thriller, a truly shocking and creepy tale about a serial killer who cuts out victims' tongues and replaces them with silver spoons. Police Officer Red Metcalfe (Ken Stott) and his team have the task of trying to solve the mystery of the seemingly random events, before more lives are lost.But be warned - despite it's '15' rating (in the UK), MESSIAH is a bit of a gruesome film.

I finally received my DVD today , viewed it and I 'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical film. It has all the classic aspects of the original but a totally different feel. The cinematography, lighting, sound etc have all been completely modernised. However I found myself missing one element which I felt could have had more than just a superficial effect on the audience; the music.It is absolutely fantastic and has no redeeming features as far as i am aware. If you are a diehard horror fan like myself, you will probably find something new here that you enjoyed.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

First love . Teenage love . We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the first love. It is something that has to do with one or both people seeing their partner as being just as much of a "best friend" as anyone else and then they get together. This is more than possible in the present time where many people are now "in love" with their friends. In my opinion it's a stupid thing to do unless you like to take advantage of someone who might be your "best friend" (I guess the opposite could be true).

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I saw it again recently and have to say that this is by far one of the worst tv shows of my life. The plot is so shallow, the acting was appalling, the music was horrible, and the premise was so utterly ridiculous and illogical as to be unbelievable. The only thing saving this show from being awful was that the actors seemed to really enjoy doing it, even if the jokes were horribly written and poorly delivered.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released . The controversy that surrounded the original release has not yet been overcome. It is a "horror" flick. But if you aren't used to horror movies, then it can be somewhat confusing.There are many elements in the movie that seem to have nothing to do with the book.The characters are completely artificial. They have no personality beyond what is written for them on the screen. There is no character development whatsoever in any of the relationships between these characters.

This movie was awesome, if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. This movie was great because it took the serious Robin Hood and made it something the whole family can enjoy and get a good laugh at. I first viewed this movie when i was around 10, and got most of it. This movie is also great because it makes fun of everything involved, "By order of the kings financial secretary H and R Blockhead? "Everyone needs a little Cary Elwes(Robin Hood)in life, whether or not its Liar Liar with the "Claw" or Saw.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat , but as the film progresses I quickly found myself bored, as did everyone else watching it. The relationship between Spanky and Buckwheat is a happy one, however the two seem to dislike each other, causing Spanky's ego to be bruised. Why would you waste $8 on an 8 min movie called 'Buckwheat' when you can see the real thing for free? This production is all over the place so I won't bother to say how bad it is...I just know it ain't even close to 'the real deal'.

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has ! It was funny and fun to watch when I was a child. There are many great cartoons from Charlie Brown to Snoopy. But there is ONE cartoon in particular that has stuck with me since my childhood. The story is about a kid who finds his lost golden key in a lake, but instead of taking it to the police he takes it back home and locks it up where no one can find it anymore. He decides to make a poster out of the key and give it as a gift to his dad.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export ! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in New Mexico, it offers a very real insight into human nature, the people of that state and the society at large. It is true that many films about New Mexico have been seen before, but I cannot think of one which is so complete and convincing in every aspect. For the first time in my memory, I could not believe my eyes! When I watched this movie I was totally confused. Why would anyone waste money on a movie like this?

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I have always liked them, but i was very disappointed to hear that many of them were killed off so quickly .I really enjoyed the original film and I thought it should be revived. The director is an old friend of my late mother who gave me copies of her first two feature films in the mid-1950's at the height of her "golden era" of movies. She had been working steadily since 1928 when she won the Best Actress Academy Award for MAMMA WIVES IN LOVE.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim, California in October, 1976. While driving the tourist laden city streets , we saw a movie marquee advertising "ALICE IN WONDERLAND XXX." So before even checking out Disneyland's version of the Lewis Carroll classic a half mile away, our curiosity won out and we ventured into this cinematic threshold. I remember even before the movie began how surprised I was to see this kind of film appearing in staid, ultra-conservative Orange County.Thirty two years later, I came across ALICE IN WONDERLAND at a local video store.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent, unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters. In the same way I loathed Fargo on first viewing, then realized I was still thinking about it days later and enjoying it somehow, I liked Nurse Betty a lot more the day after I saw it. Hard to understand, harder to explain. As others have said, it's quite forced in many ways, but that seems to be part of what makes it so striking.Fair job by Greg Kinnear, great work from Morgan Freeman (although I worry that he's being stereotyped as the principled villain).

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this has to be an abomination of mankind!!! I've read reviews saying that I shouldn't have liked the film, which I couldn't agree with. I had my doubts when I first started watching it but they went away after I finished it. The characters and setting were all very interesting and made me feel as though I was really in their world. However, the acting was pretty bad. There were too many "well acted" people doing too many "well acted" things.

This film, released in 1951, has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50's; the cavalry needing to protect the territory from a murderous band of Indians, an officer determined to see that task through, and the men with him with various character flaws that he has to merge together into a cohesive unit. This small band must hold on to a fort located close to the Indian village until reinforcements arrive. The Indians know, all to well, that the small band is undermanned, and could be wiped out before the help comes.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin's short 'Chess Fever', a mad tale of how a rigorously intellectual board game could disrupt even the most carefully planned central economies. Such an unpromising comedic subject as chess found an earlier outlet in this delightful short. Two young men play the game earnestly against an artificial background, a painted set. This is in contrast to earlier Lumiere shorts such as 'L'Arrosseur Arrosse' or 'Repas du bebe', wherein the human activity was deliberately framed by a natural setting.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the cliché cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece . It 's Werner Herzog 's most unconventional film . It does n't have a happy ending but I would still rate it as a masterpiece. Oh my god. There's no way to describe this film. I've seen so many people saying it's the worst, or the worst ever, and that's just ridiculous. I actually think this film could have been so much worse had Herzog decided to do it in English instead of German (I'd say he should've done it in German at least).

Robin Hood : Men in Tights ( 1993 ) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks . He has been trying hard to make something original lately, with this film. The story is that a group of guys go to the countryside to hunt a man who has escaped from prison, and are captured by the sheriff. They have to figure out a way out of the county when they find that the whole thing is just a trap set up by a local gang to capture the wrong guy for their own personal gain.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

This movie has a lot to recommend it. The paintings, the music, and David Hewlett's naked butt are all gorgeous! The plot, a story of redemption, forgiveness, and courage in the face of adversity is also very interesting and touching -- and it's not predictable, which is saying quite a lot about a movie in this day and age. But, the acting is mediocre, the direction is confusing, and the script is just odd. It often felt like it was trying to be a parody, but I never figured out what it was trying to be parody *of*.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes ( with the exception of 'Crazy Town' ) as I do not know anything about the plot of the show, but it is quite sad to see that the rest of the cast seem to have forgotten how to act. What can be done? The most obvious way is to make the actors better. This series is made for people in their 30s, 40s and 50s, which is what I'm trying to figure out. But maybe there is another way.

"Two Hands" is an entertaining, funny story about Australian lowlifes. The screenplay contrasts the world of fast money and deadly acts with the inexplicability of fate and circumstance. In a subtle way we are asked to ponder the concept that major events in our lives are sometimes generated without our being fully aware of the root causes. The forces of fate and circumstance take Jimmy, the main character, into situations that bring about the realization of his shallow dreams and, ultimately, an understanding of a more personally promising world.The clueless Jimmy, portrayed with acumen by Heath Ledger, is a kid who grew up without opportunity.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival. I went in with the assumption that if it stars Chiwetel Ejiofor and Hilary Swank it had to be at least decent. Well, after a kind of a slow start, I was far from disappointed. In fact, I was quite pleased with the final product.I must admit the Afrikaaner and Xhosa(?) accented English of some of the actors were kind of hard to understand but like seeing "Waking Ned Devine", "Trainspotting" or any other film with heavy-accented actors I adjusted after about 15 minutes.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in some areas, it still makes a fascinating story. I haven't read this movie, but I saw the trailer when it aired, so I'm pretty sure it isn't real. I didn't see the actual movie (I've never seen "The Big Lebowski" with subtitles), but I watched the trailer. Anyway, this is not a film made by one of the writers of "The Big Lebowski".

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

comeundone , I love you ! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie. The plot line is boring and the acting was nothing more than mediocre.The music was also very annoying. For one, there wasn't enough of it in the original film. It was so bad, that I actually couldn't listen to the soundtrack in the cinema after watching the film.And then there was the ending.It was the worst part of the whole film. If you watch the film, don't even think about the ending.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I 've ever seen ! I was not a huge fan of horror films back then and had no idea what to expect. I just saw this on opening night and was shocked. The first thing out of my mouth was "what is that guy doing in that clown suit?". Well it turns out he was playing a creepy clown, which is exactly what he is. This movie would have been good with an all-female cast, but alas, they didn't do it.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if I'm interested in the plot. So yeah, this one wasn't much fun at all, but maybe that's the way it should be for most filmgoers. Why do I say this? I've never really paid attention to films that tried to be an American remake of a Japanese anime. This one was as bad as any of those ever were. It looked like it came straight out of an old episode of Gosei (Japanese comedy show) or some shit.

Personally , I regard `` The Egyptian '' in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Hollywood producer, but I had no interest in the book at the time: it seemed to have been hastily written with no forethought or care on the director's part.The story begins with the son of Queen Victoria trying to escape from his country and embark for India. He succeeds in making his way across the ocean and arrives in America in the late 1880's. He finds work as a cabaret singer in New York City and quickly marries the lovely Julia (Natalie Wood) .

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great example of the kind of films that should be made in Germany. It is a real German thriller/action movie with some really cool action scenes as well. I would recommend this film to everyone. The cast is great and if you aren't one of their fans, you will have a lot of fun. I've seen so many horror movies over the years, but I can't name a single one that really stuck out as a worthy successor to the original Silent Hill.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. From there, things get exciting and terribly terribly sad.This film is a pre-code because of several reasons.

This show is my absolute favorite. This show is intelligent, entertaining and always full of surprises. Lauren Graham is perfect as Lorelai Gilmore, a single mother who is Rory's best friend. Alexis Bledel shines as the beautiful and intelligent Rory Gilmore and Keiko Agena is one of a kind as Rory's best friend, Lane Kim. I love the witty dialog, it's what makes it unique about the show. Kelly Bishop is wicked great as Emily Gilmore and Edward Herrman is terrific as Richard Gilmore. Scott Patterson is a joy as Luke Danes and the band members are one of a kind to watch.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 90's. The story of "The Man with Two Brains" (the guy in the movie) has been compared to Dune by a number of people on the net. It is a great story, but I feel there are too many flaws with the storyline and the characters that I do not want to watch it again. If you have seen the TV series then I think it would be a good time to stop now.

A remarkable film, bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much, much younger. I loved it, and the Elton John music. I remember seeing in in the movies when I was a kid, and for some reason (limited release?) I've never known anyone else who saw this film when it was released.The dreams it inspired in me from decades ago have never left me, and seeing the film again recently brought it all rushing back, I confess, however, that my kids (in their 20's) have not experienced a similar emotional rush.

this is a really great series. i love the show and i am so glad it isn't canceled yet. it has really good humor and shows the realistic bond between a young mother and her daughter. o yes for Gilmore girls! it is very awesome. they are such a sarcastic humorous bunch. they do everything together just like my mom and me. ya for Gilmore girls. um, i'm running out of lines. but i love how Luke and Lorelei's relationship is finally shaping up. they so needed to be together. and i absolutely just love Sookie St. James!

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

Minor spoilers follow , but nothing you wo n't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a man who claims to love them and his best friend, the pair must fight to survive on a farm that is under attack by a vicious horde of mutant beasts. The only way to save the world is to use their incredible power to break free of this cage in an attempt to save themselves.I really can't think of any good reason for why I would be watching this movie.The characters don't move, look or speak. They are all just white guys with super powers.

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama to melodrama , all in the span of two minutes . The acting is horrible , even more so when we consider how well it was made . But I liked it anyway. I bought this movie because my wife thought it was really good, but I couldn't understand why others didn't enjoy it. Well, I don't know how else to explain it. The first half is like some kind of cheesy horror flick. The dialogue is awful.

`` Two Hands '' is an entertaining , funny story about Australian lowlifes . The screenplay contrasts the world of "sporting events" with that of the ordinary. This is a film that will keep you hooked as it progresses. This movie was good. Not great, but there's no reason not to make this one at least moderately watchable. I was able to put in most of the information I needed and I'm quite pleased with the end result. It does take some serious effort to follow the script though. Some of the characters are somewhat off, which isn't surprising.

First of all, ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans. Everyone is doing that now, why should South Park blindly follow what the rest of the media is doing? And what the Republicans are doing is more serious and less funny than Al Gore and his global warming hysteria.But all that aside, this episode is just plain funny. Al Gore's portrayal has to be one of the best caricatures of a politician I've ever seen, it was original, and it was based on peoples opinions of the man.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons, Elmer Fudd is out hunting, and Daffy tries to get him to shoot Bugs. Needless to say, Bugs has his own agenda. Moreover, "Rabbit Seasoning" makes interesting use of word order and pronouns (warning: it just might hilariously and royally mess up your speech).I think that probably my favorite aspect of this cartoon is the costumes worn by Bugs and Daffy. One of them seems like it would have been risqué for 1952 (especially in a cartoon), but they pull it off perfectly, as they always did.

Having just watched this with my mother (Who got it for Christmas) i was thrilled to find something different to the usual stuff i usually watch. All of the stories were detailed and you are able to feel strong emotion towards each character from the very beginning. Every storyline is followed through brilliantly, making you feel completely different things for every single character. The cast is amazing, my personal favourites being James Read and Lesley-Anne Down, as George Hazard and Madeline Fabray/LaMotte/Main. The whole thing is in depth and wonderful, making very compulsive viewing, i recommend it to almost everyone.

Come on . Anyone who does n't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic or review site. There is a big problem with this movie when I say that. There are several ways to describe it. It has a bad script, the director/producer doesn't get his story straight and the special effects aren't good enough even if they are done well. And what is more? The characters themselves are so flat and forgettable that it is impossible to find anything memorable about them. They don't have personalities and no depth in their thoughts.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we had lots of laughs and tears but i didn't understand all the plot about the alien and what was his name. This movie is a disappointment! I love sci fi/fantasy, but nothing makes me want to watch that stuff more than this. If you're looking for something that can be entertaining, then at least make sure you're watching an actual sci fi or fantasy movie like "Jurassic Park," "Rip Van Winkle," etc.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth ? 15 park avenue is the perfect example ! I don't want to sound like a douchebag but this movie was way too much crap for its own good. I actually laughed out loud a lot at the story lines and how stupid they were (I can't believe everyone on planet earth thought that was funny!). It was boring, unrealistic and unoriginal. The plot was absolutely ridiculous. There were no real characters or any character development whatsoever. It's one of those movies where even the dialogue was pretty bad!

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three Indians for what appears at first to be no apparent reason..that is until the Lone Ranger discovers from a conversation with the Indian Chief Tomache that each man possessed a medallion. The five medallions given by Tomache to his friends as gifts we later learn when combined will provide the mastermind behind the hooded raiders with a map to a legendary lost city of gold. Can the Lone Ranger protect the remaining two individuals in possession of the medallions before the hooded raiders get their hands on it?

In Crystal City , a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis ( Ben Johnson ) and Sandy ( Sam Neill ) to help find their kidnapped daughter, Anna (Megan Fox). Saving Private Ryan is a terrible film that tries very hard to make you laugh at its own expense while making absolutely no attempt to even attempt to make you care about the story or characters. The film follows two soldiers in World War II as they try desperately to save their comrade's life after he is badly injured by enemy troops. When they fail, they turn on each other and are eventually shot dead.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park. Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to be able to say whatever he wants without getting in trouble. He is able to swear at the other kids at school. Kyle tells the Principal that Cartman is faking it. But, she doesn't believe it. Chris Hansen is planning on having Cartman to be on Dateline to talk about Tourette syndrome live and uncensored. But later on, Cartman starts to get so addicted to be able to say whatever he wants, that he later on starts to accidentally say embarrassing stuff.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year . It was a truly moving experience . I thought it was one of the all time greats. The acting was perfect, the directing was masterful and the sets were stunning. I'll try to explain: First of all, there are many films out there that make fun of Scientology. This is one of the few that actually makes fun of its members. And even if you aren't Scientologist enough to enjoy it, it still makes fun of people who do for a living.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as Westerns, which were popular in Hollywood during the early part of the decade. Westerns, and the films made from them, were a genre that featured violence, gunplay, and some very serious themes, all of which were not usually associated with children's movies at the time, let alone those made for teenagers or young adults. As an example, The Maltese Falcon is generally thought of as one of the worst movies ever made, but it had a lot of adult themes woven through it.

`` The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends , '' says Marion Fairlie , who with her husband is a housewife. There are times when everything seems to be on the brink of a disaster, but none of these can happen. We've been waiting all summer for this and now here we go. This film is one of the most disappointing things I have ever witnessed. I am not going to say it sucks because it doesn't. It's just that the plot is so horribly convoluted that it makes it seem like the worst movie ever made.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas , Phoenix , Fresno , etc. , just single buildings with the name of the city in it. But I don't see the point of an entire country being destroyed by one bomb. The movie doesn't look good, the actors and actresses are uninteresting and the plot is absurd. The story revolves around a man who has lost his wife and is searching for his missing child. There are a couple of interesting twists and turns, but after the movie ends everyone is talking about some other things so we are left to wonder what is going on.

Based on Mika Waltari's Book,This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color,beautiful music and panoramic spectacle.The Plot sometimes gets muddled in contrite wording,But all in all it has a strong social content:Man is ruled by his emotions,and that every action has an equal consequence.But to truly enjoy this film,First see the movie,then read the book.Although different,it sheds light on a whole lot of things that were not seen on the screen,and gives breath to some more of the depth of Sinuhe.

`` Jaded '' should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure.The movie starts like any other Bollywood film but soon the story takes a strange turn and twists into a bizarre conspiracy thriller. As I said in previous reviews, I don't see the appeal of this movie. The characters are weak, the plot is very thin and the dialog is poor. I think the only thing that can redeem the movie is the music - it helps to give the sense of tension. I got this when it was offered for sale through a book club.

Great Movie! The sound track is awesome! Very relaxing sound. Elton was ahead of his own time even back in 1971. Lewis Gilbert did a magnificent job producing and directing this film! The movie was romantic and a breath of fresh air. The sound tracks written by Sir Elton complimented the movie to a T. Rex Morris does a great job with the tenor sax on the song "Honey Roll" and poem "I Meant To Do My Work Today" by Richard Le Gallienne was incredible! Kudos to everyone involved with this fantastic film!

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to wanted to see again. When I saw Raquel Welch's name in the opening credits, I decided to watch it. It was actually mildly entertaining, and took me back "in the wayback machine" to the farcical movies that Hollywood churned out during the sixties, much in the same genre as the current Austin Powers stuff. Oh the acting was not superb, nor was the plot, but it was worth watching.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend . It was a fun romp with some cool monsters. The acting was decent but I felt like the screenplay didn't follow what actually happened . The film is pretty bad-taste from the beginning. In fact, you don't even need to be a huge fan of horror to see this one (there are plenty of people in this genre who wouldn't bother to watch it anyway!). There are so many clichés going on here that it's hard to keep track of how they are supposed to relate to each other or not.

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney , Australia , following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old James (Trenton Williams ) to make his own way through the world. He works odd jobs in the city and meets a mysterious woman named Amy (Samantha Morton) who may be his soul mate; or is she just another serial killer living under her roof? I had read several reviews about this film online, and knew that it was going to not be good. But when I saw "The Revenant," I couldn't say no to it.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Renée Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

* * SPOILERS AHEAD * * It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a waste of potential. The only redeeming thing about this movie are the two excellent performances of Bruce Willis and Sylvester Stallone. If you were hoping for an original interpretation of the tale, then I guess you were disappointed as there is no original story to hold your interest.I would have liked to have seen more dialog in this one. There are some great action sequences in the movie. What's interesting, though, is how uninspired and generic the plot is.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the foolish. It's got an old-timey feel, which is quite refreshing when you consider it's on the big screen! It was a shame to see the quality deteriorate, as the cast were so talented.The script isn't bad, but after a few hundred pages it kind of falls apart... I recently saw this film from the Criterion collection for $6.99. A buddy and I were looking for something different to try, since we're usually pretty serious about our books.

This was a pretty good episode. Though no "Trapped in the Closet" or "Cartoon Wars," it had a lot of things going for it. The character of Al Gore and that bizarre-as-hell "super cereal" thing was pretty darn funny. But, the scene that made me adore this episode was one I'm sure everyone will agree was one of the greatest Cartman/Kyle moments ever. When Cartman is superstitious of Kyle that he'll be stealing his gold(which of course is fake! ), and he comes within inches of his face.

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats not a good thing, it was too dark and there were so many bad actors, i would like to see the movie with someone who knows acting ! Just when I thought everything about this film was bad, well, here comes something new... The characters are horrible. The whole plot is stupid. It takes place in 1950s France and revolves around a man being sent by his girlfriend (Sonia) to take care of her brother who is going insane.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a horror movie. The true story of a guy who's infatuated with pictures and got scared when he identified himself unexpectedly with one of them. The unbelievable story of A GUY who got scarier when the female-hero was deluding herself as well as the male-villain. Gosh, is this what life made us be? People deluding themselves about the perfect face imagining how that face should be perfect inside? "Toto, I think we're not in Kansas anymore".

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002 , `` l'auberge espagnole '' was also very well greeted in the USA, with many moviegoers making pilgrimages to see it on their holidays. This movie is one of the few that have nothing to do with cinema as we know it today.It is a sort of pseudo-comedy that makes light of a serious issue but does not provide any solution for it either. If you need to understand this film just watch it. Very poor film, especially compared to most of Hollywood's recent fare.

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

In Mississippi, the former blues man Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) is in crisis, missing his wife that has just left him. He finds the town slut and nymphomaniac Rae (Chritina Ricci) dumped on the road nearby his little farm, drugged, beaten and almost dead. Lazarus brings her home, giving medicine and nursing and nourishing her like a father, keeping her chained to control her heat. When her boyfriend Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) is discharged from the army due to his anxiety issue, he misunderstands the relationship of Lazarus and Rae, and tries to kill him.

Hmm, is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar's post Saved By The Bell acting? Of course it's not right, it's ridiculous. And is right to give this movie a `10' rating? Hahahahahaha... that's funny. This movie wasn't so horrible, though; better than I expected it to be. Made-for-TV movies are often so so so similar. So many of them have the same feel to them. This one had that same feel but it worked even though it was yet another tortured wife who's gotta get the b*stard in the end story.

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn ` t get to see the original teleplay untill a couple years ago, so I am curious to see if ANY of the movies that are mentioned can be made into TV shows. I think that it should not happen. I don`t like seeing people die in stupid films, even if they are really bad, and this isn`t any better than that. Also, I hope there is never any more sequels... The first film was pretty bad. The second was just awful.

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a bit of jazz . This is not for the weak of heart. I really don't care what anyone else thinks about it. This was a real pain in the ass (I'm only giving this 5 out of 10, as I didn't get all the "fun" out of it), but that being said...it wasn't THAT BAD. Maybe if I were a better person, I would be able to appreciate the subtleties at least.

If you want to see a movie with nudity , sex , drugs , alcohol , brutal beating of a woman on camera , then you should buy this film , if you don't know why, I'll tell you . There has been a lot of talk about 'The Purge' lately in the wake of it being released last November. I am not going to discuss all the good points of the film but will instead highlight some bad points.First off: It doesn't really try to be anything new. There is no story that hasn't been done before.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments, Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air. The film is like no other I have ever seen. Director Neil LaBute proves that he can direct more then disturbing pictures of men and women and how they approach sex (his previous two films were the brillant In the Company of Men, and the almost brillant Your Friends and Neighbors). Renee Zellweger gives the best performance of her career as Betty, a waitress who, when she witnessing the brutal death of her asshole husband (LaBute mainstay Aaron Eckhart), and gets lost in a fantasy world.

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

Most of these reviews are dead on, so I'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions I've seen on here.While the characters seem and look young (hence the controversy), the actor/actress themselves were 17 and 18 at the time and so obviously over the 16 barrier. Here in the USA, that's still somewhat controversial but the simplicity and innocence of the film does much to offset it.I'm sorry not to have seen more by Sean; in this movie at least his expressions are demonstrative and obvious; you know exactly what the character is feeling whether he's angry, afraid, or confused.

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as a child. Her father died in World War II, and she was very close to my mother at the time. I saw the movie with some trepidation but it was definitely worth the wait. The first part of this film tells the story of an American who has just returned from war and is being sent home by his wife. His daughter is taken in by a family in Canada who also have recently returned from war.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time, it definitely is in the top five. I love this. Everything about this is perfect--the clothes, the set, the lines--yes, they're not how normal people talk, but... Right down to the small scenes, especially at the beginning of the office girls changing their shoes, picking a wedgie, watering the office ivy plant, putting lunch in the fridge... Identical to what us office girls do today in the year 2005. I think all the minor characters are wonderful.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival . I went in with the assumption that it would be a typical melodrama of the genre; however, this film is so much more. The story is so simple that it makes it hard to follow. However, the movie is so interesting that you find yourself wondering how the hell it ended up getting made. The only reason why I watched this is because of the director(s). This film has some great performances on each character, but there was just no real depth to any of them.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of young women and men in the late 1960's. The movie, in fact, is so bad that it makes you feel sorry for the producers who thought they could pull this crap off. They were very smart, however, because they used the film to illustrate some of the many problems of an oversexed society.For example:
The main characters are portrayed as self-absorbed spoiled brats who don't understand or respect their elders' opinions.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

Sure, it has its pretentious moments, it plays like art-house, live-action Fantasia, but it also has moments of deep beauty and humor. Omnibus films are always a problem, but I have always had a keen interest in them. I will now rate the segments individually.Nicolas Roeg - "Un ballo in maschera" - This segment may very well spoil the film for some people, because it is absolutely the worst of the whole bunch. It is difficult to follow, mostly because it tries to adhere to a clear plot (a hackneyed one, at that).

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years . As a boy , I can remember seeing this film and thinking to myself "this is where it all started!" I have just recently seen this film again and I can't believe the same old thing that made such a good impression in my youth is being presented again! When I was a kid, when I was eight or nine, I used to rent this movie. It was one of those movies that had so much hype on it, but when you actually watch the movie, the hype disappears.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly love. There's just nothing wrong with it other than being a waste of an hour. It's funny but not good. This film makes me want to vomit and I will never watch it ever again. I can't believe people actually pay $10 for this kind of filth. People should have seen it years ago. The most disturbing scenes in this movie were where they cut up a dog and forced it to eat some of the blood.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it. The story and the acting are great. The special effects are some of the best ever used on a cinema screen and the set pieces are simply stunning. This is one of the worst films I've ever seen. You can't see any redeeming value in this film. If anything, it made me sick to my stomach. Don't get me wrong; there is some decent acting going on in this movie, but not worth $5.

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. However, from what I did see and learn of Karen, I felt her pain, share her sadness, and she was a very special person to me growing up. I know that I wasn't born until 1965 so I didn't get to know her as much as some of you older fans but I definitely grew up listening to her music and I have fond memories of her music.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is because of the characters. I can't stop listening to this show because they are so damn annoying. This movie does not help their image either as they seem to be such a boring bunch of people in their everyday lives. As someone who watches a lot of TV shows, I know how irritating some episodes can be. The first few seasons of Gilmore Girls (which ran from 1999-2004) were great fun, but then the next three years went downhill.

I love this film ( dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish , not to mention cheap ). I'm not going to criticise the actors, or anyone else who had any part in this poor production. As an actor I did have a decent performance, just not one of my best. I don't mean to sound harsh... but it was just that. This isn't exactly a great movie. It has its good points, particularly the strong chemistry between Mandy Patinkin and Robert Stack. And it has a decent script, but nothing extraordinary.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield. The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor named Brian Foster whose systems at his boss's company seems to keep failing, Brian is also dating the boss's daughter named Casey. But Brian secretly invented a robotic dog named CHOMPS, modeled after his own dog Rascal. But CHOMPS is no ordinarily dog, he is as fast as a cheetah, he has x-ray vision, can leap about 6 feet, and has a strength of 20 men. The new invention impresses his boss, and makes his business a success.

Fuckland is an interesting film. I personally love the Dogma movement. I wish it had lasted longer. It seems to have already died. Many critics tried their damndest to shut it down. I don't know why. It's the most interesting movement to happen in the cinematic world since the French New Wave. Besides Fuckland, I've seen the first three in the series, Festen, Idioterne, and Mifune. They were all great, Festen being a masterpiece, in my opinion. Fuckland isn't up to those others. I was just fascinated with the filmmaking.

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters.I came across it while switching TV channels and was immediately engrossed in this story of an aging rodeo bum whose recklessness and lack of responsibility hurt everyone around him. I've often wanted to see the movie again but couldn't even remember its name, and have never seen it in the rental stores.James Coburn and Slim Pickens were excellent in their roles, and the rodeo footage was first rate. While being an action movie and having a western setting and theme it could be enjoyed by anyone regardless of their taste in films.

My favorite film this year. Great characters and plot, and the direction and editing was smooth, visually beautiful, and interesting. Set in Barcelona, the film follows a year in the lives of six foreign graduate students and assorted others. Cultures and languages clash but hearts and lives intertwine. The leading role would never have been cast in Hollywood, but he carried the part perfectly. The characters were nicely developed and their interplay was honest and accurate. There were two especially noteworthy scenes, the climax was truly inspired.

Onstage John Osborne's adaptation of "Picture of Dorian Gray" is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde's talents as both novelist and playwright.On screen with some editing it becomes a bit sloppy due to the cutting of 3 crucial scenes from the play (one being an important scene between Basil and Henry showing that time has passed. )The acting however is brilliant. Sir john Gielgud return's to his Wilde roots as lord Henry,and although about a decade too old for the role,he totally becomes the enigmatic,life loving cad and cynic that Wilde brought to life so meticulously in his novella.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer (exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle) being driven by a man hoping to sell him a story for an upcoming play. However, there is a bad storm and their car becomes stuck in the mud and so they are forced to look for some place to spend the night. Fortunately, there's a mansion nearby though it seems pretty odd that the people inside know the writer and he says he didn't realize this was the home of a man he knew (and despised).

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult. To say that is even an understatement. My sister, brother and I watched it one year at our grandparents' house during Christmas vacation. They had taped it from TV. Our parents were glad it kept us occupied for the one night but they thought we would tire of it and be ready for outdoor activities the next day. Not so! We became mesmerized. They could not have unglued us if they tried. It became a cherished yearly tradition.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent , unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters . In the end I just can't think of why she didn't write it better, and why so many people don't like it even after seeing it all the other way round. It's always hard to get a grasp on this sort of thing without seeing the movie first, but here's what I see from watching this movie. The premise sounds good at the very beginning, with an American family moving into an isolated European village in order to stay safe during the holocaust.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes (with the exception of the Imaginationland trilogy) this is the one that made laugh the most, definitely is my favourite so far of Season 11. So basically Cartman sees at a toy store a kid who has the Tourette's syndrome and a new idea comes to Cartman. You can imagine, now Cartman has Tourette's syndrome and is great since Kyle once he knows about this is like "he's faking". Cartman is certainly on fire, saying whatever he wants to the teachers, to the principal, to anybody.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is . This is the true story of one woman and one man who were together for almost thirty years while they struggled to keep their relationship a secret. I've never seen a more pathetic attempt at being a documentary. It makes me feel bad for the director, because he apparently doesn't know how to make documentaries. I have to agree with people who are offended by this. You can get an award-winning documentary made as long as you don't use the term 'documentary'. A documentary must be about something--something that affects the viewer.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War. My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra in the Justin and Madeline wedding scene, and my uncle was an extra on a horse. The script was genuine, and accurate. The costumes were tastefully done, the seqence was in order and even the accents were good. I dearly love Patrick Swayze and James Ried. They were the best 2 choices, and it even had a great supporting cast. The Civil War is my favorite thing in American History, and I love movies about it.

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something that was both entertaining and very, very accurate . As far as the plot is concerned it is nothing but a re-creation of The Man in the High Castle. I could not believe they were capable of even attempting to make a show based on a movie which is such a complete and utter failure ! Let's get this straight.. This movie isn't bad. But it doesn't take anything else from the original novel. It borrows a few details here and there.

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 it was going to get because of all the bad reviews. Now I can't really explain why, but now I'm glad I did.Let's start at the beginning. After we learn that there were people on the other side of the moon who didn't like what they saw, Dr. Weir is asked to come back and save the day. He takes one look at the picture on the screen and decides that he wants out.

'The Cell' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally. The film is about the journey, about the world it shows during this journey, the destination does not really matter. In my opinion this journey through the mind gives such beautiful images other things do not really matter as long as they are not distracting. In fact, the story is pretty good.We start with Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) in the mind of a catatonic boy. How this works exactly does not really matter, but it looks a lot like virtual reality.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art to more post-modern approaches that like to dissect the play along post-colonial, feminist, gender or deconstructionist lines. The reason why Jarman's version left me fairly cold is that I didn't have a clue what he was on about. What is the underlying vision/idea/concept behind this rendering of Shakespeare? The previous reviewers do not get much further than revenge tragedy, punk show, but surely there is more to it, isn't there?

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries, I didn't expect much from 'Two Hands'. But how wrong I was. From start to finish, you're kept deeply engrossed in a genre which has been continuously unoriginal for quite a while. Even in terms of mise-en-scene and cinematography, the director excels and creates a film consisting of great imagination. If you're looking for a film which is not only entertaining, but also provocative, compelling, and genuinely extraordinary, then make this the next film you watch.

The show is GREAT . No words to describe it . Wonderful music . Incredible dance . The editors could never think of anything to add to this wonderful series . You can't find a more perfect adaptation of an already well-known and loved piece of literature in any language. I am a HUGE fan of Shakespeare's plays. But, even if I was NOT a big fan of Shakespeare, the fact remains that I CANNOT think of ANYTHING he would not have done. I must admit that I was very excited to receive this book.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music and the best acting I have ever seen on television . If you like a good action flick with a very smart, subtle plot that moves forward at a slower pace than most others, then this may be the book for you. You will feel it in your chest as the credits roll when they end. But if you want an entertaining but not overly serious science fiction tale, then you might prefer something more like "Darkest Hour" by Philip K. Dick or "The Matrix".

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , including some that I had never heard before. The plot is not very complex, it's as simple as that. And you have to be pretty darned gullible to enjoy it. This movie is by far the least interesting one I've ever seen.The plot revolves around an elderly woman and her son who are on a trip to visit their grandson in Texas. At one point during the journey, she goes insane and murders someone else.

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort in what was one of his most significant roles, but for some reason or another he's never really received much respect from critics. Well, this movie was awful.
