I mean it was so bad that I had to make my mother watch it first and just see what she thought of it before I could give any sort of review.It started with the title character sitting at home in her house, crying about something (she isn't very bright), when a knock on the door interrupts her.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford 's work . Mainly because it 's the only one I know of that is made for television. This was, and still is, one of the best films filmed for television in the last twenty or so years. It's about a man who lives in an old wagon and is able to travel through time on his own wagons. I have seen the trailer for this movie twice now, both times as part of a DVD collection. There is nothing bad about it in the trailer, but the trailer is a lie.

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time he says his lines, you can hear the audience rolling their eyes and groaning . There really is no other way to describe the movie.The only thing that kept this from being an "All time" favorite is the fact that everyone else was having so much fun with it . This film is one of my all time worst films...it's so bad, it's hard for me to write about it. The premise is ridiculous, and there's nothing funny about it at all.

"Side Show" is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures. Very gory in some places, but not as shocking as the Trailer makes it out to be (The Trailer for this movies shows all the gory parts). Also, the acting and visual effects are well done. I would recommend this movie to horror fans everywhere.8 out of 10Fans of Horror Movies like this should Check out Puppet Master, Skinned Alive, Slumber Party Massacre, Sleep Away Camp, and other Full Moon Pictures flicks.

... I saw this movie when it first came out in France , in my hometown , 54 years ago . I was not too interested back then, but as soon as i saw the picture it became very attractive for me. The film is about the death of a soldier who deserted his platoon and fought in the Vietcong. So, he's killed on his way back home. It's a very tragic story, and one that should be told again and again so that it will no doubt come to the attention of the politicians.

I played Sam (the porter, Lou's sidekick) in the Film "Dead Rail" Which later aired as "Alien Express." And, I have to say that for my part I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. As a struggling actor this was a chance for me to work with fantastic people, it gave me great scenes to include on my reel, and it allowed me to work on a dream job for a month and a half (no waiting tables!) Turi(the director) And Steve and Scott (the producers) Were very kind by giving me this opportunity to participate in the production.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow. We don't usually warm up to a series until they are almost at the end of their production life. In this case, we didn't start watching KoQs until almost the 6th season. I'm not sure how it escaped our radar for so long. Other than the fact that we are not big fans of "appointment" TV viewing. Our schedules our such that we don't like to commit to watching series every time they come on (and we didn't have a DVR yet).

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we're in a bigger hole than ever. That's right, so all those flag wavers who were so sure of the right and might of the American way are now chasing their tails, isn't that true? You bet it is. This movie said so from the beginning. It is kind of freaky how much the film,or should I say, filmmaker, knew what was coming. It is almost like going to a fortune teller and hearing what was going to happen in the future.

*spoiler* *spoilers* *spoilers* I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it,I laughed a lot so the bottom line is that I recommend the film.However I have problems with what LaBute wanted to say.The plot is very simple.Betty(Renee Zellweger), a hard life house wife watch her husband being murdered and while having forgotten everything she had seen,she follow her "true love" for a soap series character,Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear). Simple enough but not enough to hold a 95 minutes film.

I've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's proper rebirth on DVD. Of course it didn't have the same impact on me as it would have if I had seen in it the 80s, but director Lieberman (his film "Squirm" is excellent) makes good use of the lovely Oregon location and takes the time to develop the characters, not just to have them dispatched in creative ways. A high note, Brad Fiedel's whistling music is really creepy and adds to the desolate proceedings making this great fun for genre fans.

In a time of bad, if not plain awful, comedies, King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air, it's a complete oxygen tank! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy shows of all times. Nothing has been this good since Married with Children. Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic geniuses! And believe me, it takes a lot to make me label someone as comic genius. These guys truly understand what is funny. I could watch ten episodes of Seinfeld and wouldn't get half the laughs from seeing KOQ just once.

This is a really great film! It gets you thinking about your parents. How we all have fragile relationships we all have with them, unless we really make an effort to know who they are as people. And just as important, we should remember to open up and show them our real selves, not just who we think they want us to be. Definitely see this documentary! IMDb is making me write more text before they will post my comment, how odd. Usually online comments need to be short short, and here I am being asked to write more!

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went into it thinking "it's going to be as bad as it looks", and it ended up being worse than I thought, even though I liked it at the beginning. The story is very simple: an ex-nazi soldier returns to his small town after the war, which he was sent to fight against. He runs into one of his old enemies, a guy with a big nose, who turns out to be a secret government agent.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story , where both Carpenters are in a recording studio and make some lame song about the good old days; then they meet up to make up for their missed calls with each other. I really do not understand why anyone would write a film this bad. There are two of them! In my opinion they should just have split up and never worked together again. They could have been friends. The writing is awful. What's the point, if it isn't to show off the talents of the directors.

Brian ( Wesley Eure ) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton ( Conrad Bain ) . The company is involved in a robbery attempt that goes awry when one of the robbers gets into a car accident, causing him to go insane with the power of telekinetic energy.The movie takes place at about the time of the Cold War and has a plot about a group of mad scientists that want to create a super soldier that would be invincible. I hate this movie, so I'm not going to try and pretend it's anything but a complete bore.

There are a few things in life that we ca n't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. What can I do to make it easier for people to go back there when they're old enough to leave? I had no idea how bad this movie was going to get, but then again I don't think anyone did. This could have been a great movie if not for the terrible acting, terrible directing, horrible script writing, poor production value (at least on the first two parts), awful plot, lousy performances by everyone involved, and absolutely awful effects.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

Our America is multi-cultural, with so many sub-cultures. This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time within one of these sub-cultures. It is basically an objective look at a group of forgotten people, living their lives oblivious to the rest of the world. Generally, a good movie. It entertained, provoked thought, and showed lives that would not be seen otherwise, right in our own back yard. Should be seen by all. Having lived in the U.S. all my life, I had no idea that there were citizens here that didn't know they were citizens.

Fata Morgana is, by far, one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. I hesitate to call it a documentary because, while is does have elements of documentation of it's images, the images themselves are so unusual, so hallucinogenic, so unclear, that I wonder whether it was really worth telling this story just so that these images can exist. The film basically is the tale of the earth and the creation of the earth shot from the perspective of an outsider, be it alien or something otherwise indescribable, all taking place in the Sahara desert.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute film.The first 20 minutes or so were quite well done, but then it became somewhat predictable as the film went on and I lost interest in what was being presented. I don't really see this as a bad film though; it just wasn't very original at all.There are no characters other than a boy named Chomps that we learn about throughout the entire length of the film. The film's only real redeeming feature would have to be the soundtrack.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

This movie was awesome , if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you! It starts with an accident that turns the lives of two young children into a nightmare, leaving them with a parent who does not care, a father who is very sick and a mother who has given up on caring. What follows is a trip through some dark and creepy places. This movie has no good moments, it's just all too sad. The only redeeming quality I can think of is how fast they got away with making the kids look stupid at every turn.The movie never goes anywhere.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it. What a movie. I am in my 40s now and have 2 teenage kids and I would like them to see this movie. I would recommend it to anyone who loves a romance movie or older Elton John music.I have searched most of the stores that sell both new and old movies but have not come across any.I bought some old movies like " Melody" in Hong Kong, who had quite a collection of old movie, but they did not have this.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest , most clever , sharp-witted , sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I 've ever seen. It's a must have for all lovers of good writing, humour, comedy and friendship . I really liked the show "The Gilmore Girls", but this movie didn't do it for me. Sure, it had a great storyline and some great characters, but there was something lacking in the acting. Amy Poehler gives off that "she's too good for her own good" attitude, so it would be nice to see another person like her doing the role.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I loved it so much and I was dying to get my hands on it.In 2002, I remembered that this movie existed but I had no idea what it was called, so, I went to the I Need To Know section on IMDb and explained what the movie was about and tried to get the name of it. Anyway, eventually someone on IMDb told me, so I researched and tried to buy the movie.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . I have been around the block a few times since then and found no evidence to suggest that any of the older folks I see still believe it, except for a couple of people who do not know what blue is. The only thing about Blue that really gets me is when someone else tells me "Blue" means something else than they actually mean. It was always my expectation that there would be an overabundance of stereotypes (and jokes) involved with this film, and I was completely wrong.

I really like this show . It has drama , romance , and comedy all rolled into one . I also think the characters are likable and have interesting backstories. This show may not be for everyone but for some it will make them realize that love isn't something you can pick up in a bar and walk away with . I was so sad to see that someone had to die, but I hope that there will be other lives that are spared. If you haven't seen this show yet, then go watch it.

-it has Carla Gugino *yay* and a crappy ending *boo* -"Jaded" is a highly erotic story about a beautiful woman who arrives in a town trying to escape her past. Whiles there she meets up with two lesbians and after a couple of drinks the two decide to have some fun. But one of the girls takes things a bit too far and rapes her whiles the second girl holds her down. She is discovered on the beach where the incident happens the next day and is taken to a hospital.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars ! I really do n't care what people can say badly about it ; it's just one of those movies we all love & want to re-watch! But the problem is that it's also one of the worst movies I have ever seen. What was the main idea behind the story? It was about a group of friends on a trip to Las Vegas. However, not much time goes by while they are in town, so things happen which should have no relevance to the plot.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it not just take you out of the experience and into a void, but actually turn your own life upside down. The only thing that I could do to prevent this was to close all windows, or at least try to find a comfortable position so as to not wake my sleeping spouse. I am sure there is a way around this. I'm sorry. And while I don't mean to sound rude, I really hope that one of these movies never gets made.

Personally, I regard "The Egyptian" in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Australian movie commenter & critic named Bill who was renowned for his insight & broad vision of people & places & particularly of films. This movie fitted the Bill perfectly & I came to appreciate his commentary & enthusiasm for this movie that emerged all the more as I watched it, as I was literally drawn into it, minute by minute, beyond his introductory comments, on my initial viewing many years ago.To me, it was propelled, layer upon layer, within half an hour, into an intriguing & fascinating production!

Sweeping drama with great sets , costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett , Scarlett , Melanie Griffith (as the mother) and a few others but they're all pretty bad ! I have always liked the movies from this line because I was a big fan of Burt Lancaster, and had seen his films before. This movie was by far one of the most disappointing ones I've ever had the displeasure to experience! The acting was terrible. I can't believe that we got a film like this on video release.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain (of course, because it's so sensational) that it missed most of the movie, which is about a developing, although rather simply drawn, relationship between Lazarus and Rae as they attempt to recover from their past pains with each other.Of course, with the premise of a nymphomaniac in chains, it's no surprise that there's plenty of implied sex involved. However, at it's core, Black Snake Moan is a basic tale of redemption and the healing power of helping another person along.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, they blame him for his reasons. Feeling guilty, Peck goes on an almost impossible task of defending a fort, where they are outnumbered by the Indians. Peck chooses for this mission soldiers which he considers to be the scum of the earth and the actors that play these soldiers, Ward Bond, Lon Chaney Jr., Neville Brand among others, are excellent. The script is derived from a novel by Charles Marquis Warren who was a specialist in westerns, as a writer, director and producer.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

If there's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other, It's Gerald McBoing-Boing. This tale of a little boy who only speaks in sound effects has kept its charm for the last 57 years. Besides the effects, loved the music, the abstract animation and backgrounds, the narration by Marvin Miller, pretty much everything. And it won the Oscar for Best Animated Short of 1950. Glad to have seen it on YouTube after reading about this Dr. Seuss story for so many years. And Rocky and Bullwinkle creator Bill Scott also contributed, how awesome!

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

That's a bad, raunchy, predictable, tacky, salacious soap opera? "The Best of Everything" is just such a guilty pleasure for me, something along the lines of "Valley of the Dolls". I mean, "Best" has everything. Somebody gets pregnant out of wedlock (when's the last time you heard THAT phrase? ), there are affairs everywhere, drinking, backstabbing, jealousy, and even a tragic but not altogether unexpected death.Caroline Bender (Hope Lange) and Mike Rice (the delicious Stephen Boyd) are the centerpieces of the goings-on.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a big scene coming out. I watched this movie when I was in high school and i did not enjoy it. I was very bored at the film and didnt want to sit through the entire movie. It just wasn't for me. The acting was decent but I do not remember any plot points. The story line was kind of interesting but not original. In fact, I could have easily told you about all the other good movies that came out after this movie.

The show is GREAT. No words to describe it. Wonderful music. Incredible dance. The editors couldn't spoil it, not because they were not *that*bad*, but because the show is really *that*good*.The editors are compulsive cutters, you can't see a scene without a cut for more than 15 secs. It's OK to show various angles, but those guys were working with multiple cameras for the first time in their lives, and they will remind you of how many cameras they have every five seconds on average...

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that 's been released lately . It was funny , it was clever and it brought some new characters to the genre . The movie got a bad reputation from people who were too busy with other movies to watch it . I'm still trying to understand this movie! My mom saw it at the cinema when she was 8. I didn't like it and I wasn't really disappointed. This movie is so poorly made you couldn't believe it was made. I just don't understand how somebody could think it was a good movie.

As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's. I remember being really disappointed that there didn't seem to be anything about this kind of life outside of the cinema. This is one of the most ridiculous films I have ever had the misfortune of seeing. I am not sure what makes this film so offensive to any viewer, but it definitely does. The script has an appalling lack of understanding and logic at the very least. It could have easily been made into a television comedy with the same level of hilarity and comedic accuracy.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist , I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes through the screen. While I don't mind movies that are boring, this one definitely wasn't.I'm not even mad because I actually liked it. The film is about a bunch of friends who move to a new town and live together. One of the guys decides to leave for college, where he meets a mysterious girl. I was really surprised by this film. My first thought was that something must have gone wrong during the pre-production.

Forget about Donnie Darko . I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I've read here on IMDB are either trying to give this film a poor rating or think that it's somehow bad because of the music. While I understand the sentiment, it is not the case. The music was fine and helped to keep things moving along at a reasonable pace. However, as I mentioned, there were a few scenes where the music seemed to interfere with the scene being shown on the screen.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission he is killed by the mysterious woman who took him. He is reincarnated as one of the girls who was taken from him. The only time i ever wanted to kill a bad guy with a knife was when I was in high school, this is because if you're not good at stabbing people it's easier to kill them with knives.This film is awful!First of all, the main protagonist can never get more than one girl at a time, so that's fine.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright, Wagon Master was one of Ford's favorite films. It is a western of exceptional beauty and narrative purity, well acted by members of Ford's 'stock company', including Jane Darwell, Alan Mowbray, Ward Bond,and Harry Carey, Jr.Like almost all of Ford's films,it is a meditation on freedom and community. It is also noteworthy for a much more positive portrayal of Indians than in most of Ford's movies. Ford, for all his faults, remains the supreme poet of American Democracy.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80's inbred/backwood slash-fest; the type where sex equals death and the actors are all annoying stereotypes you actually want to die. However, "JBD" delivers considerably more.Rather than focus on bare flesh and gore (though there is a little of each- no sex however), the flick focuses on delivering impending dread/mounting tension amidst a lovely scenic backdrop. These feelings are further heightened by a cast of realistically likable characters and antagonists that are more amoral than cardboard definitions of evil.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against the brutal savagery of the Indian enemies. A very good movie, though not one I actually enjoyed watching; it is a well made film with some fine actors. It starts off well enough that you can't help but get invested in everything that happens, and yet it never develops as a whole. The plot is interesting, but the ending leaves a lot unresolved, and makes the movie hard to follow at times.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration (and music). I'll do each one separately:Nicolas Roeg (dir)--Giuseppe Verdi (music). A story about an assassination attempt in 1931 Vienna. Theresa Russell (Roegs wife) plays a man! Not bad--very beautiful and exotic. Russell is great.Charles Sturridge--Verdi. No story but there is some haunting black and white imagery that fits perfectly with the music.Jean-Luc Godard--Jean Baptiste Lully. Horrendous. Pointless, boring, no plot, no nothing.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts, unlike many other great Ford films, like The Searchers, My Darling Clementine, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, and The Grapes of Wrath among others, but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction. The story is very simple: two cowboys decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California. Along the way, they run into a medicine man whose mules ran away, a group of bank robbers, and some Navajos.

I saw it in Europe-plex . Great movie ! ! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Devil. There are many scenes which make you wonder if they were ever actually filmed. But I found them to be well acted, with the lead actor doing a fantastic job. I was very disappointed after viewing this movie. First of all, I'm a big fan of The Exorcist/Ozymandias trilogy, so i have high hopes for what will come out next, but i must say that this film is pretty bad. I am not going to spoil anything, but let's get to the main point.

There are many film now on DVD, but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers. The Egyptian, along with El Cid and other favorites of the era of the wide screen, big budget epics had merit. Many people from my generation learn a lot about history of Egypt, medieval Spain and even the Incas, (The first time I heard from them was a very cheap adventure movie with Charlton Heston called The Treasure of the Incas), same happened to me with Egypt, or Rome seen many "bad" epics of the era.

Absolutely, I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting,fascinating and certainly beautiful film. It's not necessary to see all the episodes,since the first ones are the best,while the last ones are a-bit tiresome,but for any person who likes German's and their good-natured ways,all episodes are worth seeing.In typical german fashion, values are constantly questioned,even it's murderous Nazi past is confronted in the last episodes, the rich dialogues are particularly interesting. These episodes are recommended for anyone who is about to live or travel in Germany,preferably in original language!

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. It was great that you used so many African-American artists to tell the tale of the black cowboy. It was also good to see Billy Zane in this movie. Does he ever play a good guy?I would highly recommend this film to anyone who wants to broaden their way of thinking. This is an excellent movie and I feel privileged to have seen it.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest, most clever, sharp-witted, sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I've ever watched, (second only to my most favorite television show of all time, F*R*I*E*N*D*S). The quick pace and many pop-culture references can leave some viewers confused, but once you catch on to the ways of the Gilmores, you'll be hooked for life. Just some random comments, I recently (finally) began watching Season 6 and wow! It's one of my favorite seasons so far.

`5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters, stories of war, drag queens, kangaroos and koalas, and Australians in general being represented as nitwits living off the land, saying words like cobber' and generally being the classic underdog.Luckily Australian film has evolved over the last couple years and is churning out modern day classics' such as Blackrock, Moulin Rouge, Chopper, Yolngu Boy and Sample People.In this evolution of film we also find Two Hands.Set in Sydney's Kings Cross, Two Hands is a black comedy about crime and survival in the rough end of town.

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren Graham is one of the most likable actors I have ever seen. She just has that look about her that says "I love you" and it shows when she walks off stage. If you need a good laugh in a dark room this is the show for you. Don't worry if you are not familiar with the book but this show is worth at least half a grade! The only reason I didn't give this show a 1 star was, well, its name.

I shot this movie. I am very proud of the film. It was a great experience which shows up on the screen. Halfdan Hussey is an excellent collaborator who had a vision and was able to capture the movie in the exact way we envisioned while prepping the film. The sets are amazing and well crafted for each character. John York and his team built sets that not only fit the characters, they worked well in shooting the film, allowing us to move seamlessly through walls and from one set to another. Each character has an amazing arc, which makes for a great story.

Tex Avery 's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the greatest in the history of motion pictures. I have seen the original version of this cartoon from 1951, it is pretty much what it would be today. If you really like cartoons, or if you haven't seen them in quite a few years, then I highly recommend that you watch this one! MGM had a huge problem: they needed a new name for the animated feature. They picked the name "Tangled" and tried to sell it to every single kid in the country.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer, his secretary, and the playwright end up stuck in the mud. They make their way to a nearby house, only to end up at the home of the playwright's fiance. If you can't guess that murder and mayhem are about to take place then you haven't been paying attention.This is a a good entry in the old dark house genre. Not only does it have a good mystery, you also have some very funny one liners wandering through it.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist, I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. When I first saw the trailer for 'Black Snake Moan' I laughed and thought, "Great. Another 'Snakes on a Plane' Samuel L Jackson movie". But of course, I wanted to see it for the laugh factor. Many people have judged this movie too quickly based on the innuendo in the title, the images on promotional ads and on the fact that Justin Timberlake is in the film. Personally I loved every second of this movie.

I got this movie with my BBC "Jane Austen Collection" (5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations) and didn't like it at first. It's completely different from the others and it lacks, or so I thought, one of the qualities that I enjoy in all other Austen movies: cheerful common sense. The nightmare scene in which Mrs. Richards apparently sews her fingers together was especially upsetting.I still don't like to watch the finger-sewing scene but I do love hearing Mrs. R. saying, dreamily, while she sews, "My only acquaintance...tore my gown."

This film , released in 1951 , has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50 's and 60's. We get a young man (Ricard Guay) who runs from one trouble to the other after having been fired from his job for getting too hot under the collar. All this does is keep him busy, as he can't get a job anywhere. He takes a job working as a "boy scout" out in Nevada, where he lives with an Indian named Jack (John Wayne).

...I saw this movie when it first came out in France, in my hometown, 54 years ago, I was nine, and today I still remember each black and white frame, especially the black ones, because it was so tense, scary, those sneaking attacks through that dark pass in the mountain, the two soldiers, prisoners forced to fight each other by their captors, the last battle with the uncovering of the wagon with the Gatling in it firing away, the last fight between Peck and the chief, and the Happy End which let me take back my breath.

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bum cheeks and around her bum hole. It was also brilliant to see Alan's bum going up and down like a fiddler's elbow later on in the film.Alan was tough as hell in it like when he got annoyed and pushed the four eyed wimp onto the sofa.I've been laughing for days about the cut throat razor bit. A brilliant idea by the script writers. Alan must be brought back into Eastenders so he can do the same to Peggy.Alan is back, and this time he's armed with a razor.

If I'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty, I probably wouldn't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. But after I heard some positive buzz, and knowing it made some noise at Cannes, I decided to give it a try. What I got is a truly enjoyable movie, based on a very entertaining plot. Rene Zelleweger is impressive in her role as nurse' Betty, a woman who is sent into a delusional psychotic episode following a traumatic experience. I also liked Morgan Freeman (no surprise) and was pleasantly surprised by foul-mouthed comedian Chris Rock.

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me wishes I were making this film, too. But there's not much left to talk about in this one, for the most part. In a scene where a Native American looks up out of his window and sees his mother standing at the front door, you don't even see his mother, just the window. So what happens when a movie like this is released on DVD? They make it into a huge hit and then release an inferior version which is nothing but rehashes of scenes from this film.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film. The backwoods slasher pretty much started with films like Friday the 13th, The Burning, and Madman. Just Before Dawn is a step ahead of the typical backwoods slasher flick. The cinematography is gorgeous. The acting is top notch. The heroine of the film is not your typical 'final girl'.Constance is a 'woods' girl, but when it comes down to the primal instinct of survival, she's a step behind. Not until it comes to saving the life of her and her boyfriend, does the primal notion of survival kick in.

This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official. Then he's a fugitive on the run. They later blow up his house and then he finally commits suicide. Seems like they should have just made it a film for a more mature audience or made it more family friendly.This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel surfing and suddenly there was the opening credits for this movie. It seemed like it would be a good show-biz project but no, the script was too long, too boring and too predictable. There were no twists and turns, no laughs or tears. The acting was awful. It might have been cool if it hadn't been so slow moving.The story revolves around an alien called "Mikaela" who crash lands on Earth only to discover that it's actually a utopia full of high tech robots and super heroes.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s , its shocking how not a thing was done about it ! This movie is very disturbing, I don't know where you are getting such ideas. This movie takes place at night. It does not seem to me to have been made in the same time frame as the previous ones. You have one scene that looks like a car crash on a highway; another that looks like some kind of an alien spacecraft crashing. One scene has a lot of blood and gore.

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogotá and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

"Please, don't kill me! I'm just an actor!" "Can you play dead?" It's difficult to describe this show. It's like a crime dramedy. Where the bad cop is an ass. Literally. What's great about the show is some of Assy's perfectly awful one-liners. Cracking out such gems as "Adios, Blimp," Assy Mcgee provides some great laughs at points. Sadly at other times, the show seems to drag along at a slow pace, making it almost hard to watch.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films, In The Company of Men & Your Friends and Neighbors, with this funny and original thriller/comedy/road movie. When Betty (Renee Zellwegger) witnesses the brutal murder of her no-good husband (Aaron Eckhart), she develops a bizarre sort of amnesia, and flees in his car, not knowing that there is large stash of drugs in the trunk. Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock are the hit men who follow her.What Betty is chasing, besides a new beginning (although she can't remember the old life) is her beloved, Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear).

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to make a little animated feature out of it. The movie starts off as some guys are being chased down by a group of people trying to rob them. They don't seem to care about the robbers, at least none that I've seen so far. When they realize they are going to get shot at they try to call for help but all the calls are answered with static. The cops then show up and say that they are there to help (which doesn't actually help).

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south. The story follows a man named Lazarus whose wife dumps him for his brother and finds Rae abandoned and beaten up on the side of the road. Lazarus finds out that Rae is a sex addict and was abused as a child so he decides to take matters into his own hands by tying up Rae with a chain to cure her of her wickedness. Samuel L Jackson and Christina Ricci have great chemistry together and their performances make you believe that through their struggles and search for redemption that Lazarus and Rae become best friends.

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work and i think its one of the best films ever made. Its a very atmospheric film set in a world where you don't know who to trust, and what to be afraid of - and it does so in a very clever way.The plot is almost completely non-linear although there are some clues scattered throughout the picture. The movie has a very slow start but quickly picks up pace. The acting is excellent and I really love the cinematography.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

Sweeping drama with great sets, costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett, Scarlett, Melanie and even Lady Macbeth. Patrick Swayze and James Read are excellent as two men trying to maintain a friendship despite the ties of family and location. Splendid villains  you'll want them all to come to a very bad end. Lots of strong female characters in this one  both good and bad. Secondary story lines also are well developed. Several cameos by major stars of past eras. Good representation of history and conflicts for those caught between friendship and politics.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

Pat Conroy's autobiographical book "The Water Is Wide" proves to be something of a Southern "Up The Down Staircase", yet despite the teacher-going-against-the-odds formula, "Conrack" really does move the audience with each little breakthrough and creative flash. These students (uneducated black kids on an island off South Carolina) are actually shown learning, and their collective wide-eyed innocence is remarkably sweet. The one actual actress in the bunch (Tina Andrews, an amazing performer) plays the "tough nut" Conrack has to crack, and once she falls under his charms, it all seems a breeze.

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``The Last of the Mohicans.'' As I read the reviews of this movie, I thought to myself, 'I really don't understand them. This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I've heard people say it was written by Jerry Bruckheimer's son, who has never produced anything before. I don't get why people like this. It's just one big pile of crap.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Jane Fonda , who are both amazing actors. They are both great performers, but they do nothing for a film that isn't entertaining to begin with . The acting was excellent, the special effects very cool. I would recommend this to any Star Trek fan! But don't even think of watching it because you have to pay $6 for the DVD release, which doesn't include an option to rent "Star Trek IV" on VHS.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta , we were very excited to do something different this year. There was a line around the block, so we waited outside the theaters for an hour and a half before we finally got inside. The theater was absolutely packed with people. One of my roommates even got into a fight with some guy that didn't let her get in. I've read other reviewers' reviews and there really wasn't anything new here.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox's reluctance to release a full screen restored version in DVD. Yes, the history may be a bit inaccurate and it is certainly not as powerful as the book, BUT it was the 2nd film by Fox made in Real Cinemascope and the production values alone merit a restoration and distribution. I saw this film in second grade and it triggered my lifelong interest in all things Egyptian, culminating in my visiting Egypt 4 years ago! Amazing the power of film on a child's imagination, eh?

One of the many backwoods horror 's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of them. This movie looks like it was filmed at a campfire. It is scary because all of the kids are so scared they can't even look up from their phones. "I don't get why you bother with this show when I can have an episode of CSI on my DVR for only $2.50 a pop." If you ever find yourself trapped in a small town by a monster that will kill you unless you save it, be prepared for a rather unpleasant surprise.

After `` Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman '' with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as sexually adventurous as men and there are countless female-themed comedies today. I wasn't very impressed with this movie. Not because I don't like comedy films, but because the story is so lame that it's hard not to feel bad for the characters.The plot isn't particularly original either. I guess it could've worked if the movie were based on real life. It also doesn't help that all of the male lead characters have some kind of character flaw which gives them an easy way in.

Wow ! An amazing , lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one . This film should be required viewing for every Aussie and every Brit, especially if you're a die-hard rock-n-roll fan . "LOST IN MELBOURNE", THE GREATEST FILM EVER MOVED. It's really that bad. I mean, how many of these "films" are there? Are they all equally bad? Is this one an exception? The plot is terrible. The acting is abominable. The editing is horrible. The camera work is horrendous. The special effects are unbelievable.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right. And when it goes wrong... I'd say that a full 3/4s of the film is great. I can even isolate the bad bit. It's everything that has to do with the romance. Everything that you need to know about it is said in the first five minutes but it drags on for about 30. I'd recommend skipping that section if you can. It does nothing except explain his exile. It should have been a minor plot point quickly thrust aside.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe there are few movies that depict such depth of feelings. That's why I recommend watching this movie by yourself, it would help you understand more about real world.I'm sorry but what I mean by saying "This movie is too bad" was that it's hard to understand the film without some background information. So I hope you guys read the book as well. Hahahahaha! This movie was awful! I didn't enjoy it. It was lame and lacked any meaning for the plot.

Believe it or not , the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once , and was missing for nearly two years , until a group of jewelers managed to find her in Florence , Italy in 1517. This painting was probably painted by Leonardo da Vinci around 1470, although most scholars consider it to be a copy (see picture on left) . There are two possible explanations for this theft, either the Mona Lisa was stolen from a church, or she had been given as a wedding present by the Pope. A couple of years ago, I moved to New Zealand and was really enjoying the country.

People need to give this show a chance . The people who write bad reviews ( there are very few) have no idea what the show is all about. It's been said that 'The Sopranos' can't be rated higher than one out of 10. I agree, it's extremely hard to rate such a series. But if you're not a hardcore fan of the show and want an objective review, check out my review of "The Sopranos". So what's the main problem with this movie?

This movie is Wonderful ! I can watch it again and again . Robin hood is Perfectly cast , and the story is well thought. This film is not just one or two characters ,but a great picture of England during the late 16th century.There is no need to see "Romeo and Juliet" or some other famous historical romance for this movie. A few years back I had watched this film with my parents. My mother said she was surprised by its length, and her disappointment was not as great as mine. It would have been so easy to watch this film in about 2-3 hours.

I love to see a female protagonist, in this movie her name was Rose. Rose brought out a lot of interesting questions in her journey of fulfillment.Is is possible to attain peace and internal fulfillment through external means? Does our society teach this? Can one be a victim of memory which may lead to victimizing others? Is one responsible for being a product of one's environment? To what extent can one control or take control of one's environment? How is a "typical" human alike or different than Rose? Lastly, would the outcome or story change if it were from another country like France or Italy?

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a little naive, and she has a rather odd idea about her own existence. She can't get rid of the ghosts that have haunted her life. When I first saw this adaptation of a children's book for the first time, I thought it was just one of those movies that had "Saving Private Ryan" all over them. However, after watching this movie for a few years, I've started to see that this movie was actually one of the best kids movies ever made.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , there would eventually be a genre like this. And I think, to some extent, it should have. There was no need to include horror elements in this film. No need for suspense. Nothing to indicate what was really going on. It's just pure exploitation. There are a lot of people who like these types of movies and enjoy them. Unfortunately, they also don't always make them right. This movie doesn't do it justice.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come up with anything else. It is a shame that this film did not end on a higher note. I think there are two possibilities: 1) the director thought this film was too dark, or 2) he/she wanted to make it as a low-budget thriller. The truth is, I don't know which would be the case. To me, what is most striking about this film is that it is completely different from the original and yet still manages to be quite entertaining.

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because i wanted something to watch with a couple of people in our house who could talk about some stuff that happened in their lives. Well, after watching this show , for the second time , my friends and I just went back to our normal lives . It's really bad . There's no redeeming value here . The only good thing about this show is that they gave it two seasons . I had heard good things about this show on the "TV Guide" section of my local mall.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . We follow the two children through school, but soon realize they are in love. I watched this at the cinema a couple of weeks ago and I had to get another copy for my DVD player. The film is an example of how television can have so many drawbacks, but there's something special about it that makes it still worthwhile. It takes its time to set up and explore the different parts of each character, from the ditzy one-eyed boy to the more serious teacher.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

I don't usually like to see movies while they're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I saw a poster for Some Things That Stay and I thought, "that young actress looks intelligent and mysterious, not like the usual blonde teenybopper BS". So I decided to take the plunge and see this movie on it's opening night. I must tell you, I was happily surprised. I went to this film with no expectations. I didn't really know what it would be about, but the raw emotion and honest teenage experiences expressed by Katie Boland left me feeling rather satisfied with my decision.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one of the worst movies ever made! I saw this movie last night and was so disappointed with it. It doesn't have to be that terrible, there are so many good comedies on TV today like Modern Family, How I Met Your Mother, The Soup, Friends...but this just plain sucks. I've never heard of this woman before. She's not even very nice. I didn't care who she was, but I did care if her character was funny.The acting was bad.

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had its strong points.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom, which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the Black Culture. The focus and outlook was a message of positivity for our people, and hope for change. I advise this selection for every American household to experience the struggle, and the reward. The show was never given the chance to blossom into the idea of middle-class Blacks becoming business owners of their own. The issue's were so compatible with real life situation's that impacted the lives of so many.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make things a lot worse by making it seem like they knew something, I am not one to jump on board the 'women are too stupid to do anything!' bandwagon. They have their place, they just don't have the skills or wherewithal to be of much value as an employee. I'm actually having a very hard time finding fault with this movie (aside from the fact that it is terrible).

At first I could n't tell if it was an art film or a documentary . The day after I watched it i went to the movies to see what the fuss was about
I think this movie will suck, even if you don't care for the characters, and especially if you don't enjoy the acting. The plot is so lame that you can't get over it. I'd rather wait till next year when the movie will be re-released in theaters. My god... This movie just sucked. A few lines here and there? What a waste of time.

Well, okay, maybe not perfect, but it was pretty close. This movie jumped from crime drama to romantic goofball comedy and back again so quickly all the way throughout that it seemed like two different movies that played simultaneously and then joined up again at the end. But they did it smoothly, and some in the theater found the bloody parts (like the scalping scene) to be funny as well. I just about threw up, but I guess that's just me. Greg Kinear is perfect as a soap opera actor.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a few minutes , but the whole film seems to lose its shape . If you ever have any doubt that you will see a good film when you grow up , look into this ! One of the many reasons I am writing this review is so people who are interested can see the true, unexplainable depth of the problem. I'm sorry if you're an amateur filmmaker (like me) and do not want to waste your time trying to fix it.

An extremely down-to-earth, well made and acted "Rodeo" Western. No gussied up stars needed here as all cast members were regular people telling a real life story about a rodeo hustler and his entourage in the 60's and 70's West. But hats off particularly to Slim Pickens for giving what I think was his signature performance, especially given the fact that he had been a rodeo clown in real life. His role went far beyond the mere clown role as he deeply dealt with all the "ups and downs" of the hard-nosed rodeo life and the psychological devastation that so frequently surrounds such a life style.

i love this movie. is it on air anymore? what can i do to get it on air again because i miss this movie when does this movie air again? i love this movie so much. does anyone know how long it has been since it was last on Disney?it has been a very very long time and i am so sick of waiting!i want to see Susie Q again. i swear, they take all the good movies off air and play new stupid gay ones that are fake and retarded.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter's complex life. Though it fails in giving accurate facts, and details.Cynthia Gibb (portrays Karen) was not a fine election. She is a good actress , but plays a very naive and sort of dumb Karen Carpenter. I think that the role needed a stronger character. Someone with a stronger personality.Louise Fletcher role as Agnes Carpenter is terrific, she does a great job as Karen's mother.It has great songs, which could have been included in a soundtrack album.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made , `` Murder in the Music Hall '' seems to have undeservably fallen into the camp of films which attempt to emulate the style of an earlier film such as John Ford's `The Searchers'. I think it is a very dumb movie.It was made in the 1970s and has no plot or characters at all. I am sorry, but that is all I can say.The main reason why I give this one three stars instead of four is because I find some of the acting ridiculous. There was nothing funny about this film.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat, but as the film progresses, the two boys have fewer scenes together. This slows the pace considerably. Billie "Buckwheat" Thomas gives a very strong performance in his early scenes. When he is left behind on the riverboat, his fear and abandonment are palpable and his tears are truly heartbreaking. When he goes from man to man asking for help and is repeatedly rejected the viewer really begins to wonder if this is a comedy or not. Watching a children's birthday party through a picket fence is another moving moment.

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen's death decided that they'd had enough and were going to go ahead and finish it off. I thought I had seen so many bad movies that I needed to find out more about them. Unfortunately, when I came upon this film a week or so ago, I was completely disappointed in it. The movie itself is not good. It's simply awful. The acting by the lead actors is terrible. There are many times where the audience can tell that these actors do not get along.

It 's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it 's either one thing or another. The premise is that the aliens are coming for Earth and the only people to stop them are Dr. Rorschach, who's been turned into a zombie (which isn't a good enough reason). In other words, the movie is based on a book by William Peter Blatty. However, there is not one character in the movie who ever appears in the book except for someone who has a cameo in the novel.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even remotely accurate would be saying the plot of this movie was a little boring, but then again it doesn't have anything to do with the main story line at all. If you want to understand why I'm so upset about this movie then I think you will find it by looking at the reviews for this DVD. That said I will give it 4 stars because I thought the script was good (although it wasn't).

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made , and by 'poorly' I mean "filmed on a $1,000 budget". The last time we saw it was in 1985. This time around there are only a few scenes of any relevance to the real story of this film, as far as I can recall. This movie should have been a masterpiece. Instead it is like an overworked, underpaid, underprivileged person who happens to be rich decides to turn their life around and make it work for everyone else.

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

Style over substance . But what a style it is . `` The Cell '' is the internal version of the TV series, and not to be confused with the film , which also uses the same name. This time, however, there is no good reason why such a show should exist at all; indeed, one has to wonder how this was even possible in the 1980's (or even now).The plot is that a group of young people who have never seen each other before meet for the first time and realize that they are not "friends".

Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that. I got all the tapes, DVD's and audiobooks and every time i watch/listen to them its brand new. The film. The film is a re run of certain episodes, Man and the hour, Enemy within the gates, Battle School and numerous others with a different edge. Introduction of a new General instead of Captain Square was a brilliant move - especially when he wouldn't cash the cheque (something that is rarely done now).It follows through the early years of getting equipment and uniforms, starting up and training.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film. It was when I was a teenager, I think (I'm 37 now). I started watching it as a late night movie sometime in the mid to early 80s, and so much of it has stayed with me ever since. Seeing other comments, I had NO idea it was shown at theatres, or that anyone else even new it existed. I don't think I've even mentioned the movie to anyone else.But half a lifetime later, I still remember much of the movie that I watched late at night so long ago.

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter's voice, there is that old familiar feeling of 70's blues. What an overwhelmingly beautiful and mature voice she had. Cynthia Gibb cast in the title role does a good job, however, I thought Karen Allen would have been a better choice. This is a tearjerker movie that does a fine job of presenting the professional careers of Karen and Richard but also the personal struggles that Karen dealt with and her disease. The recording sessions in Herp Albert's studio are very nicely done.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air ? I was not impressed by this film, I've seen some very good movies over the years, but this film wasn't one. The acting was terrible, and the story was a total mess.The movie starts off with the idea that these people have all become insane and are being held captive in a small island by a group of men known as "The Island" (we don't see them until the first 30 minutes of the movie, so they could have only been brought there by force).

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford's best in my opinion. No major stars, but Ben Johnson shines in most everything he appears, and here he gets a rare lead as the title character. Matching him is Ward Bond as the crusty Mormon elder leading his people west. John Ford's stock of character actors, including Harry Carey, Jr., Jane Darwell, Russell Simpson and Hank Worden, provide ample support, as does eerily silent James Arness, a member of the outlaw Clegg clan that joins up with the wagon train.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It really showed us all that we couldn't be anything other than what we truly were in the black community . That show made us realize how big of a world we live in and how important it is to support those who are working hard to bring about change . To know that there are many of us out there going through life who have no choice but to strive every day to better myself and my family.

Strange enough, shorts like this get a 10. Why? They are hilarious. This is hilarious. Notice a lot of the quirky humor. Dated and childish to toon naysayers, but they don't know what they're talking about. They got to know that cartoons aren't just for kids. The art in this is probabley the best non-Road Runner art of the 1950's Looney Tunes shorts. It's hard to come across something better than the art in "The Great Piggy Bank Robbery", although nothing ever will. This probabley runs a close 3rd or 2nd.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends, and this time around the main characters are different people and their relationship is much deeper. It works really well since it gives you a chance to feel for all the characters that have been involved in this case.The acting is good and there are some very nice moments but overall I am not sure if this movie is worth your money. If you're looking for an action movie, watch Lethal Weapon 3 instead.

Okay I marked this spoiler so don't be upset when I wrap this up. Now I went into the movie expecting to see a very predictable movie. And I was right, as almost every horror flick I have ever seen it was predictable but not as bad as most. What helped was the story, I did not expect there to be a "WHY" to Kane's madness. But there was and while somewhat foggy you still got the idea and understand the madness. Now of course if you like something that will scare you for nights to come this is not the movie your looking for.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen. To explain my experience, let me use this word picture: Imagine that you have been binging on pixie sticks and paint fumes for the last month while watching nothing but Twilight Zone reruns. The resulting coma lands you in a hospital, where the nurse seems to get a kick out of shooting adrenalin into your IV. The dream that you have while in the coma will be something like this movie.SUMMARY: A man shows up at the door of a couple. He gives them a box with a button on it.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance , women-on-the-verge psychodrama , work place sexual harassment , adultery , and fashion . However, I can see why many people may be disturbed by it. It was supposed to be funny. I laughed at a few of the lines in the film. A couple of things about the script: 1) In real life, there is no such thing as a man on the verge of murdering a woman. 2) All the women in this film are either fat, ugly, crazy or have some sort of mental condition that renders them incapable of giving a decent blow job.

King of Queens is comic genius. Kevin James, whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny, Leah Remini who plays Doug's wife Carrie is incredibly hot ( # 19 on Stuff magazine's hottest 102 woman list ), and very funny. The true magic of the show However is the scenes with Jerry Stiller, they are the funniest in the show. Jerry, a comic genius, plays Carrie's father, Arthur Spooner, whom lives in Doug and Carrie's always cold basement. I must admit that I never watched this show until this year, 2006.

I saw the Messiah:- The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I have seen, ever. It was one of those programmes that you think that oh, no, I cannot watch the rest of this but you feel compelled to watch it just to see who done it. Jamie Draven was an absolutely amazing actor in it, to be able to switch between two totally, totally different characters one of which is the evil, nasty person that did it and the other person who is Jez Clifton, the cop.

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in New York. It was actually one of the most important movies of the twentieth century due to its political impact. The main plot revolves around an American-born Russian who is captured and tortured by the Nazis during WW2. We are then given a synopsis about his life, which at the end has been altered. This movie could be great if the characters were likable and interesting. A lot of these people just don't seem to have any depth.

(My Synopsis) Rae (Christina Ricci) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) to fulfill her needs. Ronnie must report to his National Guard unit and leaves Rae all alone. Rae is not alone for long, because she is the town tramp with a powerful need to hook-up with a man. After a party, Rae is taken home by a friend who ends up beating her half to death and throws her on the side of the road. The next day, Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) finds Rae and carries her home.

Honestly, when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana, I did not expect much. I went to this movie only because I figured hey, it's a WWE movie it'll be good for a laugh. Then I sat down and watched it and saw why they chose Glen Jacobs (Kane) to play Jacob Goodnight. He is probably one of the freakiest guys on the big screen (much worse in my opinion than Freddy or Jason) and has one big advantage to other movies that attracts me to a horror movie.

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at all the same as what we've been accustomed to. Crawford's eyes are more open, she has an impassioned delivery, and her character is a bit more likeable. If you don't know about this movie yet, I want you to watch it again before you write a review. I recommend that you get into it while you still can. It is a masterpiece of American cinema from its very first appearance on the scene in 1932.

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice old lady who has been abused by her step-father in the past, tries to get some peace and reconciliation back.The problem here is there is not really any "resolution" for the relationship. We know that she loves her father very much, but does not have the same feelings for him as she had for her mother. I would have given this movie less than a 1 if it wasn't for the beautiful cinematography.

My favorite film this year . Great characters and plot , and the direction and editing was smooth , visually stunning. I had a bad experience watching this in Australia and I can't remember why. There are many people that complain that this is an "adventure film" and I don't believe it. It is a thriller at heart, but one that also has a strong psychological undertone. I've always been amazed at the amount of hype about these movies. I never understood why filmmakers spend so much money on marketing their movies and then turn around and do very little promotion.

A remarkable film , bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much , much younger. It brings back memories of the late 60's, but with a new twist. Myself, my family, and friends could not agree on what was right and what was wrong! The story of this movie is that a bunch of teenagers get together for a night of drinking and debauchery at an isolated cabin owned by a crazy old man named Jim (the only one in the movie who actually makes any real sense). The result is chaos and insanity.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows a small town couple who has their house burglarized. I know this is not the first movie made about a serial killer but its still an awful film. If you haven't seen one before don't waste your time, its nothing special. Every single character are annoying, there's nothing to care about. The acting is horrendous as it seems that they had no experience of working with other actors. This film also doesn't contain any plot whatsoever.

This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . If there was ever a movie that really needed more than 2 minutes to get started it's one of these.If you want to know how bad the script is you will find out when you watch the movie. "It's boring and pointless" - as an ex-policewoman once told me, before she threw herself under the bus! (I couldn't help but laugh at the fact)
First off, let me give some credit to the production company. There is no way I would be able to produce a movie like this on my own.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short. Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a pure emotional response to the script. Well acted, directed, shot and written. I was surprised to hear that there was no rehearsal before shooting, not even a read through. The performances stand as testament to some fine instinctual acting in response to a well written script. The actresses work was excellent and there was never an indication that their work would slip into the purely sentimental. Less is much better in this case.

`` Jaded '' takes on the complex question of abuse : the perpetrators and the victims . In lesser hands this movie might never have been allowed on television, because it is a far too long (and very confusing) movie to allow you to enjoy it. I saw this film at an open air theater near my home last weekend and was rather disappointed with how bad it was. I watched it for about 45 minutes and had no idea what the movie was about at all. I thought it sounded more like a children's story or a low budget horror movie.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

1981's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there. It's one of the finest-made slashers of the 80's and it easily blows movies like The Final Terror, Don't Go in the Woods, or The Prey out of the water.A group of young adults come to check out the mountain property that one of the group has just bought. However they are not alone in the wild. A hulking in-bred murderer, who seems to be in two places at once, is lurking and apparently hates trespassers.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin. There aren't much left when it arrives.
