Not of the train and not of some passengers.This is a black comedy directed by Peter Dalle and acted like they used to act in the 40s and also photographed (in b/w) like they used to during that period. The actors must have had lots of fun making it. They aren't much of characters, like they weren't in the 40s, but the story is well narrated and everybody has timing.A deadly black and deadly funny film.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen(mostly in English). In the earlier film she treated a contemporary political environment and its effect on individuals. In this film it is the impact of mentally disabled member of the family and its impact on the family. As a parallel sub theme she treats a philosophical concept on "reality". It is a film which leads to thinking after seeing the film.Mithee the younger sister (Konkana Sen Sharma, the daughter of Aparna Sen) is suffering from Schizophrenia being taken care of by the dominant elder sister Anjali (Shabana Azmi) .

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful. I liked the movie. Can anyone tell me how I can get hold of the songs from this movie? Even the soundtrack will do. If that's not possible, can I at least get the names of the songs with their respective singers? I tried to look up amazon.com but its not there. I tried CD baby, not there either. I browsed through Google to get some details but there weren't any. I would appreciate it if someone could give me the answer to my question.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made ..... Realistic . Movies were not candy for me back in those days.. I don't get why people are surprised that I am into such things. I have not seen this movie since I was 8 years old.... I saw it because my brother and I had some friends over and decided to watch this movie together..... It was about a family living in a small ranch house on the outskirts of town. The house has no telephone and no television, there is also no running water at the house.

I got this movie with my BBC `` Jane Austen Collection '' ( 5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations ) and I just couldn't believe that they had made this film. I bought this on DVD and it was NOT good. If you like Jane Austen, this is the best one you could buy for £6.99. The acting is not great. The music is horrible. The story sucks. The plot is totally stupid. The characters are all stupid.The story is completely unnecessary and the acting is very bad. It's a really bad movie if you want to get a sense of the author and the world.

I get really fed up with sitcoms ; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be a comedy or drama. I am very surprised that this movie doesn't get any nominations for best actor or actress...it was such a shock to me because I had been anticipating seeing this movie after watching the trailer at least 2 times before seeing it in cinemas. It looks like a great script and the cast are all very good, but I just can't see anyone being able to make a decent movie out of this kind of material.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class. The musicianship of this band is amazing and we should all be very thankful we live in a world where Rush exists. Future generations will never be able to see such mastery live and in person. Get this DVD and you will enjoy it throughly!! I was recently able to see these incredible musicians play in Houston, TX and was blown away. I have not missed a show since power windows and I have to say that they are better than ever.

As I was reading through the comments, I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was "not very profound." I have to disagreethis has to be one of the deepest and most thought-provoking films I've ever seen. Yes, the acting and the music were excellent; they have been praised over and over in the reviews. However, I also praise the heart of the movie. It resonates with deep meaning and feelingit is a story of redemption. It is about two very different and very flawed characters, beaten down by life but too strong to lie down and die.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts , unlike many other great Ford films , like the classic The Searchers . I was very disappointed by the movie. The director and his team obviously have too much time on their hands for something that has no redeeming characteristics at all. The only good aspect about The Wagonmaster lies in the fact that the film is full of memorable scenes, such as "The Hunchback", "The Mule" and more. It's just too bad that so many of them are completely forgettable. I thought this film would be fine.

It came before "the ten commandments" "land of the Pharaohs" "Ben Hur" and it's overlooked today.How unfair!Based on Mika Waltari's mammoth novel ,it doesn't cheapen it!Waltari's novel was so huge only a miniseries could have done it justice (I hope it will be done some day).Waltari,whose message is essentially Christian remains intact(another of his books "the secret of the kingdom" (first part) takes place after Christ's death in the Holy Land).

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland , and it wasn't bad. I think the only thing that made this film go from terrible to truly awful was a scene where a character goes into a restroom on her own and comes back out crying. Very disappointing. The movie starts out with a montage of all the bad parts of the '60s (such as John Wayne's divorce, the Vietnam War etc..) and then we see one of the worst things to happen to the world - nuclear winter.

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the show that aired last night and it was really good . I was so glad they had the original cast back for the new series and I am sure this one will be better than the worst . This is an old classic, but if you're in the market for a sitcom (especially for late night) or even just to get your brain moving after a long day's work, start at the beginning. The story has some interesting ideas here, but the writing is not quite up to snuff.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I was not a big fan of Robin Hood, or Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, but this movie was a lot different! It made fun of Robin Hood, and was HILARIOUS! I was extremely pleased with how well it was put together, and how well acted it was! Besides Home Alone, Mrs. Doubtfire, and Houseguest, this was the funniest move I've ever seen! I especially love the song; "We're Men in tights!"

Having just got the "Loony Tunes Golden Collection"(which i HIGHLY recommend, by the way), I'm going to try to comment on most if not all of the cartoons individually. As such the starting statement might seem redundant for those whom read multiple reviews of them, for this i apologize.Rabbit Seasoning is the middle short in a trilogy of like-minded shorts (the other two being "Rabbit Fire" and "Duck! Rabbit, Duck). Bags and Daffy argue about who Elmer Fudd should short. It makes me laugh EVERY SINGLE TIME!!!

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to find out the truth about Stan, but it backfires and he goes off the deep end. The only thing that really stands out from this episode is Cartman's fake mustache. He must have spent hours trying to replicate this look. Not exactly what I expected from one of the more "funny" shows on TV. The story line is very predictable. In a nutshell, Randy is kidnapped by an evil scientist who claims that his cure for cancer will cure everyone.

I too saw this movie when it first came out. I was a teenager at the time, and I saw it with my girl friend who later became my wife. I remember the movie made me feel it was possible to beat the odds. The cinematography was very well done if memory serves me correctly. The boy was a little much, but the girl character was very interesting. I thought it was very romantic and that might have been the intro to the first time with my then girlfriend. I have not seen the movie since and I wander why it has gone to the wayside.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . I loved Tombstone but I'm really torn on Unforgiven . I've always been a huge fan of Westerns. This one is definitely my fave. If you haven't had the chance to see it, then do yourself a favour and check it out, because it is well worth watching. John Wayne is the most overrated actor in Hollywood today. The guy doesn't have enough talent to even be cast in this role.

Awww, I love this! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon doesn't really need an synopsis, as that's what it is... the cat chasing the moon, to a Spanish poem. It's the artistry that's interesting. In fact, there was this animated short called the Fan and the Flower that was an Academy Award winner last year (2005)... yeah, almost same thing, which leads me to believe it might just be a rip off.But this is a really good short, with stark black & white shapes shifting and transitioning into beautiful motion and poetic seduction...

I'm not the type of person to watch T.V. shows because the acting normally sucks or it's unrealistic or TOO dramatic! But this show is perfect. Everyone can act, and you can relate to the characters and their situations. Everyone has their own personality and Lorelai Gilmore is the best for her sarcastic comments that can make any bad situation seem a little funny. Rory Gilmore is a good role model for all girls. She takes pride in wanting to attend Harvard and boys/boyfriends always come second in her book. She's a loyal friend and always the peace maker.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford's work. Mainly because it's the only one that is based on a story written by John Ford himself, the story that was elaborated by Frank Nugent and director's son  Patrick Ford and turned into a screenplay, and because of director's personal opinion regarding it, Wagon Master is the film John Ford called the one which `came closest to being what I had wanted to achieve', to say so is not to say a little, but as Ford confessed once to Lindsay Anderson, his favourite was nonetheless My Darling Clementine and not any other.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan , I really loved this film ( although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired ) but was extremely disappointed with the ending. This movie just doesn't work.The premise is very interesting and the screenplay is good. However, everything after the halfway point starts to unravel. Everything that should have been explored or explained at the beginning slowly fades off into nothingness until we get to the end and then it's gone.I was expecting more of the same from this movie. It looks nice on paper but what happened to those great cinematography and lighting?

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again (because I'd missed lots with all the laughing I did). I'm European and I've studied abroad and I've as good as lived with Spanish, french, Italian and German people. The film was full of stereotypes, which, more often than not, p*** people off, and reading some of the other reviews I see that it did p*** people off. But, this film gets the stereotypes so right I cannot fault it.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius, every character in it is perfect for their part, and they all do an absolutely excellent job in their parts. This is a good glimpse of what life was before & during the civil war, the difference between the wealthy, the average whites, and the black people. The story gives you some insights as to the real issues of the era, and the difficulties that were inherent in everyday living back in those days. The storyline is compelling, and the drama keeps your attention through the entire movie.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three Native Americans. But when the movie begins to move in the direction of the film's climax, it quickly loses its steam. This is not a great movie. It is one of those films that you want to watch from beginning to end but don't. This is because there is very little dialogue and the acting is pretty terrible. You are supposed to be impressed by the fact that a group of people with no respect for each other could come together to commit murder on their own accord.

I love this film (dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish, and entirely irrelevant name! ), I spent 8 months in Barcelona, not as an Erasmus student but living with other foreigners, so it felt just the same. It brings back so many great memories of the fun I had with all the friends I made from different countries, and of the city itself. I really want to see the followup 'Les Poupees Russes ' (the Russian Dolls), I'm guessing it wont be released here?

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . The film takes place during the Civil War. The movie starts out with an older man who decides to join the "Boys of Liberty" in their cause to defeat the Northern aggressors. He soon finds himself in a lot more trouble than he expected after discovering that his family is planning to flee to freedom. This leads to some very funny character development for young Henry Hill as he gets to know the old man better.

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another generic comedy. Fast forward to today, I just found out that it's actually not funny at all (not that there is any other way of showing what a terrible show it truly is), and for some weird reason, people keep turning around to watch it whenever it comes on. So if you're wondering where they've been since then, well, in the trash. This show is so stupid. Why would anybody even watch this garbage?

Ok, maybe Posse can't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies. But that's because it didn't have the FUNDING those movies had. Obviously, whenever you want to produce a story such as this one, focusing on African American historical involvement (and NO, servants and 'mammies' are not historical involvement), Hollywood isn't going to be too supportive. And believe me they weren't. The producers and actors sacrificed a lot of 'out of pocket' expenses to make "Posse", just so that the story could be told. I think that alone is commendable.

People need to give this show a chance. The people who write bad reviews (there are very few of them) are clearly people who haven't seen many episodes. One needs to really sit down and pay attention to this show to appreciate it. All of the characters are realistic because they have so many flaws. They make mistakes, but they are REALISTIC mistakes, which is an uncommon thing to see on television today. Also, for the most part the acting is superb. Lauren Graham has been snubbed of an Emmy for six years now.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

"Stripperella" is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones (voiced by Pamela Anderson) who lives a double life as a stripper at a gentleman's club known as "The Tender Loins" and as a sexy crime-fighter known as Stripperella, a.k.a. Agent 69 who works for a government organization. As Stripperella, Erotica fights crime and the forces of evil such as a plastic surgeon who gives women breast implants that either explode or make them fat and Cheapo, a criminal who steals from 99 cent stores and makes his two henchmen share a gun.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it 's rabbit season . But after the first few months, they're all gone and there's only one deer in town. Now what? I never understood why people loved this movie until I read a review by a guy on here who said he saw this movie yesterday and it ruined his weekend. The movie is pretty good and if you like Bugs Bunny and are looking for a good comedy then this might be something you'll like. It seems like the writers forgot to give Charlie Chaplin any credit.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since.The acting is good and the plot is believable. The main problem that I had with the film was the lack of direction. There were so many scenes that were pointless, confusing and uninteresting. As someone who has seen this movie at least a dozen times (probably more than that, I'm sure), I could not understand why people gave it 4 out of 10 stars. I've seen other movies which have scored as low as a 2 or 3 stars, but this was just plain awful.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager , not that it matters , and my parents sent it to our local video store on VHS with a promise that if they didn't give it away, it would be at our daughter's house. (I still think about that tape to this day .) Anyway , the movie itself has nothing to do with Christmas, and we don't need another excuse to make people feel guilty for enjoying something they weren't born to like.

this is a really great series . i love the show and i am so glad it is n't canceled by the tv channels.the only thing i can say with respect to the rest of the series is that this should be in high def, not low def like some of their other projects.my only complaint is that you can't get the subtitles on the DVD's. if anyone wants to help fix that problem they are more then welcome to send me a link to the subtitles for the episodes that you want translated. I'm sure they will do a good job of translating!

I saw "The Reader" at a film festival in Manhattan this week. It touched my heart in a way that few short films have done. In ten or so minutes, it tells a poignant two-character story that resonated deeply with me. Duncan Rogers has done a superb job capturing very real, tender moments on film. What I really admire about this film is that the director has chosen a story appropriate to the short format. These are genuinely interesting characters, and their story is told in the perfect length of time. This is no small feat.

` Skenbart ' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the likes of Joe Dante and John Candy as well. You will laugh your ass off at this flick. Dolores Haze has some very strong acting skills, but it's what she talks about that makes the movie so good! She's not afraid to say what needs to be said and in a very realistic way. As an audience, we can see what her real thoughts are and what she actually feels. That's a pretty impressive achievement for any actress.

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships , 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the viewer's mind to accept and even like everything that happens in it, this can get very frustrating. It has some of the better performances in recent years, but as a movie it falls pretty far short of greatness. This was my first foray into film criticism, so I don't know if I've written this review right or wrong. However, I should be commended for being aware of what I'm writing.

Ignore the bad reviews on here, this film is awesome! "Just Before Dawn" is a great example of what can be done in a film with a minimal budget if you have a dedicated crew, decent script, and a cool idea for a film. It's a hell of a lot of fun.I enjoyed it a lot more than most other 80's slashers because the killer is so unique. "Wrong Turn" ripped this movie off something fierce! There's plenty of blood and scares. My girlfriend was freaked out and she watches almost everything with me and doesn't flinch.

I 've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's been on sale for a long time now! I'm glad that my friend helped me out with this movie so we could enjoy it instead of going to see it, but I wish the DVD would be released as soon as possible.The movie begins with a man being abducted by an alien that turns him into an ape. This ape is able to have sex with men but does not allow any women to be affected.

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 10 stars, but then I would have to spend every waking hour and day watching it. There were several scenes in the movie that I thought were very cool (the scene where they go to see an old love for the first time after many years). But what was most disappointing about the whole movie is that all of them were completely unrealistic. For instance, when they're talking on the plane, the female pilot says things like: "How do we ever get back to Japan?"

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood years of this series, its coming to DVD was a blessing for all time. North and South truly is a series about friendship,love,honor... you name your own list of feelings you get from watching this series. I can still remember the first time I caught a glimpse of this series on TV when I was about 8 years old. I though wow this looks exciting. To bad I never had the chance to see book one and two on TV in the Netherlands.

There's a brand new killer on the loose, and he's doing God's work. Yeah right! This killer makes Jason Voorhes look like a chump, and Freddy Krueger look like a rag doll against this dude. He is Jacob Goodnight(WWE's Glen "KANE" Jacobs), a 7' monster who wields a Axe, and a hook and chain. Those weapons are nothing to him his real finisher is ripping out eyeballs from the victims sockets. That is totally methodical! When the encounter happened 4 years earlier, Jacob killed a rookie cop and maimed the veteran after putting a bullet in his head.

I 'm absolutely disgusted this movie is n't being sold . All who love this movie should email Disney and tell them to stop putting it out. I can not believe that people like this "film" and are willing to pay big bucks for it. The fact that it's being advertised by Disney in their own movies is just disgusting. They should be banned from advertising at Disney World!! I wish they would get sued or something. This film is simply atrocious. It's one of those movies that have a bad beginning, a bad ending and no redeeming quality.The story is nonsensical and ridiculous.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when this train arrives, and the passengers decide it would be a great idea to sleep in the trains car. But they also decide it would be a great idea to watch some movie on TV.. There is no reason for this film to have been filmed in 1946-47...it should have been set during the Nazi period (1939-45). In fact there was a film made that could have been shot during the Nazi era but it went unproduced.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

As I was reading through the comments , I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was so bad that I'm glad it wasn't a part of "the good movies" they made up. To me, that is the worst possible thing in the world. I had heard a lot about it but never bothered to see it myself. My first thought upon seeing this film was "oh god why do they keep putting out these crappy trashy movies?" The only reason for me checking it out was that I read the reviews and came across it on IMDb.

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own and I have a weak spot for crazy horror, slasher flicks and See No Evil happens to be exactly that and more!! I think that the biggest mistake made by producers and film makers of this film is that they hype it as a WWE film and "starring" KANE. WWE might have a big following but it's a very, very specific group that follow the incredibly cheesy and (sorry folks) kind of trailer park "sport" and those who don't love it HAATTTE IT!!

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George's relationship and also how they grew up. But I don't remember the plot very well. There was so much going on that the only thing that made sense was Orry's father who couldn't be involved in the situation he found himself in or his death. This was a pretty bad movie. A few things were interesting, but other than that it was boring. We have to keep reminding ourselves that most of these films aren't even good, but for whatever reason this one was terrible.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time. I believe that if you just watch one episode of the show you cannot judge in completely on that one episode, (this include the movie) You must at least watch a series of this show, get inside the characters, become familiar with there surroundings and the situations which they are in. When you become familiar with the show then it will start appealing to you. Now the movie has a few changes to the series which is slightly disappointing, but it still works.

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of the questions you guys may have. What was the inspiration? Why did they write this film? And if it was an inspired movie, were the actors acting that way in real life? This is an extremely poorly conceived film.The premise sounds good, the director says he wants something like that but what does that mean exactly? The plot seems to have been rushed into production without a solid concept. The acting is atrocious, from the lead actress to her co-stars to everyone else in the cast.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker. This is the only flick that I know of that Tarsem Singh has directed but boy was it intense. This movie was a total mind stimulant and one of the best special effects flick of this kind.The characters were vibrant and and nothing short of beings created in your own mind or nightmare. This movie is scary and interesting and totally bombs the senses with fear and exhilaration. This movie compares to no other I have seen except for the level of being beautifully odd. In that respect it is a fairly large step above `A Clockwork Orange.'

I shot this movie . I am very proud of the film . It was a great experience which shows me to my own self how hard it is to get something made anymore. Told in flashbacks, the story follows a young boy who discovers that he is the heir to a powerful family and his childhood friend dies in a tragic accident. He finds out from his wife that the death was a suicide attempt. When their daughter mysteriously disappears after a trip to see her father, they go on a search to track down the missing girl.

I like movies that show real people "Americans" and tell truth. The movie is simple and that seems to be the great thing about it. It played here in Norway fine (Amazon says above that it's USA/Canda but the box states "All Regions". I have to say it is not for the American viewers. It played in here in World Raw Views, a theater. I saw it and later I ordered it. The cut was different and much better. See it and you will like it or maybe hate it.

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series I have ever watched, and one of the most beautiful to boot. The only thing this series had going for it at all was a lousy plot that took place over a large geographical region. If you are one of those people who likes to sit around in a darkened room all day, waiting for the sky to light up, or the sun to shine on you, then you will probably enjoy this series.

Brilliant film! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats how it is with post pulp era. Many pictures get automatically likened to it for only being a gangster flick. But this one is well written, funny coincidences, ordinary gangsters who are family men, resemble something from Tarantino, which is a good similarity!Anyway the film's about a guy bloke in Australia which is getting mixed up with a hard- core crime gang, and ends up in a debt and deep s*it.

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own.I watched this movie last night and I was really looking forward to getting through the plot, however I found myself saying to myself 'you know what, you don't need to worry about a plot here. You are not watching a bad movie here'. In fact I can honestly say this movie was quite good and well written. The characters were funny, they didn't get along all that well and I had a very good time laughing out loud during the whole movie.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

I have n't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater , and I have been away from the medium for years. It is not my favorite of the Bollywood trilogy, but it was also not my least favorite of the three.This is probably the weakest link in that trilogy. The plot is very simplistic and lacks depth to any degree. There are some good characters and even though many are unappealing, I thought they were all interesting. What could possibly be the worst film ever made? I don't want to talk about what it is, I'd rather just see it.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story , Like someone you might have known . Just trying to be positive in a sad world. I didn't want to see it come across as "we're just another group of rich, arrogant spoiled kids from New York City who think they are better than us"
There are so many terrible things in this film. First of all, I have to say that the entire plot is completely uninspired. In fact, one of the main reasons I thought about giving this movie a zero was the horrible acting.

I just started watching The Show around July. I found it by mistake, I was channel surfing during a Vacation. It is a great show, I just wish it wasn't on so late at night. It's on at 12:30 AM. As a working person it makes it hard to watch all the time.I read some comments. I did not agree with the late one about not growing up in the 60's and not believing that this stuff can happen.I grew up in the 60's. I'm Hispanic and I had a "White" boyfriend plus we had black friends in High School.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar , which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything , and the movie was a disappointment . This film has some good characters in it, but the plot is so weak I had to leave. There are some really interesting moments of music in this film, however there were very few of them. For all the negative things people have said about this one, let's talk about the positives.The story is actually quite gripping. It started out promisingly, as we meet a group of misfits from New York City who go on a road trip through America.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with `` Valley of the Kings . '' These movies were quite possibly the two worst films ever made at the RKO studios, even though neither one was technically a "sequel." This is a poor attempt at making a western and if you don't believe me just ask yourself what the big bucks are for such a thing? I had high hopes of seeing a more original western, but it's obvious that the writer(s) of this were simply out to cash in.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of "Rawhide" Charles Marquis Warren. Direcxtor Gordon Douglas is its chief help in this regard. Its strong plot line can be told in a few sentences. A hard-nosed by-the- book, Cavalry officer, Captain Richard Lance, captures a leader of the Indian enemy after a massacre at a fort. He insists on bringing the man back for trial, to be sent toTucson; his commander sends another man to try to take the prisoner for trial and the patrol is wiped out.

North and South is a miniseries from the "golden age" of television miniseries in the 1980s, which was a time for long, sweeping epics with high production values and lots of star cameos. It is, for the most part, excellent for what it is, although I personally prefer the less soap-opera like elements of the story and the overall sense of history.James Read and Patrick Swayze deliver excellent performances--especially Read, whose George Hazard serves as kind of an emotional anchor in the midst of the often melodramatic story.

I ca n't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten . To be honest , I saw it when it was on sale at a big box retail store for $10. It had a good reputation in the early 1990s so I don't really care what people think about it since I am not from there. So let's jump right into it :-
The opening title sequence gives off the vibe of something that will never get past the basic concept stage, and by the second minute, you just can't tell what they were trying to do.

This film blew me away . I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot . After watching this film it was very clear to me that what they did there, and the people who were in it, didn't have any regard for human life at all. This movie has nothing going on but a lot of black people being mugged and shot. I'm not sure why anyone would waste their time seeing this movie. There isn't even a single bit of action or adventure. I don't think I'll see another movie like this again.

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her teenage daughter.The only problem is that it never got past the pilot stage . So what we get instead of a good show is a bad show . The acting is not great and there are some pretty bad jokes thrown in. I'm an old fan of this show but I've never watched it with kids or adults. My son recently watched with his friends who loved it so much he begged me to see it with them.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

This game is very good for the n64 . You can skate as Tony Hawk , Bob Burnquist , Steve McQueen and lots more .The gameplay is really good . I played it a month after it came out. One of the reasons I got this game has nothing to do with the storyline, but rather because it was the first "video game" from Activision. I am not so sure about the storyline, but the graphics were pretty good for a Nintendo 64 game at the time. This game does have some issues, the biggest being the camera in the background that moves left and right while you're skating.

I'm a fan of independent film. Dialogue driven, character study pieces are where it's at for me. Some of the other posts are right: "Wannabes" isn't going to rival "The Godfather" for best mob film ever. On the other hand, "Wannabes" is a well-written and well-directed picture that has surprisingly good performances from every actor/actress. My problem with one of the other reviews:- Conor Dubin stands out as the only Irishman in a cast of Italians- Dubin is a Jewish last name, and as such has a dark complexion, not a traditional ruddy one of an Irishman.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the "big, blockbuster" movies so that he could afford to make the "small" movies that he loved so well. Wagon Master, with a young Ben Johnson, is clearly one of his best, if not the best of his small movies. The location shooting, the wagons, the intricate work with horses, and the inclusion of the plains Indian are all trade marks of Ford. As in many of his other films, Eisenstein, the great Russian director's influence is seen in this film.

"Jaded" takes on the complex question of abuse: the perpetrators and the victims. In lesser hands it would have degenerated into an erotic thriller made for direct-to-video. This director, however, has managed to pull off a textured multi-layered study with a decidedly different point of view.Given the fact that the director/writer is a woman and the main detective and D.A. are also women, this could have turned into a very anti-male film. It is not. To be a sexual predator IS gender neutral. The nudity of this film is not erotic. The rape is brutal not sexual.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow . We do n't usually warm up to a series of movies until the very last one . I've noticed that after you've seen all 12 of these movies it takes about 3-4 hours to watch the last one . This movie got me thinking. Why was there not more sex scenes? Is it because of the storyline or is it because of the nudity? Or both? The sex scenes were great. They didn't seem overly sexual in any way . I thought they were really hot .

In the midst of a documentary about his parents , the filmmaker 's mother dies , but he continues making films. One such film is about a guy who moves back in with his father and has to deal with the fact that his step-mother is dead by the time he was born. The film doesn't go far, but does a good job of explaining why people make these mistakes. I am a die-hard fan of Robert Altman's career. He has managed to put together some of the most compelling and engaging movies of the past 35 years.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker . This is the only flick that I know of that makes you cringe at every second of it..It has a very weak beginning , which goes on for about 5-10 minutes. It then slows down enough for you to stop and appreciate what is taking place, but there is still a lot more to be seen. By the end you are so emotionally invested in the story, that you can't look away or watch anything else. The acting is pretty mediocre too...not bad, but nothing special either.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little so that I could give it a 4/10.The reason for this is that there seems to be a tendency among some viewers to write off any show they don't feel like watching as 'not worth watching' without looking into what's behind it. This is a very common phenomenon, often by people who just want to see something cool and exciting without making too much effort.I'll confess that I have watched this programme twice. In fact, I was only on the second time after reading the comments here.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of the documentary format for nearly a decade now. In his latest attempt at making a movie called, The Search for Everything, Herzog takes the audience along for the ride as they learn all about the life and work of famous German physicist Werner Heisenberg. What makes this movie so intriguing is the fact that there are literally no plotlines in the film whatsoever. It seems to have been largely created by Herzog himself. I just don't understand it.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger, and I really remember liking it. However, I didn't have great taste back then (not to say that I do now) so I can't vouch for my nine-year-old self too well. The movie was probably a 7/10 but it had some good music so I gave it an extra point. Yeah, worth watching. I know that some fans of this movie are wondering what a certain song is - the one that appears when she is in the car crash.
